69.The Wise Quran: A party of the people of the Book wish they could lead you astray, but they only lead themselves astray, and they do not perceive.

70.The Wise Quran: O people of the Book! Why do you disbelieve in the signs of God, while you witness?

71.The Wise Quran: O people of the Book! Why do you clothe the truth with falsehood and hide the truth while you know?

72.The Wise Quran: And a party of the people of the Book say, 'Believe in what was revealed to those who believe at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve it at its end, perhaps they will return;

73.The Wise Quran: And do not believe except for he who followed your religion.' Say, 'Indeed, the guidance is the guidance of God. That one is given the like of what was given to you or they dispute with you in the presence of your Lord.' Say: 'Indeed, grace is in the hand of God, He gives it to whom He wills; and God is immense, knowing.'

74.The Wise Quran: He specially favours with His mercy whom He wills; and God is the possessor of great grace.

75.The Wise Quran: And of the people of the Book is he who, if you entrust him with a weight of treasure, he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a dinar, he will not return it to you unless you keep standing over him. That is because they say, 'We owe no duty to the Gentiles;' and they tell a lie against God, while they know.

76.The Wise Quran: Nay, whoever fulfils his covenant and fears, then indeed, God loves those who fear.

77.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who sell God's covenant and their oaths for a little price, these have no share in the hereafter. And God will not speak to them, and will not look upon them on the Day of Resurrection, and will not purify them; and for them is painful punishment.

78.The Wise Quran: And indeed, among them surely is a party who distort the Book with their tongues, that you may think it is from the Book, but it is not from the Book. And they say, 'It is from God,' but it is not from God, and they tell a lie against God, while they know.

79.The Wise Quran: It is not for a mortal that God should give him the Book, and the wisdom, and the prophethood, then he should say to mankind: 'Be servants for me besides God.' But, 'Be rabbis for that you were teaching the Book and for that you were studying.'

80.The Wise Quran: And he does not order you to take the angels and the prophets for lords; shall he order you to disbelieve, after you are those who submit?

81.The Wise Quran: And when God took the covenant from the prophets 'Surely what I have given you of the Book and wisdom. Then shall come to you a messenger confirming that which is with you. You shall believe in him and you shall help him.' He said, 'Are you resolved and have you taken My covenant on that?' They said, 'We are resolved.' He said, 'Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses.'

82.The Wise Quran: But whoever turns away after that, then those, they are the disobedient.

83.The Wise Quran: So is it other than the religion of God they desire, and to Him submits whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they shall be returned.

84.The Wise Quran: Say, 'We believe in God, and what has been revealed to us, and what was revealed to Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the tribes and what was given to Moses, and Jesus, and the prophets from their Lord, - we make no distinction between any of them, - and we are those who submit to Him.'

85.The Wise Quran: And whoever seeks other than the submission for a religion, it shall not be accepted from him, and he shall, in the hereafter, be among the losers.

86.The Wise Quran: How shall God guide people who disbelieved after believing and bearing witness that the messenger is true, and the clear proofs had come to them? And God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

87.The Wise Quran: Those, their reward is that on them is the curse of God and of the angels and of men, all together,

88.The Wise Quran: In it dwelling forever. The punishment shall not be lightened for them, nor shall they be respited;

89.The Wise Quran: Except those who repented after that, and did right, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

90.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve after believing, then increase in disbelief, their repentance shall not be accepted; and those, they are those who err.

91.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die in disbelief, there shall not be accepted from any one of them the earth-full of gold, though he should give it as a ransom. For them is painful punishment, and they shall have no helpers.

92.The Wise Quran: You will not attain righteousness until you spend of what you love. And what thing you spend, then indeed, God knows of it.

93.The Wise Quran: All food was lawful to the children of Israel except what Israel made unlawful to himself before that the Torah was revealed. Say, 'So bring the Torah and recite it, if you are truthful.'

94.The Wise Quran: And whoever forges the lie against God after that, then those, they are the wrongdoers.

95.The Wise Quran: Say, 'God spoke truly, then follow the faith of Abraham, the upright. He was not of the idolaters.'

96.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the first House established for mankind was surely that at Bakkah, a blessing and a guidance to the worlds.

97.The Wise Quran: In it are clear signs, - Abraham's standing place, and whoever enters it is safe. And there is due to God from mankind a pilgrimage unto the House, whoever can find a way to it. And whoever disbelieves - then indeed, God is independent of the worlds.

98.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O people of the Book! Why do you disbelieve in God's signs, while God is witness of what you do?'

99.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O people of the Book! Why do you hinder him who believed from the way of God, seeking to make it crooked, while you are witnesses? And God is not heedless of what you do.'

100.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! If you obey a party of those who have been given the Book, they will turn you after your faith, to disbelievers.

101.The Wise Quran: And how can you disbelieve while to you are recited the signs of God, and among you is His messenger? And whoever takes tight hold of God, then surely he is guided to a straight way.

102.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Fear God as He should be feared, and definitely do not die except while you are those who submit.

103.The Wise Quran: And take tight hold of God's rope all together, and do not separate; and remember the favour of God upon you, when you were enemies and He made friendship between your hearts, and on the morrow you were, by His favour, brothers. You were on the edge of a pit of fire, but He rescued you from it. Thus does God make clear to you His signs; perhaps you may be guided;

104.The Wise Quran: And that there may be of you a nation who will call to the good, and bid what is reasonable and forbid what is wrong; and those - they are the prosperous.

105.The Wise Quran: And do not be like those who separated and disagreed after the clear proofs came to them; And those for them is great punishment,

106.The Wise Quran: On the day faces shall be whitened and faces shall be blackened. As for those whose faces are blackened, - 'Did you disbelieve after your faith, then taste the punishment because you disbelieved.'

107.The Wise Quran: But as for those whose faces are whitened, then in God's mercy, they shall dwell therein forever.

108.The Wise Quran: Those are the signs of God. We recite them to you in truth, and God does not desire injustice to the worlds.

109.The Wise Quran: God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and unto God affairs return.

110.The Wise Quran: You are the best of nations brought forth for mankind. You bid what is reasonable, and forbid what is wrong, and believe in God. And if the people of the Book had believed, surely it would have been better for them. There are believers among them, though most of them are disobedient.

111.The Wise Quran: They shall not harm you except a hurt; and if they fight you, they will turn to you the backs, then they shall not be helped.

112.The Wise Quran: They are smitten with abasement wherever they are found, except for a rope from God and a rope from men; and they returned with anger of God. They are smitten with poverty; that is because they disbelieved in God's signs, and slew the prophets without right. That is because they were rebellious and used to transgress.

113.The Wise Quran: They are not equal. Of the people of the Book there is a nation standing, reciting God's signs the hours of the night, and they prostrate.

114.The Wise Quran: They believe in God, and the Last Day, and bid what is reasonable, and forbid what is wrong, and hasten in good works; and these are among the righteous.

115.The Wise Quran: And what they do of good, they will not be denied it; and God knows those who fear.

116.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieved, their wealth will not avail them anything against God nor their children; and those are the fellows of the fire, they will dwell in it for ever.

117.The Wise Quran: The similitude of what they expend in this, the worldly life, is as the similitude of a wind wherein is a cold blast that falls upon the tillage of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it. And God has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.

118.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take as intimates others than you; they will not fail to ruin you; they wish you would have hardship, indeed, the hatred is shown from their mouths; and what their breasts conceal is greater. Certainly, We have made clear for you the signs, if you will become intelligent.

119.The Wise Quran: Lo! You are those who love them, and they love you not; and you believe in the Book, all of it. And when they meet you they say, 'We believe;' and when they are alone, they bite on the fingertips from rage. Say, 'Die in your rage. Indeed, God knows what the breasts own.'

120.The Wise Quran: If good touches you it grieves them, but if disaster strikes you they rejoice at it; and if you are patient and fear, their plot will not harm you anything. Indeed, God is surrounding what they do.

121.The Wise Quran: And when you set forth early from your people to settle for the believers a camp to fight; and God is hearing, knowing;

122.The Wise Quran: When two parties of you were on the point of showing cowardice; but God was their patron, and upon God the believers should rely.

123.The Wise Quran: And certainly God helped you at Badr while you were weak; so fear God, perhaps you may give thanks.

124.The Wise Quran: When you said to the believers, 'Does it not suffice you that your Lord assists you with three thousand of the angels sent down?

125.The Wise Quran: Yes, if you are patient and fear, and they come upon you suddenly, this your Lord will assist you with five thousand of the angels of mark.'

126.The Wise Quran: And God made it not except as glad tidings for you, and that with it your hearts may be at rest, and victory comes only from God, the Mighty, the Wise.

127.The Wise Quran: To cut off a part of those who disbelieve, or abase them, so they turn back disappointed.

128.The Wise Quran: Nothing is for you of the affair, whether He relents on them or punishes them; for indeed, they are wrongdoers.

129.The Wise Quran: God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and punishes whom He wills; and God is forgiving, compassionate.

130.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not devour usury doubly doubled, and fear God, perhaps you may be prosperous;

131.The Wise Quran: And fear the fire which is prepared for the disbelievers,

132.The Wise Quran: And obey God and the messenger, perhaps you may get mercy.

133.The Wise Quran: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord, and for a garden, the breadth of which is as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those who fear: -

134.The Wise Quran: Those who expend in ease and hardship, and those who repress their rage, and those who pardon men; God loves the good-doers.

135.The Wise Quran: And those who when they have done an immorality or wronged themselves, remember God, and ask forgiveness for their sins, - and who forgives sins but God? - and do not persist in what they did, while they know.

136.The Wise Quran: Those - their reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; and excellent is the reward of the workers.

137.The Wise Quran: Indeed incidents have passed before you so travel in the earth and see how was the end of those who denied.

138.The Wise Quran: This is a clear speech for mankind, and a guidance and a warning for those who fear.

139.The Wise Quran: And do not faint nor grieve, for you shall have the upperhand if you are believers.

140.The Wise Quran: If a wound touches you, a wound like it has touched the people; and those are the days which We make to alternate amongst mankind that God may know those who believe, and may take from you witnesses, and God does not love the wrongdoers;

141.The Wise Quran: And that God may assay those who believe, and blot out the disbelievers.

142.The Wise Quran: Or do you think that you will enter the Garden and God not know those of you who strove, and know the patient?

143.The Wise Quran: And certainly, you wished for death before you met it. So indeed you have seen it and you look.

144.The Wise Quran: Muhammad is not except a messenger; certainly messengers have passed away before him; what if he dies or is killed, will you turn back on your heels? And whoever turns back on his heels does no harm to God at all; and soon God will reward the thankful.

145.The Wise Quran: And it is not for a soul to die, except with God's permission written down for a determined time; and whoever wishes for the reward of the world - We will give him of it, and whoever wishes for the reward of the hereafter - We will give him of it, and soon We will reward the thankful.

146.The Wise Quran: And how many a prophet with him fought many rabbis. They did not faint at what befell them in God's way. Nor were they weak, nor did they demean themselves. And God loves the patient.

147.The Wise Quran: And their word was only to say, 'Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our extravagance in our affairs; and make firm our feet, and help us against the disbelieving people.'

148.The Wise Quran: So God gave them the reward of the world, and the good reward of the hereafter; and God loves the good-doers.

149.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! If you obey those who disbelieved, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will turn back losers.

150.The Wise Quran: Nay, God is your sovereign, and He is the best of helpers.

151.The Wise Quran: Soon We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve, because they associate with God that which He has sent down no authority. And their abode is the fire, and evil is the abode of the wrongdoers.

152.The Wise Quran: God has truly kept His promise to you, when you routed them with His permission, until when you showed cowardice, and quarrelled about the matter, and rebelled, after He had shown you what you love. Among you are those who love the world, and among you are those who love the hereafter. Then He turned you away from them to try you; and surely He has pardoned you, and God is possessor of grace upon the believers,

153.The Wise Quran: When you went up and looked not round upon anyone, and the messenger was calling you from your rear. So He rewarded you with grief upon grief that you not grieve over what has escaped you nor what befell you. And God is aware of what you do.

154.The Wise Quran: Then He sent down upon you after the grief safety, - drowsiness overcoming a party of you, and a party, certainly their souls made them anxious, thinking about God other than the truth, the thought of ignorance. They say, 'Is there anything for us of the affair?' Say, 'Indeed, the affair, all of it, is for God.' They hide in their souls what they do not show to you. They say, 'If there was for us anything of the affair, we would not have been killed here.' Say, 'If you were in your houses, surely those against whom slaughter was written down would have gone forth to their places of death;' that God may try what is in your breasts and assay what is in your hearts. And God knows what the breasts own.

155.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day when the two armies met, it was the devil who made them slip for some of that which they had earned. And surely God has pardoned them; indeed, God is forgiving, clement.

156.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brothers when they travelled in the earth or went out to fight, 'If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed,' so God makes that regret in their hearts. And God gives life and death; and God sees what you do.

157.The Wise Quran: And if you are killed in God's way or die, surely forgiveness from God and mercy are better than what they collect;

158.The Wise Quran: And if you die or are killed, surely to God you shall be assembled.

159.The Wise Quran: So by the mercy of God, you were gentle with them. And if you had broken up, harsh of the heart, surely they would have dispersed from around you. But pardon them, and ask forgiveness for them, and consult them in the affair, and when you have decided, then rely upon God. Indeed, God loves those who rely.

160.The Wise Quran: If God helps you, none can overcome you; but if He forsakes you, who then can help you after Him? And upon God let the believers rely.

161.The Wise Quran: And it is not for a prophet to cheat; and whoever cheats shall bring what he has cheated on the Day of Resurrection. Then shall each soul be paid in full what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged.

162.The Wise Quran: Is he who follows the pleasure of God, like he who returned with displeasure of God, whose abode is Hell? And evil is the destination.

163.The Wise Quran: They are in ranks with God; and God sees what they do.

164.The Wise Quran: God was surely gracious to the believers, when He sent amongst them a messenger from themselves, to recite to them His signs, and purify them, and teach them the Book and wisdom, and indeed, they were before surely in clear error.

165.The Wise Quran: Or when an accident befalls you, surely you have fallen on twice as much, you say, 'How is this?' Say, 'It is from yourselves. Indeed, God is powerful over everything.'

166.The Wise Quran: And what befell you the day the two armies met, was with God's permission; that He might know the believers,

167.The Wise Quran: And that He might know those who behaved hypocritically; for it was said to them, 'Come, fight in God's way, or repel;' they said, 'If we knew how to fight we would surely follow you.' They were that day nearer to disbelief than to faith. They say with their mouths what is not in their hearts, and God knows best what they hide.

168.The Wise Quran: Those who, while they sat, said of their brothers, 'If they had obeyed us they would not have been killed.' Say, 'Then avert death from yourselves, if you are truthful.'

169.The Wise Quran: And do not count those who are killed in the way of God as dead, Nay, they are living with their Lord; provided for,

170.The Wise Quran: Rejoicing in what God has given them of His grace, and being glad for those who have not joined them, those who are behind them; that there is no fear on them, and they will not grieve;

171.The Wise Quran: Glad at favour from God and grace, and that God does not waste the reward of the believers.

172.The Wise Quran: Those who responded to the call of God and of the messenger after the wound had befallen them. For those who do good among them and fear God, is a great reward.

173.The Wise Quran: Those to whom the people said, 'Indeed, the people have certainly gathered against you, so fear them.' But it increased them in faith, and they said, 'God is enough for us; and excellent is the trustee.'

174.The Wise Quran: So they returned with favour from God and grace; no evil touched them; and they followed the pleasure of God, and God is a possessor of great grace.

175.The Wise Quran: Only that the devil, he frightens his patrons. So do not fear them, and fear Me if you are believers.

176.The Wise Quran: And do not be grieved, by those who hasten in disbelief. Indeed, they cannot hurt God at all. God wills not to make for them a portion in the hereafter, and for them is a great punishment.

177.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief for faith, they do not hurt God at all, and for them is painful punishment.

178.The Wise Quran: And let not those who disbelieved think that We give respite to them is good for them; We only give respite to them that they may increase in sin. And for them is shameful punishment.

179.The Wise Quran: God was not to leave the believers upon what you are upon, until He distinguishes the bad from the good. And God was not to acquaint you with the unseen, but God chooses of His messengers whom He wills. So believe in God and His messengers. And if you believe and fear, then for you is a great reward.

180.The Wise Quran: And let not those who are niggard of what God has given them of His grace, count that it is best for them; - nay, it is worse for them. What they have been niggard of shall be a collar round their necks on the Day of Resurrection. And God's is the heritage of the heavens and the earth, and God is aware of what you do.

181.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly, God heard the speech of those who said, 'Indeed, God is needy and we are rich.' Soon We will write down what they said, and their killing the prophets without right, and We shall say, 'Taste the punishment of the burning!'

182.The Wise Quran: That is for what your hands have sent forth; and God is not unjust to the servants,

183.The Wise Quran: Those who say, 'Indeed, God has covenanted with us that we should not believe in a messenger until he gives us a sacrifice which fire devours.' Say, 'Certainly messengers before me came to you with the clear proofs and with the one you said; why then did you kill them, if you are truthful?'

184.The Wise Quran: And if they deny you, then certainly messengers before you were denied; they came with the clear proofs, and the scriptures, and the illuminating Book.

185.The Wise Quran: Every soul shall taste of death; and you shall only be paid in full your hire on the Day of Resurrection. Then whoever is removed from the fire and made to enter the Garden, then certainly, he is successful; the worldly life is not except the provision of deception.

186.The Wise Quran: You shall surely be tried in your wealth, and in yourselves, and surely you will definitely hear from those who were given the Book before you, and from those who associate partners with God, much harm. But if you are patient and fear, then indeed, that is of the determination of affairs.

187.The Wise Quran: And when God took a covenant from those who had been given the Book: 'You shall certainly make it clear to the people, and not conceal it.' But they threw it behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price - and evil is what they buy.

188.The Wise Quran: Do not think that those who rejoice in what they have produced, and love to be praised for what they have not done, so do not think that they are in safety from the punishment, and for them is painful punishment.

189.The Wise Quran: And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and God is powerful over everything.

190.The Wise Quran: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of the night and the day, are surely signs for possessors of understanding;

191.The Wise Quran: Those who remember God standing and sitting and on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth. 'Our Lord! You have not created this in vain. Glory be to you; So guard us from the punishment of the fire.

192.The Wise Quran: Our Lord! Indeed, whomever You have made to enter the fire, then surely you have disgraced him; and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

193.The Wise Quran: Our Lord! Indeed, we heard a caller calling to the faith, 'Believe in your Lord,' and we believe. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and cover from us our evil deeds and let us die with the righteous.

194.The Wise Quran: Our Lord! And give us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection; indeed, You do not break the promise.'

195.The Wise Quran: And their Lord answers them: 'Indeed, I waste not the works of a worker amongst you, male or female, - some of you are from some. So those who emigrated, and were driven out of their homes, and were harmed in My way, and fought and were killed, surely I will definitely cover from them their evil deeds, and surely I will definitely make them enter into gardens beneath which rivers flow.' A reward from God; and God, with Him is the best reward.

196.The Wise Quran: Let it not deceive you that those who disbelieve go to and fro in the cities.

197.The Wise Quran: A little enjoyment, then their abode is Hell; an evil bed.

198.The Wise Quran: But those who fear their Lord, for them are gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever, - an entertainment from God; and that which is with God is best for the righteous.

199.The Wise Quran: And indeed, of the people of the Book are some who believe in God, and in what has been revealed to you, and what has been revealed to them, humble to God, they do not exchange the signs of God for a little price. Those, for them is their reward with their Lord; indeed, God is swift in the reckoning.

200.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Be patient and vie in being patient, and be on the alert, and fear God, perhaps you may prosper.

1.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Fear your Lord, the one who created you from one soul, and from it created its mate, and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear God, in whose name you beg of one another, and the wombs; surely God watches over you.

2.The Wise Quran: And give unto the orphans their property, and do not give them the bad in exchange for the good, and do not devour their property to your property; surely that is a great sin.

3.The Wise Quran: But if you fear that you cannot do justice between orphans, then marry what seems good to you of women, two or three or four; and if you fear that you cannot be equitable then one, or what your right hands possess. That keeps you nearer to not being partial.

4.The Wise Quran: And give women their dowries freely; and if they are pleased to remit any of it of themselves, then devour it with good wholesome digestion.

5.The Wise Quran: And do not give to the fools your wealth which God has made standing for you; and provide for them in it, and clothe them, and say kind speech to them.

6.The Wise Quran: And test the orphans until when they reach a marriageable age, and if you perceive in them rectitude, then hand over to them their property, and do not consume it extravagantly and hastily that they will grow up. And whoever is rich, then let him abstain; and whoever is needy, then let him consume in reason, and when you hand over to them their property, then take witnesses on them; and God sufficed for a reckoner.

7.The Wise Quran: To the men a portion of what parents and nearer relatives leave, and to the women a portion of what parents and nearer relatives leave, whether it be little or much, a determined portion.

8.The Wise Quran: And when the relatives and the orphans and the poor are present at the division, then maintain them out of it, and say kind speech to them.

9.The Wise Quran: And let those fear who, if they left behind them weak offspring, would be afraid on their account, and let them fear God, and speak a straightforward speech.

10.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly, only devour into their bellies fire, and they shall broil in flames.

11.The Wise Quran: God instructs you concerning your children; to the male the like portion of two females, and if there are women above two, then for them two thirds of what he leaves; and if there is one, then to her a half; and to his parents to each one of the two the sixth of what he leaves, if he has a child; and if he has no child, and his parents inherit, then a third to his mother, and if he has brothers, then to his mother a sixth, after payment of the bequest he bequeaths or debt. Your parents and your children, you do not know which of them is nearer to you in usefulness: - an ordinance from God. Indeed, God is knowing, wise.

12.The Wise Quran: And for you half of what your wives leave, if they have no child; but if they have a child, then for you of what they leave a fourth, after payment of the bequests they bequeath or of their debts. And for them a fourth of what you leave, if you have no child; but if you have a child, then for them of what you leave an eighth, after payment of the bequest you bequeath and of your debts. If a man or a woman have no heir direct, but have a brother or a sister, then to each of the two a sixth; but if they are more numerous than that, then they share equally in a third, after payment of the bequest he bequeaths and of his debts, without prejudice, - an ordinance from God, and God is knowing, clement.

13.The Wise Quran: Those are God's limits, and whoever obeys God and His messenger, He will make him enter into gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; - and that is the great success.

14.The Wise Quran: And whoever rebels against God and His messenger, and transgresses His limits, He will make him enter into fire, therein dwelling forever; and for him is shameful punishment.

15.The Wise Quran: And those of your women who commit immorality, call witnesses against them, four from you; and if they bear witness, then keep the women in houses until death release them, or God makes for them a way.

16.The Wise Quran: And the two who commit it among you, then punish them both; then if they repent and do right, leave them alone, indeed, God is relenting, compassionate.

17.The Wise Quran: The relenting is only upon God for those who do evil in ignorance, then they repent soon after. Then those, God relents upon them. And God is knowing, wise.

18.The Wise Quran: And the relenting is not for those who do the evil deeds until when death becomes present before one of them, he says, 'Indeed, now I repent;' nor those who die while they are disbelievers. Those - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

19.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! It is not lawful for you to inherit women against their will; nor to hinder them, that you may go off with part of what you have given them, except that they commit manifest immorality; but associate with them in kindness, for if you are averse to them, it may be that you are averse to a thing, and God placed in it much good.

20.The Wise Quran: And if you wish to exchange one wife for another, and you have given one of them a great amount, then do not take from it anything. Would you take it for a calumny and a manifest crime?

21.The Wise Quran: And how can you take it when one of you has gone in unto the other, and they have taken from you a strong covenant?

22.The Wise Quran: And do not marry women your fathers married, - except bygones, - indeed it was an immorality and hateful, and an evil way.

23.The Wise Quran: Unlawful for you are your mothers, and your daughters, and your sisters, and your father's sisters and your mother's sisters, and your brother's daughters, and your sister's daughters, and your foster mothers, and your foster sisters, and your wives' mothers, and your step daughters who are under your protection, born of your women to whom you have gone in; but if you have not gone in unto them, then it is no crime in you; and the lawful spouses of your sons from your loins, and that you should have two sisters together - except bygones, - indeed, God is ever forgiving, compassionate;

24.The Wise Quran: And married women, except what your right hands possess, - God's Book against you. - But lawful for you is all besides this, for you to seek them with your wealth, marrying them and not fornicating; so what you enjoyed from them of it, then give them their hire as a lawful due; for there is no crime in you about what you agree between you after such lawful due, indeed, God is knowing, wise.

25.The Wise Quran: And whoever of you is not able to afford to marry free chaste women who believe, then take of what your right hands possess, of your maids who believe; - and God knows best about your faith. You come one from the other; then marry them with the permission of their people, and give them their hire in reason, they being chaste and not fornicating, and not taking lovers. And when they are married, if they commit immorality, then inflict upon them half the penalty for the free chaste women; that is for whoever of you fears wrong; and that you should have patience is better for you, and God is forgiving, compassionate.

26.The Wise Quran: God wishes to explain to you and to guide you into the ordinances of those who were before you, and to relent on you, and God is knowing, wise.

27.The Wise Quran: God wishes to relent on you, and those who follow their lusts wish that you should swerve with a mighty swerving.

28.The Wise Quran: God wishes to make it light for you, for man was created weak.

29.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not consume your wealth amongst yourselves with falsehood, unless it be a trade by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves; indeed, God is ever compassionate unto you.

30.The Wise Quran: And whoever does that in enmity and unjustly, then soon, We will broil him with fire; for that is easy with God.

31.The Wise Quran: If you avoid great sins from which you are forbidden, We will cover from you your evil deeds and make you enter with a noble entrance.

32.The Wise Quran: And do not wish for that by which God has favoured some of you over some. To the men a share of what they have earned, and to the women a share of what they have earned; and ask God for His grace, indeed, God knows all things.

33.The Wise Quran: And for all We have made heirs of what the parents and the nearer relatives leave, and those whom your right hands have made a covenant, so give them their share; indeed, God is witness over all things.

34.The Wise Quran: Men are in charge of women, because God has favoured some of them over some, and because they spend of their wealth; So righteous women are obedient, guarding in secret that which God has guarded. And those you fear may be rebellious admonish them and forsake them in the bed and strike them; then if they submit to you, then do not seek a way against them; indeed, God is high, great.

35.The Wise Quran: And if you fear a breach between the two, then send a judge from his people and a judge from her people. If they wish for reconciliation, God will arrange between them; indeed, God is knowing, aware.

36.The Wise Quran: And serve God, and do not associate anything with Him; and with the two parents be good, and with the relative, and the orphans, and the poor, and the neighbour who is a relative, and the neighbour who is a stranger, and the companion by the side, and the wayfarer, and what your right hands possess, indeed, God does not love him who is proud, boastful;

37.The Wise Quran: Who are miserly and bid men be miserly, and hide what God has given them of His grace; - And We have prepared for the disbelievers a shameful punishment.

38.The Wise Quran: And those who spend their wealth for appearance sake before men, and who believe not in God nor in the Last Day; - and whoever has the devil for his companion, then an evil companion has he.

39.The Wise Quran: What harm would it do them if they believed in God and the Last Day, and spent of what God has provided them? And God knows about them.

40.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God would not wrong by the weight of an atom; and if it is a good work, He will double it and give from Himself a great reward.

41.The Wise Quran: How then when We bring from every nation a witness, and bring you as a witness against these.

42.The Wise Quran: On that day those who disbelieved and rebelled against the messenger would wish that the earth were levelled with them; and they cannot hide the news from God.

43.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not approach prayer while you are drunk, until you know what you say; nor after a seminal emission, - unless you are passing by the way, - until you have washed yourselves. And if you are sick, or on a journey, or one of you come from the toilet, or if you have touched a woman, and you cannot find water, then use good surface sand and wipe your faces and your hands; indeed, God is pardoning, forgiving.

44.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those who have been given a portion of the Book? They buy error, and they wish that you may err from the way.

45.The Wise Quran: And God knows best your enemies, and God sufficed for a patron, and God sufficed for a helper.

46.The Wise Quran: Among those who became Jews, they alter the word from its proper meaning, and they say, 'We heard and we disobeyed' and 'Listen without hearing' and 'Observe us,' distorting with their tongues and slandering religion. If they had said: 'We heard and we obeyed' and 'Hear' and 'Regard us,' surely it would have been better for them, and most straight; but God has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except a few.

47.The Wise Quran: O you who have been given the Book! Believe in what we have revealed, confirming what is with you; before We efface faces and turn them on their backs, or curse them as we cursed the fellows of the Sabbath, and God's command is to be done.

48.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God does not forgive associating partners with Him, and He forgives what is besides that to whom He wills; and whoever associates partners with God, then surely he has devised a great sin.

49.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those who purify themselves? Nay, God purifies whom He wills, and they shall not be wronged the filament on a date-seed.

50.The Wise Quran: See how they devise against God a lie, and it sufficed for a clear sin.

51.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those to whom a portion of the Book has been given? They believe in idols and false deities, and they say for those who disbelieve, 'These are better guided in the way than those who believe.'

52.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones whom God has cursed, and whoever God has cursed, you will not find for him any helper.

53.The Wise Quran: Or have they a share in the kingdom? And then they will not give mankind the dent on a date-seed.

54.The Wise Quran: Or do they envy mankind for what God has given them of His grace? And certainly, We gave the family of Abraham the Book and the wisdom, and We gave them a great kingdom.

55.The Wise Quran: Then of them is he who believed in it, and of them is he who turned away from it. And Hell sufficed for a blaze.

56.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our signs, soon We will broil them with fire; whenever their skins are well done, We will change them for other skins, that they may taste the punishment. Indeed, God is mighty, wise.

57.The Wise Quran: And those who believe and do good works, We will make them enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever, for them therein are pure spouses, and We will make them enter into a shady shade.

58.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God commands you pay your trusts to their owners, and when you judge between mankind to judge with justice. Indeed, God, excellent is what He admonishes you with; indeed God is hearing, seeing.

59.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Obey God, and obey the messenger and those in authority amongst you; and if you quarrel about anything, refer it to God and the messenger, if you believe in God and the Last day; that is better and fairer as a settlement.

60.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those who claim that they believe in what has been revealed to you, and what was revealed before you; they wish to refer their judgment to idols, and surely they were commanded to disbelieve therein, and the devil desires to lead them astray - a far error.

61.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what God has sent down and to the messenger,' you see the hypocrites, they turn away from you, turning away.

62.The Wise Quran: How then when there befalls them a misfortune because of what their hands have sent forth? Then they will come to you, swearing by God, 'We meant nothing but good and concord.'

63.The Wise Quran: Those, God knows what is in their hearts. So turn away from them and admonish them, and speak to them penetrating words about themselves.

64.The Wise Quran: We have never sent a messenger except that he should be obeyed by the permission of God; and if they, when they have wronged themselves, come to you and ask pardon of God, and the messenger asks pardon for them, surely they will find God relenting, compassionate.

65.The Wise Quran: But no, by your Lord, they will not believe, until they have made you judge of what is in dispute between them, then find within themselves no straitness from what you decide, and submit with submission.

66.The Wise Quran: And if We had prescribed for them 'Kill yourselves' or 'Leave your homes,' they would not have done it, except a few of them; but if they had done what they are admonished, surely it would have been better for them, and stronger in firmness.

67.The Wise Quran: And then We would surely have brought them from Ourselves a great reward,

68.The Wise Quran: And surely We would have guided them unto a straight path.

69.The Wise Quran: And whoever obeys God and the messenger, then those are with those who God has favoured, of the prophets and the truthful and the martyrs and the righteous; - And excellent are those companions.

70.The Wise Quran: That is grace from God, and God sufficed for a knower.

71.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Take your precautions; then move forward in detachments, or move forward all together.

72.The Wise Quran: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind; and if a misfortune befalls you, he says, 'Verily, God has been gracious to me, since I am not a martyr with them.'

73.The Wise Quran: And if there befalls you grace from God, he would surely say - as though there were no friendship between you and him - 'O would that I had been with them, then I would have attained a great success!'

74.The Wise Quran: So let those fight in God's way who sell the worldly life for the hereafter; and whoever fights in God's way, and is killed or achieves victory - then soon We will give him a mighty reward.

75.The Wise Quran: And what ails you that you do not fight in God's way, and for the weak men and women and children, who say, 'Our Lord, bring us out of this town of oppressive people, and appoint for us from Yourself a patron and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?'

76.The Wise Quran: Those who believe fight in the way of God; and those who disbelieve fight in the way of idols; So fight against the patrons of the devil, Indeed, the devil's tricks are weak.

77.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those to whom it is said, 'Restrain your hands, and be steadfast in prayer and give alms;' and when it is prescribed for them to fight then a party of them fear mankind, as though it were the fear of God or a still stronger fear, and they say, 'Our Lord! Why have You prescribed for us to fight, could You not let us abide till our near appointed time?' Say, 'The enjoyment of the world is slight, and the hereafter is better for him who fears; and you shall not be wronged the filament on a date-seed.'

78.The Wise Quran: Wherever you are, death will overtake you, even if you are in lofty towers. And if a good thing befalls them, they say, 'This is from God,' but if a bad thing befalls them, they say, 'This is from you.' Say, 'It is all from God.' What ails these people? They can hardly understand a story.

79.The Wise Quran: What befalls you of good it is from God; and what befalls you of bad it is from yourself. And We have sent you to mankind as a messenger, and God sufficed for a witness.

80.The Wise Quran: Whoever obeys the messenger then surely he has obeyed God; and whoever turns away, then We have not sent you as a guardian over them.

81.The Wise Quran: They say, 'Obedience.' Then when they leave you, a company of them brood by night over other than that which you say; and God writes down that over which they brood. So turn from them and rely on God, and God sufficed for a trustee.

82.The Wise Quran: Do they not meditate on the Quran? If it were from other than God surely they would find in it many a discrepancy.

83.The Wise Quran: And when there comes to them a matter of security or fear they broadcast it; but if they were to report it to the messenger and to those in authority among them, surely those of them who are able to think out the matter would have known it. If it had not been for the grace of God on you and His mercy surely you would have followed the devil, except a few.

84.The Wise Quran: So fight in the way of God; do not task except your soul, and urge on the believers; it may be that God will restrain the violence of those who disbelieve, for God is more violent and more severe in deterrent punishment.

85.The Wise Quran: Whoever intercedes with a good intercession shall have a share of it; and whoever intercedes with an evil intercession shall have the like of it; and God is over all things a keeper.

86.The Wise Quran: And when you are greeted with a greeting, then greet with better than it, or return it; indeed, God is over all things a reckoner.

87.The Wise Quran: God, there is no god but He. He will surely gather you to the Day of Resurrection, there is no doubt in it; who is truer than God in discourse?

88.The Wise Quran: Why are you two parties about the hypocrites, when God has overturned them for what they earned? Do you wish to guide those whom God has led astray? And whoever God has led astray, you shall not find a path for him.

89.The Wise Quran: They wish that you should disbelieve as they disbelieve, so you would be alike; so do not take patrons from them until they emigrate in the way of God; and if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them, and take from them neither patron nor helper,

90.The Wise Quran: Except those who reach a people between whom and you is an alliance or who come to you while their breasts prevent them from fighting you or fighting their own people. And if God had pleased surely, He would have given them authority over you, and they would surely have fought you. But if they withdraw from you and do not fight you and offer you the peace, then God has given you no way against them.

91.The Wise Quran: You will find others desiring to be secure from you, and secure from their people; whenever they return to hostility they shall be overturned in it: So if they do not withdraw from you, nor offer you the peace, nor restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them. And those - We have made for you a clear authority against them.

92.The Wise Quran: It is not for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake; and whoever kills a believer by mistake then let him free a believing neck; and the blood-money must be paid to his family except what they remit as charity. But if he is from a people hostile to you and yet a believer, then let him free a believing neck. And if it is a people between whom and you there is an alliance, then let the blood-money be paid to his family, and let him free a believing neck; and whoever cannot find the means, then let him fast for two consecutive months - a repentance from God, And God is knowing, wise.

93.The Wise Quran: And whoever kills a believer purposely, then his reward is Hell, to dwell therein forever; and God will be wroth with him, and curse him, and prepare for him a mighty punishment.

94.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When you are journeying in the way of God, be discerning, and do not say to him who offers you a greeting, 'You are not a believer,' seeking the chance goods of the worldly life, for with God are many spoils. So were you before, then God was gracious to you, so be discerning; indeed, God is aware of what you do.

95.The Wise Quran: Not alike are those of the believers who sit at home without harm, and those who strive in God's way with their wealth and their persons. God has favoured those who strive with their wealth and their persons over those who sit, by many degrees, and to each has God promised good, but God has favoured those who strive for a mighty reward over those who sit, -

96.The Wise Quran: Degrees from him, and pardon and mercy, and God is forgiving, compassionate.

97.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those whom the angels cause to die while wronging themselves, they say, 'What state were you in? They say, 'We were weak in the earth;' They say, 'Was not the earth of God earth spacious so you could emigrate in it?' So those, their habitation is Hell, and it is an evil destination.

98.The Wise Quran: Except for the weak men, and women, and children, who could not devise a plan and were not guided to a way;

99.The Wise Quran: Then those, it may be God will pardon them, and God is pardoning, forgiving.

100.The Wise Quran: Whoever emigrates in the way of God shall find in the earth many places of refuge and abundance; and whoever goes out of his house an emigrant to God and His messenger, then death overtakes him, then certainly his reward is incumbent on God. And God is forgiving, compassionate.

101.The Wise Quran: And when you are journeying in the earth, it is no crime to you that you come short in prayer, if you fear that those who disbelieve may afflict you. Indeed, the disbelievers are your clear enemies.

102.The Wise Quran: And when you are among them, and stand up to pray with them, then let a party of them stand up with you, and let them take their weapons; and when they have prostrated, then let them go behind you, and let another party who have not yet prayed come and pray with you; and let them take their precautions and their weapons. Those who disbelieve wish that you should be careless of your weapons and your baggage, that they may attack you once for all. And it is no crime to you if you are annoyed with rain or are sick, that you lay down your weapons; but take your precautions, indeed, God has prepared for those who disbelieve a shameful punishment.

103.The Wise Quran: Then when you have fulfilled the prayer, then remember God standing and sitting and on your sides; and when you are in safety then be steadfast in prayer; indeed, prayer is for the believers prescribed, timed.

104.The Wise Quran: And do not be weak in pursuit of the people; if you feel pain, then indeed they feel pain as you feel pain; and you hope from God what they do not hope; and God is knowing, wise.

105.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have revealed to you the Book in truth that you may judge between mankind with what God has shown you; and do not be for the treacherous a disputant;

106.The Wise Quran: And seek God's forgiveness: indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

107.The Wise Quran: And do not argue for those who defraud themselves; indeed, God does not love he who is treacherous sinful.

108.The Wise Quran: They hide themselves from men; but they cannot hide themselves from God, for He is with them while they brood at night over speeches that do not please Him; and God encompasses what they do.

109.The Wise Quran: Here you are - these, you argued for them in the worldly life; but who will argue with God for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who shall be a trustee over them?

110.The Wise Quran: And whoever does evil or wrongs himself, then seeks God's forgiveness, he shall find God forgiving, compassionate;

111.The Wise Quran: And whoever commits a sin, he only commits it against himself, and God is knowing, wise.

112.The Wise Quran: And whoever commits a fault or a sin then throws it on the innocent, then surely, he has burdened himself with a slander and a manifest sin.

113.The Wise Quran: Were it not for God's grace upon you, and His mercy, a party of them would have tried to lead you astray; but they only lead themselves astray; they shall not hurt you in anything. And God has sent down upon you the Book and the wisdom, and taught you what you did not know. And God's grace is mighty on you.

114.The Wise Quran: There is no good in most of their secret discourse; except for him who bids charity, or kindness, or reconciliation between men; and whoever does this, seeking the pleasure of God, then soon We will give him a great reward.

115.The Wise Quran: And whoever splits from the messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers, We will turn him to what he turned away to; and We will broil him in Hell, and it is evil a destination.

116.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God does not forgive associating partners with Him, and He forgives what is besides that to whom He wills; and whoever associates partners with God, then surely he has erred a far error.

117.The Wise Quran: They do not call besides Him on anything but females; and they do not call on anything except a rebellious devil

118.The Wise Quran: Whom God has cursed. And he said, 'I will surely take from your servants a portion due to me;

119.The Wise Quran: And I will surely, definitely lead them astray; and I will surely, definitely stir up vain desires within them; and I will surely, definitely order them and they will surely, definitely crop the ears of cattle; and I will surely, definitely order them and they will surely, definitely alter God's creation; and whoever takes the devil for a patron besides God, then certainly he has lost - a clear loss.

120.The Wise Quran: He promises them and stirs up vain desires within them; and the devil promises them not except deception.

121.The Wise Quran: Those, their habitation is Hell; and they shall not find an escape from it.

122.The Wise Quran: And those who believed, and did good works, soon We will make them enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow, to dwell therein forever, God's promise in truth; and who is truer than God in speech?

123.The Wise Quran: Not for your wishful thinking, nor the wishful thinking of the people of the Book. Whoever does evil shall be recompensed with it, and shall not find for him besides God a patron, nor a helper.

124.The Wise Quran: And whoever does good works, - be it male or female, - and he is a believer, then those shall enter the Garden, and they shall not be wronged the dent on a date-seed.

125.The Wise Quran: And who has a better religion than he who submits his face to God, and does good, and follows the faith of Abraham, the upright? And God took Abraham as a friend.

126.The Wise Quran: And God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and God encompasses everything.

127.The Wise Quran: They ask you for a decision about women. Say: 'God decides for you about them, and what is recited to you in the Book concerning orphan women to whom you do not give what is prescribed for them - and you desire to marry them - and the weak among children, and that you stand for orphans with justice. And what you do of good, then indeed, God knows of it.

128.The Wise Quran: And if a woman fears from her husband perverseness or aversion, then it is no crime in them both that they make terms of peace between themselves - a reconciliation, and reconciliation is best. And the souls are prone to covetousness; and if you do good and fear, then indeed, God is aware of what you do.

129.The Wise Quran: You are not able, to act equitably between women, even though you are eager; but do not incline all the inclination and leave her like the suspended one; and if you reconcile and fear, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

130.The Wise Quran: And if they separate, God will enrich each from His abundance; And God is immense, wise.

131.The Wise Quran: God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. And surely, certainly We have instructed those who have been given the Book before you, and you that you fear God; and if you disbelieve, then indeed, God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and God is rich, praiseworthy.

132.The Wise Quran: And God's is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. And God sufficed for a trustee.

133.The Wise Quran: If He wills He can remove you, O mankind! And bring others; and God is powerful over that.

134.The Wise Quran: He who wishes for a reward in the world, then with God is the reward of the world and of the hereafter, and God is hearing, seeing.

135.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Be steadfast in justice, witnessing for God though it is against yourselves, or parents and nearer relatives, be it rich or needy, and God is more worthy of both of them. So do not follow lusts, so as to act partially; but if you swerve or turn aside, then indeed, God is aware of what you do.

136.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Believe in God and His messenger, and the Book which He revealed to His messenger, and the Book which He sent down before; and whoever disbelieves in God, and His angels, and His Books, and His messengers, and the Last Day, then surely he has erred a far error.

137.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believe, then disbelieve, then believe, then disbelieve, then increase in disbelief, God will never pardon them, nor will He guide them in the path.

138.The Wise Quran: Give to the hypocrites the glad tidings that for them is painful punishment.

139.The Wise Quran: Those who take the disbelievers for patrons rather than believers, do they seek honour from them? But indeed, honour is altogether God's.

140.The Wise Quran: And surely He has revealed to you in the Book, that when you hear the signs of God disbelieved in and mocked at, then do not sit with them until they plunge into vain discourse about a story other than it. Indeed, you then are like them. Indeed, God will gather the hypocrites and the disbelievers into Hell all together.

141.The Wise Quran: Those who lie in wait for you, and if the victory is yours from God, they say, 'Were we not with you?' And if the disbelievers have a chance they say, 'Did we not get the mastery over you, and defend you from the believers?' But God shall judge between you on the Day of Resurrection; and God will not give the disbelievers a way against believers.

142.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the hypocrites strive to deceive God, but He deceives them; and when they rise up to pray, they rise up lazily. They make a show to men, and they do not remember God, except a little;

143.The Wise Quran: Wavering between the two, neither to these nor to those. And whoever God leads astray, you will not find a way for him.

144.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take disbelievers for patrons instead of believers; do you wish to give God a clear warrant against you?

145.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the hypocrites are in the lowest depths of the fire, and you shall not find a helper for them.

146.The Wise Quran: Except those who repented and did right, and took tight hold of God, and were sincere in religion to God; then those are with the believers, and soon God will give to the believers a mighty reward.

147.The Wise Quran: Why should God punish you, if you are grateful and you believe? And God is grateful, knowing.

148.The Wise Quran: God does not love publicity of evil speech, unless one has been wronged; and God is hearing, knowing.

149.The Wise Quran: If you display good or hide it, or pardon evil, then indeed, God is pardoning, powerful.

150.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve in God and His messengers and desire to make a distinction between God and His messengers, and say, 'We believe in part and disbelieve in part,' and seek to choose a way in between;

151.The Wise Quran: Those in truth are the disbelievers, and We have prepared for the disbelievers a shameful punishment.

152.The Wise Quran: And those who believe in God and His messengers and do not make a distinction between any one of them, to these soon He will give them their reward; and God is forgiving, compassionate.

153.The Wise Quran: The people of the Book will ask you to bring down to them a book from heaven; but indeed, they asked Moses greater than that, for they said, 'Show us God plainly;' So the thunderbolt caught them in their injustice. Then they took the calf, after the clear proofs came to them; then We pardoned that and We gave Moses clear authority.

154.The Wise Quran: And We held over them the mountain at their covenant, and We said to them, 'Enter the gate prostrating;' and We said to them, 'Do not transgress in the Sabbath,' and We took from them a strong covenant.

155.The Wise Quran: Then for that they broke their covenant, and for their disbelief in God's signs, and for their killing the prophets without right, and for their saying, 'Our hearts are uncircumcised,' - nay, God has stamped on them their disbelief, So that they believe not, except a few, -

156.The Wise Quran: And for their disbelief, and for their saying against Mary a great slander,

157.The Wise Quran: And for their saying, 'Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of God.' And they did not kill him, and they did not crucify him, but a similitude was made for them. And indeed, those who disagreed concerning him are surely in doubt of it; they have no knowledge of it, except the following of conjecture. And they did not kill him, for sure.

158.The Wise Quran: Nay, God raised him up unto Himself; and God is mighty, wise.

159.The Wise Quran: And there shall not be one of the people of the Book but shall surely believe in him before his death; and on the Day of Resurrection he shall be a witness against them.

160.The Wise Quran: And for the wrongdoing of those who became Jews We have forbidden them good things which had been lawful for them, and for their hindering many from the way of God,

161.The Wise Quran: And for their taking usury when certainly they were forbidden it, and for their consuming the wealth of people with falsehood. And We have prepared for those of them who disbelieve a painful punishment.

162.The Wise Quran: But those amongst them who are firmly rooted in the knowledge, and the believers believe in what is revealed to you, and what was revealed before you and the steadfast in prayer, and the givers of alms, and the believers in God and the Last Day, - those, soon We will give them a great reward.

163.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have inspired you as We inspired Noah and the prophets after him, and as We inspired Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Tribes, and Jesus, and Job, and Jonah, and Aaron, and Solomon; and to David We gave the Psalms.

164.The Wise Quran: And messengers We have mentioned to you before and messengers We have not mentioned to you; - and Moses did God speak to, speaking;

165.The Wise Quran: Messengers giving glad tidings and warning, that mankind should have no argument against God, after the messengers; and God is mighty, wise.

166.The Wise Quran: But God bears witness to what He has revealed to you: He revealed it in His knowledge, and the angels bear witness; and God sufficed for a witness.

167.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of God, certainly they have erred, a far error.

168.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve and are unjust, God will not pardon them, nor will He guide them unto a road,

169.The Wise Quran: Except the road to Hell, to dwell therein forever; that is easy to God.

170.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Surely the messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord: so believe, it is better for you. But if you disbelieve, then indeed, God's is what is in the heavens and the earth, and God is knowing, wise.

171.The Wise Quran: O people of the Book! Do not exceed in your religion, or say about God except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, is only a messenger of God and His word, which He cast to Mary and a spirit from Him; so believe in God and His messenger, and do not say 'Three.' Cease! It is better for you. God is only one god, Glory be to Him that He should have a son. His is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth; and God sufficed for a trustee.

172.The Wise Quran: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of God, nor would the angels who are near; and whoever disdains His service and is proud, then He will gather them altogether to Himself.

173.The Wise Quran: But as for those who believe and do good works, then He will give them in full their reward and will give increase to them of His grace. And as for those who disdain and are proud, then He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they shall not find for them other than God a patron or a helper.

174.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Proof has come to you from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.

175.The Wise Quran: So as for those who believed in God, and took tight hold of Him, then soon He will make them enter into mercy from Him and grace; and He will guide them to Himself, a straight way.

176.The Wise Quran: They ask you for a decision; say, 'God gives you a decision concerning remote kinship.' If a man perishes and has no child, but has a sister, let her have half of what he leaves; and he shall be her heir, if she has no child. But if there are two sisters, let them both have two thirds of what he leaves; and if there are brothers and sisters, men and women, let the male have like the portion of two females. God makes clear to you, lest you go astray; and God knows all things.

1.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Fulfil contracts. Lawful for you is the beast of cattle, except what is here recited to you, not allowing you the chase while you are on pilgrimage; indeed, God judges what He wills.

2.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not profane God's waymarks, nor the sacred month, nor the offering, nor its neck garlands, nor those who sojourn at the Sacred House, seeking grace from their Lord and His pleasure. But when you have quit your pilgrim sanctity, then chase; and do not let hatred of a people that hindered you from the Sacred Mosque make you definitely sin that you transgress; and help one another in righteousness and piety, and do not help one another to sin and enmity; and fear God, indeed, God is severe in punishment.

3.The Wise Quran: Forbidden to you is that which dies of itself, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and that which is devoted to other than God, and the strangled and the knocked down, and that which falls down, and the gored, and what wild beasts have eaten - except what you slaughter in time - and what is sacrificed to idols, and dividing carcasses by arrows. That is disobedience. Today shall those who disbelieve in your religion despair; do not then fear them, but fear Me - Today I have perfected for you your religion, and I have fulfilled upon you My favour, and I am pleased for you to have the Submission for a religion. But whosoever is forced by hunger, not inclining to sin, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

4.The Wise Quran: They will ask you what is lawful for them? Say, 'Lawful for you are good things and what you have taught beasts of prey, training them like dogs; you teach them as God taught you; so eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of God over it, and fear God, indeed, God is swift in the reckoning.'

5.The Wise Quran: Lawful for you today are good things, and the food of those to whom the Book has been given is lawful for you, and your food is lawful for them: and chaste women of those who believe, and chaste women of those to whom the Book has been given before you, when you have given them their hire, living chastely and not fornicating, and not taking lovers. But whoever disbelieved in the faith, then surely his work is void, and he shall be in the hereafter, of those who lose.

6.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When you rise up to prayer, then wash your faces, and your hands as far as the elbows, and wipe your heads, and your feet to the ankles. And if you have had a seminal emission, then purify yourselves. And if you are sick, or on a journey, or if one of you comes from the toilet, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then take fine surface sand and wipe your faces and your hands with it. God does not desire to make any straitness on you; but He desires to purify you and to fulfil His favour upon you; perhaps you may give thanks.

7.The Wise Quran: And remember the favour of God upon you and His covenant which He bound you with when you said, 'We heard and We obeyed;' And fear God, indeed, God knows what the breasts own.

8.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Stand steadfast to God as witnesses with justice; and do not let hatred of a people make you definitely sin by not acting with equity. Act with equity, that is nearer to piety, and fear God; indeed, God is aware of what you do.

9.The Wise Quran: God has promised those who believed and did good works - for them is pardon and a mighty reward.

10.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieved and called Our signs lies, those are the fellows of Hell.

11.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Remember God's favour towards you, when a people intended to stretch their hands against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear God; and upon God let the believers rely.

12.The Wise Quran: And certainly God made a covenant with the children of Israel, and We raised up among them twelve chieftains; and God said, 'Indeed, I am with you, if you are steadfast in prayer, and give alms, and believe in My messengers, and assist them, and lend to God a good loan; surely I will definitely cover from you your evil deeds and surely I will definitely make you enter gardens beneath which rivers flow; and whoever disbelieves after that among you, then certainly, he has gone astray from the right direction of the way.

13.The Wise Quran: And because of their breaking their covenant, We cursed them, and We placed in their hearts hardness. They alter the word from its proper meaning, and they forgot a portion of what they were reminded of; and you will not cease to discover treachery amongst them, except a few of them; but pardon them and overlook; indeed, God loves the good-doers.

14.The Wise Quran: And from those who say, 'Indeed, we are Christians,' We took their covenant; but they have forgotten a portion of what they were reminded of; therefore We have incited amongst them enmity and hatred till the Day of Resurrection; and soon God will inform them of what they used to do.

15.The Wise Quran: O people of the Book! Surely Our messenger has come to you to explain to you much of what you had hidden of the Book, and to pardon much. Surely there has come to you from God a light, and a clear Book;

16.The Wise Quran: God guides with it those who follow His pleasure to the way of peace, and brings them out of the darkness into the light with His permission, and guides them to a straight path.

17.The Wise Quran: Certainly they disbelieve who say, 'Indeed, God is the Messiah, the son of Mary;' say, 'Then who has any hold on God, if He wished to destroy the Messiah, the son of Mary, and his mother, and those who are on earth altogether?' And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between both of them; He creates what He wills, And God is powerful over everything.

18.The Wise Quran: And the Jews and the Christians say, 'We are the sons of God and His beloved.' Say, 'Why then does He punish you for your sins? Nay, you are mortals among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and punishes whom He wills; And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and what is between both of them, and to Him is the destination.

19.The Wise Quran: O people of the Book! Surely Our messenger has come to you, explaining to you the interval of messengers; lest you say, 'There came not to us a herald of glad tidings nor a warner.' But surely there has come to you now a herald of glad tidings and a warner, and God is powerful over everything.

20.The Wise Quran: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people! Remember the favour of God upon you when He made amongst you prophets, and made you kings, and brought you what never was brought to anybody in the worlds.

21.The Wise Quran: O my people! Enter the Holy land which God has prescribed for you; and do not turn in flight, and retreat losers.'

22.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O Moses! Indeed, in it is a people, tyrants; and we will surely not enter it until they go out from it; but if they go out from it then certainly we will enter.'

23.The Wise Quran: Then said two men of those who fear, - God had been gracious to them both, - 'Enter upon them by the door, and when you have entered it, then indeed, you shall be victorious; and upon God rely, if you are believers.'

24.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O Moses! Indeed, we shall never enter it so long as they are in it; so go you and your Lord and fight; indeed, we will sit down here.'

25.The Wise Quran: He said, 'My Lord, indeed, I can control only myself and my brother; therefore part us from the disobedient people.'

26.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Then indeed, it is forbidden them; for forty years shall they wander about in the earth; so do not grieve for the disobedient people.'

27.The Wise Quran: And recite to them the story of two sons of Adam; in truth when they both offered a sacrifice and it was accepted from one of them, and was not accepted from the other, He said, 'I will surely kill you;'

28.The Wise Quran: He said, 'God only accepts from those who fear. If you stretch out to me your hand to kill me, I will not stretch out my hand to kill you; indeed I fear God the Lord of the worlds;

29.The Wise Quran: Indeed, I desire that you return with my sin and your sin, then you will be among the fellows of the fire, and that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.'

30.The Wise Quran: But his soul allowed him to slay his brother, and he slew him, and became of the losers.

31.The Wise Quran: And God sent a crow to scratch in the earth to show him how he might hide his brother's shame, he said, 'O woe unto me! Am I unable to become like this crow and hide my brother's shame?' And he became of those who repented.

32.The Wise Quran: For that cause We have prescribed to the children of Israel that whoever kills a soul, unless it be for another soul or for violence in the land, then it is as though he had killed mankind altogether; but whoever saves one, it is as though he saved mankind altogether. And surely Our messengers came to them with the clear proofs; then, indeed, many of them after that are surely those who commit excesses in the earth.

33.The Wise Quran: The reward of those who make war against God and His messenger and strive in the earth working corruption is that they be killed or crucified or their hands cut off and their feet on alternate sides or that they shall be banished from the land; that is the disgrace for them in the world, and for them in the hereafter is a great punishment;

34.The Wise Quran: Except those who repented before you have them in your power, then know that God is forgiving, compassionate.

35.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Fear God and seek the means to approach Him, and strive in His way, perhaps you will prosper.

36.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve, even though they had what is in the earth, all of it, and the like of it with it, to offer as a ransom from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them; but for them is painful punishment.

37.The Wise Quran: They may wish to go out from the fire, but they shall not go out from it, and for them is lasting punishment.

38.The Wise Quran: The man thief and the woman thief, then cut off their hands, a recompense for what they earned; a deterrent punishment from God, and God is mighty, wise.

39.The Wise Quran: Then he who repented after his wrongdoing and did right, then indeed, God will relent on him, indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

40.The Wise Quran: Do you not know that God, His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills, and forgives whom He wills; and God is powerful over everything.

41.The Wise Quran: O messenger! Let not those grieve you who hasten in disbelief; of those who say with their mouths 'We believe,' But their hearts do not believe; and of those who became Jews, listeners to a lie, - listeners to other people, but who do not come to you. They alter the word from some of its proper meaning, they say, 'If this is what you are given, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware.' but he whom God wishes to mislead, you can do nothing with God for him; those are the ones whose hearts God wishes not to purify, for them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the hereafter is great punishment, -

42.The Wise Quran: Listeners to a lie, eaters of unlawful things. But if they come to you, then judge between them or turn away from them; and if you turn away from them they shall not harm you at all, but if you judge, then judge between them with justice, indeed God loves the just.

43.The Wise Quran: But how should they make you their judge, when they have the Torah, in it is God's judgment? Then they turn away after that; but those are not believers.

44.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have revealed the Torah, in it is guidance and light; the prophets, those who had submitted, judge with it those who became Jews, as did the rabbis, and the scholars by that which they were entrusted of the Book of God, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear mankind, but fear Me, and do not sell My signs for a little price; and whoever will not judge by what God has revealed, then those, they are the disbelievers.

45.The Wise Quran: We have prescribed for you therein: 'The life for the life, and the eye for the eye, and the nose for the nose, and the ear for the ear, and the tooth for the tooth, and for wounds retaliation.' But whoever gives charity with it, then it is an expiation for him, but whoever will not judge by what God has revealed, then those, they are the wrongdoers.

46.The Wise Quran: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming what was before him of the Torah, and We brought him the Gospel, in it is guidance and light, and verifying what was before it of the Torah, and a guidance and an admonition unto those who fear.

47.The Wise Quran: And let the people of the Gospel judge by that which is revealed in it, And whoever will not judge by what God has revealed, then those, they are the disobedient.

48.The Wise Quran: And We have revealed to you the Book in truth verifying what was before it of the Book and a protector over it; judge then between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their lusts, turning away from what is given to you of the truth.
