For each one of you have We made a Law and a pathway: and had God pleased He would have made you one nation, but He will surely try you concerning that which He has brought you. So race to the good works; to God is your return altogether, and He will inform you of that concerning which you were disagreeing.

49.The Wise Quran: And judge between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their lusts; and beware of them lest they mislead you from part of what God has revealed to you; yet if they turn away, then know that God only wishes to fall on them for some of their sins, and indeed, many of mankind are surely disobedient.

50.The Wise Quran: Is it the judgment of ignorance they seek? And who is better than God to judge people who are sure?

51.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take the Jews and the Christians for your patrons: some of them are patrons of some; and whoever amongst you takes them for patrons, then indeed, he is of them, indeed, God does not guide the unjust people.

52.The Wise Quran: You will see those in whose heart is a sickness hastening in them; they say, 'We fear lest there befall us a change of fortune.' But perhaps God will give the victory, or a command from Him, and they may awake repenting of what they thought in secret to themselves.

53.The Wise Quran: Those who believe will say, 'Are these those who swore with God the utmost of their oaths, indeed they are surely with you?' Their works were voided, then they became losers.

54.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Whoever of you turns away from his religion, then soon God will come with a people - He loves them and they love Him, humble to the believers, mighty to the disbelievers, they strive in the way of God, and they do not fear the blame of him who blames. That is God's grace. He gives it unto whom He wills, and God is immense, knowing.

55.The Wise Quran: God only is your patron, and His messenger and those who believe and those who they are steadfast in the prayer and they give the alms and they bow down.

56.The Wise Quran: And whoever takes as patrons God and His messenger and those who believe; then indeed, God's crew, they are the victorious.

57.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take for patrons those who take your religion for jest and play amongst those who have been given the Book before and the disbelievers; but fear God if you are believers.

58.The Wise Quran: And when you call to the prayer, they take it for a jest and a sport; that is because they are a people who are not intelligent.

59.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O people of the Book! Do you take vengeance on us except that we believe in God, and what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down before, and because most of you are disobedient?'

60.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Shall I tell you of a recompense with God, worse than that? Whomsoever God has cursed, and with whom He is wroth, and He has made of them apes and swine, and who worship idols, those are in a worse plight and are more astray from the right direction of the way.

61.The Wise Quran: And when they come to you they say, 'We believe;' but certainly they entered in with disbelief, and they certainly went out with it, and God knows best what they were hiding.

62.The Wise Quran: You will see many of them hastening in sin and enmity, and in eating unlawful things, surely evil is what they have done.

63.The Wise Quran: Why do the rabbis and the scholars not forbid them from saying what is sinful and eating what is unlawful? Surely evil is what they have performed.

64.The Wise Quran: The Jews say, 'God's hand is fettered;' their hands are fettered and they are cursed for what they said. Nay, His hands are outspread, He expends how He wills. And that which has been sent down to you from your Lord will surely, definitely increase many of them in immoderation and disbelief. And we have cast amongst them enmity and hatred till the Day of Resurrection. Whenever they kindled a fire for war, God extinguished it; and they strive for corruption in the earth, but God does not love the corrupt.

65.The Wise Quran: And if the people of the Book had believed and feared, surely We would have covered from them their evil deeds and surely We would have made them enter the Gardens of pleasure;

66.The Wise Quran: And were they steadfast in the Torah and the Gospel, and what has been sent down to them from their Lord, surely they should eat from above them and below them. Amongst them are a nation who are moderate, and many of them evil is what they do.

67.The Wise Quran: O messenger! Convey what has been revealed to you from your Lord; if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And God will protect you from mankind; indeed God does not guide the people who disbelieve.

68.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O people of the Book! You rest on nothing until you stand fast by the Torah and the Gospel, and what is revealed to you from your Lord.' And what has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely, definitely increase many of them in immoderation and disbelief, so do not grieve for the people who disbelieve.

69.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believed and those who became Jews, and the Sabaeans, and the Christians who believed in God and the Last Day and did good works, then no fear for them and they will not grieve.

70.The Wise Quran: Certainly We took a covenant from the children of Israel and We sent to them messengers; everytime there came to them a messenger with what their souls loved not, a part of them they called liars and a part of them they slew.

71.The Wise Quran: And they reckoned that there would be no trial; and they were blind and deaf. Then God relented on them; then many amongst them were blind and deaf. But God saw what they did.

72.The Wise Quran: Certainly they disbelieve who say, 'Indeed, God is the Messiah, the son of Mary;' But the Messiah said, 'O children of Israel! Worship God, my Lord and your Lord.' Indeed he who associates anything with God, then surely God has forbidden him the Garden, and his abode is the fire, and there are no helpers for the wrongdoers.

73.The Wise Quran: Certainly they disbelieve who say, 'Indeed, God is the third of three.' For there is no god but one god, and if they do not desist from what they say, surely there shall definitely touch those who disbelieve amongst them painful punishment.

74.The Wise Quran: Will they not repent to God and seek His forgiveness? And God is forgiving, compassionate.

75.The Wise Quran: The Messiah, the son of Mary is only a messenger; certainly messengers before him have passed away; and his mother was truthful; they both used to eat food. See how we make clear for them the signs, then see, how are they turned away?

76.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Will you serve, other than God, what can neither hurt you nor profit you?' And God, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

77.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O people of the Book! Do not exceed the truth in your religion, and do not follow the lusts of a people who have erred before, and who lead many astray, and who have gone astray from the right direction of the way.'

78.The Wise Quran: Those of the children of Israel who disbelieved were cursed by the tongue of David and Jesus, the son of Mary; that is because they rebelled and were transgressing;

79.The Wise Quran: They would not desist from the wrong they did; surely evil is what they used to do.

80.The Wise Quran: You will see many of them taking those who disbelieved for patrons; surely, evil what their souls have sent forward for them, that God is displeased with them, and in the punishment they will dwell forever.

81.The Wise Quran: But had they believed in God and the prophet, and what was revealed to him, they had not taken them for patrons; but many of them are disobedient.

82.The Wise Quran: Surely you will definitely find the strongest of mankind in enmity against those who believe are the Jews and the idolaters; and surely you will definitely find the nearest of them in love to those who believe to be those who say, 'Indeed, we are Christians;' that is for that amongst them are priests and monks and that they are not proud.

83.The Wise Quran: And when they hear what has been revealed to the messenger you will see their eyes gush with tears at what they recognise as the truth; they will say, 'Our Lord! We believe, so write us down amongst the witnesses.

84.The Wise Quran: And why should we not believe in God and the truth that is given to us, nor desire that our Lord should make us enter with the upright people?'

85.The Wise Quran: So God rewarded them, for what they said, with gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein forever; and that is the reward of those who do good;

86.The Wise Quran: But those who disbelieve and say Our signs are lies, they are the fellows of Hell.

87.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not forbid the good things which God has made lawful for you, nor transgress; indeed, God does not love the transgressors.

88.The Wise Quran: But eat of what God has provided you lawful and good; and fear God, the one in whom you are believers.

89.The Wise Quran: God will not chastise you for idle speech in your oaths, but He will chastise you for the oaths which you swear in earnest; and the expiation is to feed ten poor people with the average of that wherewith you feed your families, or to clothe them, or to free a neck; but whoever does not have the means, then let him fast three days. That is the expiation of your oaths, when you have sworn. But keep your oaths. Thus God makes clear for you His signs, perhaps you may be grateful.

90.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Indeed, strong drink and games of chance and idols and divining-arrows are an uncleanness of the devil's work; avoid them then that perhaps you may prosper.

91.The Wise Quran: The devil only desires to place enmity and hatred between you by strong drink and games of chance, and to hinder you from the remembrance of God and from the prayer; so will you not desist?

92.The Wise Quran: And obey God, and obey the messenger, and beware, and if you turn away then know only upon Our messenger is the clear communication.

93.The Wise Quran: There is no crime in those who believe and do good works, for what they ate when they fear God, and believe, and do good works, then they fear and believe, then they fear, and do good, and God loves those who do good.

94.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Surely, definitely God will try you with something of the game that your hands and your lances take, that God may know who fears Him in the unseen; whoever transgresses after that, then for him is painful punishment.

95.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not kill game while you are on pilgrimage. But whoever amongst you who kills it purposely, then his compensation is the like of that which he has killed in cattle - of which two men of equity amongst you shall be judge - an offering reaching the Kaabah; or an expiation, the food of poor persons, or an equivalent thereof in fasting, that he may taste the evil result of his deed. God pardons bygones; but whoever returns, then God will take vengeance on him. And God is mighty, owner of retribution.

96.The Wise Quran: Lawful for you is the game of the sea, and to eat thereof; a provision for you and for the travellers; but forbidden you is the game of land while you are on pilgrimage; And fear God to whom you shall be gathered.

97.The Wise Quran: God has made the Kaabah, the Sacred House, to be a station for mankind, and the sacred months, and the offering and the neck garlands; that is so that you may know that God knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and that God knows all things.

98.The Wise Quran: Know that God is severe in punishment, and that God is forgiving, compassionate.

99.The Wise Quran: Nothing is upon the messenger except the communication, and God knows what you show and what you hide.

100.The Wise Quran: Say, 'The bad and the good are not equal, though the abundance of the bad please you.' So fear God, O possessors of understanding! Perhaps you may prosper.'

101.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not ask about things which if they are shown to you will pain you; but if you ask about them when the Quran is revealed, they shall be shown to you. God has pardoned it, and God is forgiving, clement.

102.The Wise Quran: Indeed, a people before you asked them, then they became disbelievers therein.

103.The Wise Quran: And God has not ordained any Bahirah nor Saibah, nor Wasilah nor Hami, but those who disbelieve invent the lie against God, and most of them are not intelligent.

104.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what God has revealed, and to the messenger,' they say, 'Enough for us is what we found our fathers agreed upon.' Though their fathers knew nothing and they were not guided?

105.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Upon you are your souls; he who has erred will not hurt you when you are guided. To God is your return altogether, and He will inform you of what you used to do.

106.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Let there be a testimony between you when any one of you is on the point of death - at the time he makes his will - two men of equity among you; or two others from other than you, if you are journeying in the land, and the calamity of death befalls you; you shall detain both of them after the prayer, and they shall both swear by God, if you doubt them, 'We will not sell it for a price, though it were to a relative, nor will we hide God's testimony, indeed, then we would surely be among the sinners.'

107.The Wise Quran: But if it is discovered that both of them have merited the accusation of sin, then two others shall stand in their place, these being the nearest of those most concerned, and they shall swear by God, 'Surely our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed, indeed then we would be among the evildoers.'

108.The Wise Quran: That is more likely that they will bear testimony in proper form, or else they will be afraid that after their oaths, oaths may be rebutted. But fear God and listen, and God does not guide the disobedient people.

109.The Wise Quran: The day God shall assemble the messengers and shall say, 'What answer were you given?' They shall say, 'We have no knowledge; indeed, You are the knower of the unseen.'

110.The Wise Quran: When God said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary! Remember my favour upon you and upon your mother, when I strengthened you with the Holy Spirit, you spoke to mankind in the cradle and in maturity. And when I taught you the Book and the wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you made from the clay, like the form of the bird, with My permission, then you blew in it, and it became a bird, with My permission; and you healed the blind from birth and the leper with My permission, and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the children of Israel from you, when you came to them with the clear proofs, and those who disbelieved amongst them said, "This is not except clear magic."

111.The Wise Quran: And when I inspired the disciples, "Believe in Me and My messenger;" they said, "We believe; bear witness that indeed we are those who submit."'

112.The Wise Quran: When the disciples said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary! Is your Lord able to send down to us a table from heaven?' He said, 'Fear God, if you are believers;'

113.The Wise Quran: They said, 'We desire to eat from it and that our hearts may be at rest, and that we may know that certainly what you have told us is the truth, and that we may be thereby amongst the witnesses.'

114.The Wise Quran: Jesus, the son of Mary, said, 'O God, our Lord! Send down to us a table from heaven to be to us a festival, - to the first of us and the last of us, and a sign from you, - and grant us provision, for you are the best of providers.'

115.The Wise Quran: God said, 'Indeed, I am one who sends it down upon you; then whoever disbelieves after among you, then indeed, I will punish him with a punishment which I have not punished any one among the worlds.'

116.The Wise Quran: And when God said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary! Did you say unto men, "Take me and my mother as two gods, apart from God"?' He said, 'Glory be to You! It was not for me to say what I have no right to. if I said it, then surely You would have known it; You know what is in my soul, but I do not know what is in Your soul; indeed You, You are the knower of the unseen.

117.The Wise Quran: I said not to them except what You commanded me, - "Worship God, my Lord and your Lord," and I was a witness against them so long as I was amongst them; then when You caused me to die You were the watcher over them, and You are witness over all things.

118.The Wise Quran: If You punish them, then indeed, they are Your servants; and if You forgive them, then indeed You are the Mighty, the Wise.'

119.The Wise Quran: God said, 'This is the day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness.' for them are gardens beneath which rivers flow, dwelling for ever in it, for ever. God is pleased with them, and they pleased with him; that is the great success.

120.The Wise Quran: God's is the kingdom of the heavens, and the earth, and what is in them, and He is powerful over everything.

1.The Wise Quran: Praise be to God, the one who created the heavens and the earth, and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disbelieve ascribe equals with their Lord.

2.The Wise Quran: He is the one who created you from clay; then He decreed a term, - and a named term with Him. Then you doubt.

3.The Wise Quran: And He is God in the heavens and in the earth. He knows your secret and your open, and He knows what you earn.

4.The Wise Quran: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord but they turn away from it.

5.The Wise Quran: Then indeed, they have called the truth a lie when it came to them, so soon there shall come to them news of what they mocked at.

6.The Wise Quran: Do they not see how many a generation We have destroyed before them, We had established them in the earth as We have not established you, and We sent the sky upon them pouring abundantly, and We made the rivers flow beneath them? Then We destroyed them in their sins, and raised up other generations after them.

7.The Wise Quran: Had We sent down to you a book on paper, and they had touched it with their hands, those who disbelieve surely would have said, 'This is not except clear magic.'

8.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'Why has not an angel been sent down on him?' And if We had sent down an angel the affair surely would have been decided, then they would have had no respite.

9.The Wise Quran: And had We made him an angel, certainly We would have made him a man; and certainly We would have confused for them what they are confusing.

10.The Wise Quran: And certainly messengers before you were mocked, but those who scoffed of them were encompassed by what they mocked at.

11.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Travel in the earth then see how was the end of the deniers.'

12.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Whose is what is in the heavens and the earth?' Say, 'God's.' He has prescribed mercy on Himself. He will surely gather you together to the Day of Resurrection. There is no doubt about it, those who have lost their souls, then they do not believe.

13.The Wise Quran: And His is whatever dwells in the night and the day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

14.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Shall I take a patron other than God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, And He feeds, And is not fed?' Say, 'Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first who submits, and not be of the idolaters.'

15.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, I fear, if I rebel against my Lord, the punishment of a mighty day.'

16.The Wise Quran: Whomever it is averted from on that day, then surely He will have had mercy on him; and that is the clear success.

17.The Wise Quran: And if God touches you with harm, then there is no remover of it but He. And if He touches you with good, then He is powerful over everything.

18.The Wise Quran: And He is the Supreme over His servants, and He is the Wise, the Aware.

19.The Wise Quran: Say, 'What thing is greatest as a testimony?' Say, 'God is witness between me and you. And this Quran was inspired to me that I may warn you with it and whoever it reaches. Do you indeed testify that there are other gods with God?' Say, 'I do not testify.' Say, 'He is only one god, and indeed I am clear of what you associate.'

20.The Wise Quran: Those to whom We have given the Book know him as they know their sons; those who have lost their souls, then they do not believe.

21.The Wise Quran: And who does more wrong than he who forges against God a lie, or says His signs are lies? Indeed, the wrongdoers shall not prosper.

22.The Wise Quran: And the day We shall gather them all together, then We shall say to those who associated partners, 'Where are your associates those whom you used to claim?'

23.The Wise Quran: Then they will have no excuse but to say, 'By God, our Lord, we were not idolaters.'

24.The Wise Quran: See how they lie against themselves, and what they forged has gone astray from them.

25.The Wise Quran: And among them are those who listen to you, and We have made coverings upon their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears, dulness; and though they see every sign they would not believe in it; until when they come to you to argue with you, those who disbelieve say, 'This is not except legends of the former people.'

26.The Wise Quran: And they forbid it and they avoid it; - but they destroy none but themselves; and they do not perceive.

27.The Wise Quran: And if you could see when they are stationed before the fire and say, 'Oh, would that we were sent back. And we would not call our Lord's signs lies, and we would be of the believers.'

28.The Wise Quran: Nay, is shown to them what they hid before; and if they were sent back certainly they would return to what they were forbidden, and indeed, they certainly are liars.

29.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'There is nothing except our worldly life and we shall not be raised.'

30.The Wise Quran: If you could see when they are stationed before their Lord; He says, 'Is this not the truth?' They say, 'Yea, by our Lord.' He says, 'Then taste the punishment, for that you used to disbelieve.'

31.The Wise Quran: Lost certainly are those who deny the meeting with God, until when the Hour comes suddenly upon them, they say, 'O our regret over what we neglected concerning it.' And they shall bear their burdens on their backs. Lo, evil is what they bear.

32.The Wise Quran: And the worldly life is not except play and diversion, and surely the home of the hereafter is better for those who fear. So will you not become intelligent?

33.The Wise Quran: Indeed, we know that what they say grieves you; And indeed, they do not call you liar; but the unjust deny the signs of God.

34.The Wise Quran: And certainly messengers before you were called liars; but they were patient of being called liars and of being hurt until Our help came to them; and there is none to change the words of God. And certainly there has come to you of the news of the messengers.

35.The Wise Quran: And if their turning away is hard for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel in the earth, or a ladder in the sky, to bring them a sign. And had God willed surely He would have gathered them on the guidance, so do not be of the ignorant.

36.The Wise Quran: Only those who hear will answer; and the dead, God will raise them up, then to Him they shall be returned.

37.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'Unless there is sent down a sign from his Lord.' Say, 'Indeed, God is able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know.'

38.The Wise Quran: And there is not a creature in the earth nor a bird that flies with both its wings, but are nations like you; We have neglected nothing in the Book; then to their Lord they shall be gathered.

39.The Wise Quran: And those who say Our signs are lies, deaf and dumb, in darkness. Whomever God wills He leads him astray, and whomever He wills He places him on the straight way.

40.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen if there came to you God's punishment or there came to you the Hour, would you call on other than God, if you are truthful?'

41.The Wise Quran: Nay, on Him you would call, and He will remove what you call upon Him for if He wills; and you shall forget what you associate.

42.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly We sent to nations before you, then We seized them with distress and adversity perhaps they might be humble.

43.The Wise Quran: And if only when Our violence came upon them, they had been humble. But their hearts were hard, and the devil beautified for them what they were doing.

44.The Wise Quran: And when they forgot what they were reminded of, We opened on them the gates of everything, until when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and lo, they were in despair.

45.The Wise Quran: And the roots of the people who did wrong were cut off; and praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

46.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen if God seizes your hearing and your sight, and sets a seal on your hearts, who is god other than God to bring it to you?' See how We turn about the signs; then they turn away.

47.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen if God's punishment should come upon you suddenly or openly, would be destroyed except the wrongdoing people?'

48.The Wise Quran: And We do not send the messengers except as heralds of glad tidings and of warning. So whoever believed and did right, then there is no fear upon them, and they will not grieve.

49.The Wise Quran: And those who say Our signs are lies, the punishment shall touch them, for that they used to disobey.

50.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I do not say to you with me are the treasuries of God, nor I know the unseen; and I do not say to you, I am an angel. I follow not except what is revealed to me.' Say, 'Are the blind and the seeing equal? Do you not reflect?

51.The Wise Quran: And warn with it those who fear that they will be gathered to their Lord; there is no patron for them besides Him, and no intercessor; perhaps they may fear.

52.The Wise Quran: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord in the morning (After sunrise to mid-morning) and the afternoon (Noon to mid-afternoon), desiring His face; not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account; so were you to drive them away, then you would be of the unjust.

53.The Wise Quran: And thus We have tried some of them with others, that they may say, 'Are these those unto whom God has been gracious amongst us?' Does not God know those who give thanks?

54.The Wise Quran: And when those who believe in Our signs come to you, then say, 'Peace be on you. Your Lord has prescribed upon Himself mercy; indeed, he of you who did evil in ignorance, then repented after it and did right, then indeed, He is forgiving, compassionate.'

55.The Wise Quran: And thus We detail the signs, that the way of the sinners may be manifest.

56.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, I am forbidden to worship those whom you call on besides God.' Say, 'I will not follow your lusts, certainly I would err then and I would not be of the guided.'

57.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, I am on a clear proof from my Lord, and you call it a lie. Not with me is what you seek to hasten of it. The judgment is only God's. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders.'

58.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If what you seek to hasten of it were with me, the matter would have certainly been decided between you and me; and God knows best of the wrongdoers.'

59.The Wise Quran: And with Him are the keys of the unseen. None knows them but He; And He knows what is in the land and the sea; and not a leaf falls but He knows it; nor a grain in the darkness of the earth, nor anything that is moist, nor anything that is dry, but is in a clear Book.

60.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who takes your souls by night, and knows what you have committed by day; then He raises you up in it, that a named term may be fulfilled; then to Him is your return, then He will inform you of what you used to do.

61.The Wise Quran: And He is the Supreme over His servants; and He sends guardians over you; until when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they neglect not.

62.The Wise Quran: Then they are returned to God, their sovereign, the Truth. Lo, His is the judgment and He is the swiftest of the reckoners.

63.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who saves you from the darkness of the land and the sea?' You call upon Him in humility and in secret, 'Indeed, if He saves us from this, we will surely be of the thankful.'

64.The Wise Quran: Say, 'God saves you from it, and from every trouble, then you associate partners.'

65.The Wise Quran: Say, 'He is able to send punishment on you from above you or from beneath your feet, or to confuse you into sects, and to make some of you taste the violence of others.' See how We turnabout the signs; perhaps they may understand.

66.The Wise Quran: And your people called it a lie, while it is the truth. Say, 'I am not a trustee over you.'

67.The Wise Quran: For every news is a fixed time, and soon you will know.

68.The Wise Quran: And when you see those who plunge into vain discourse about Our signs, then turn away from them until they plunge into vain discourse about a story other than it; and if the devil definitely makes you forget; then do not sit, after the remembrance, with the wrongdoing people.

69.The Wise Quran: Nothing of their account falls upon those who fear; but a reminding; perhaps they may fear.

70.The Wise Quran: And leave those who have taken their religion as play and diversion, and whom the worldly life has deceived, and remind with it lest a soul is given up for what it has earned; besides God, it has no patron and no intercessor; and though it should compensate - every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given up for what they have earned, for them is a drink of hot water, and painful punishment for that they disbelieved.

71.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Shall we call, besides God, on what neither profits us nor harms us, and be turned back on our heels after God has guided us, like him whom the devil has led away bewildered in the earth, who has companions who call him to guidance, "Come to us?"' Say, 'Indeed, God's guidance, it is the guidance, and we are commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.

72.The Wise Quran: And be steadfast in the prayer and fear Him, and He is the one to whom you shall be gathered.'

73.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who created the heavens and the earth with the truth; and the day He says, 'Be,' Then it is. His speech is the truth; His is the kingdom on the day the horn will be blown in; the knower of the unseen and the seen; and He is the Wise, the Aware.

74.The Wise Quran: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Do you take idols for gods? Indeed, I see you and your people in clear error.'

75.The Wise Quran: And thus We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and that he may be of those who are sure.

76.The Wise Quran: And when the night overshadowed him he saw a star. He said, 'This is my Lord;' But when it set, he said, 'I love not those that set.'

77.The Wise Quran: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord;' But when it set he said, 'If my Lord does not guide me I shall surely be of the people who err.'

78.The Wise Quran: And when he saw the sun rising he said, 'This is my Lord, this is greater;' But when it set, he said, 'O my people! Indeed, I am clear of what you associate.

79.The Wise Quran: Indeed, I have turned my face to the one who originated the heavens and the earth, upright, and I am not of the idolaters.'

80.The Wise Quran: And his people disputed with him; he said, 'Do you dispute with me concerning God, and certainly He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him, except that my Lord wills anything. My Lord encompasses everything in knowledge, then will you not remember?

81.The Wise Quran: And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with God what He has not sent down on you authority for it? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you know?

82.The Wise Quran: Those who believe and do not mix their faith with wrong, those, for them is security and they are guided.

83.The Wise Quran: And that is Our argument, We gave it to Abraham against his people; We raise up in degrees whom We will; Indeed, your Lord is wise, knowing.

84.The Wise Quran: And We bestowed to him Isaac and Jacob, all We guided. And Noah We guided before; and of his offspring, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. And thus We reward the good-doers.

85.The Wise Quran: And Zachariah and John and Jesus and Ilyas, all were of the righteous.

86.The Wise Quran: And Ishmael and Al Yasa'a and Jonah and Lot, and all We favoured over the worlds;

87.The Wise Quran: And of their fathers and their offspring and their brothers; and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.

88.The Wise Quran: That is God's guidance; He guides with it whom He wills of His servants; and had they associated partners, surely what they used to do would have been voided from them.

89.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Book and the judgment and the prophethood; and if these disbelieve in it, then indeed, We have entrusted it to a people who are not disbelievers in it.

90.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones whom God has guided, so with their guidance be led. Say, 'I will not ask you for it a reward. It is not except a reminder to the worlds.'

91.The Wise Quran: And they measured not God truly His value when they said, 'God has not sent down anything on a mortal.' Say, 'Who revealed the Book which Moses came with, a light and a guidance for mankind? You put it on papers which you show, and you hide much; and you are taught what you knew not, neither you nor your fathers.' Say, 'God,' Then leave them in their vain discourse to play.

92.The Wise Quran: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed, confirming that which was before it, and that you may warn the mother of the cities, and those who are around her. And those who believe in the hereafter believe in it, and they over their prayers are guarding.

93.The Wise Quran: Who is more unjust than he who forges against God a lie or says, 'It has been inspired to me,' while nothing has been inspired to him, and who says, 'I will reveal the like of what of what God has revealed'? And if you could see when the unjust are in the floods of death, and the angels stretch out their hands, 'Bring out your souls! Today you shall be recompensed with the punishment of disgrace, for that you used to say against God other than the truth and you were proud against His signs.'

94.The Wise Quran: And certainly you have come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left what We granted you behind your backs. And We do not see with you your intercessors those whom you claimed that they were associates in you. Indeed, it has been cut asunder between you; and what you used to claim has gone astray from you.

95.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God is the cleaver of the grain and the date-seed; He brings forth the living from the dead, and is the bringer-forth of the dead from the living. That is God, so how are you turned away?

96.The Wise Quran: The cleaver of the morning. And He has made the night for repose, and the sun and the moon for reckoning. That is the decree of the Mighty, the Knowing.

97.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who made for you the stars that you might be guided with them in the darkness of the land and the sea. Certainly, We have detailed the signs for a people who know.

98.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who produced you from one soul, and a settlement and a resting place. Certainly, We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.

99.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who sends down from the sky water; and We bring forth with it plants of everything; and We bring forth from it green, from which We bring forth grain in full ear; and from the palm from its spathe near clusters; and gardens of grapes and the olives and the pomegranates, alike and unlike; look at its fruit when it fruits and ripens. Indeed, in that are signs for the people who believe.

100.The Wise Quran: And they make the jinn partners with God, though He created them. And they ascribed to Him sons and daughters, without knowledge. Glory be to Him and high is He above what they describe.

101.The Wise Quran: Originator of the heavens and the earth. How can He have a son, and He has no female companion, and He has created everything, and He has knowledge of everything?

102.The Wise Quran: That is God your Lord. There is no god but He, the creator of everything; so worship Him. And He is over everything a trustee.

103.The Wise Quran: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives vision; and He is the Subtle, the Aware.

104.The Wise Quran: Indeed, insight has come to you from your Lord. So whoever sees, then it is for his soul, and whoever is blind then it is against it; and I am not a guardian over you.

105.The Wise Quran: And thus We turn about the signs, that they may say, 'You have studied,' And that We may make it clear for a people who know.

106.The Wise Quran: Follow what is inspired to you from your Lord; there is no god but He, and turn away from the idolaters.

107.The Wise Quran: And if God had willed, they would not have associated partners. And We have not made you a guardian over them, nor are you over them a trustee.

108.The Wise Quran: And do not insult those whom they call on other than God, then they may insult God in enmity without knowledge. Thus We beautified to every nation their works. Then unto their Lord is their return, then He will inform them of what they used to do.

109.The Wise Quran: And they swore with God the utmost of their oaths, surely if a sign comes to them, they would surely, definitely believe in it. Say, 'Signs are only with God;' But what will make you perceive that when it has come, they will not believe.

110.The Wise Quran: And We will turn their hearts and their eyesights, as they did not believe in it the first time; and We will leave them, in their immoderation, blindly wandering.

111.The Wise Quran: And had We sent down to them the angels, and the dead had spoken to them, and We had gathered everything upon them, in front, they were not to believe except that God wills, but most of them are ignorant.

112.The Wise Quran: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy: devils of mankind and the jinn; he inspires - some of them to some - the embellishment of speech, deception. And had your Lord willed they would not have done it; so leave them and what they forge.

113.The Wise Quran: And let the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter incline to it; and let them be pleased with it; and let them earn what they are earning.

114.The Wise Quran: Shall I then seek a judge other than God? And He is the one who has sent down to you the Book in detail, and those to whom We gave the Book know that it is sent down from your Lord with the truth, so do not be of the doubters.

115.The Wise Quran: The word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and justice; there is none to change His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

116.The Wise Quran: And if you obey most of those who are in the earth, they will lead you astray from the path of God; they follow not except conjecture, and they do not except lie.

117.The Wise Quran: Indeed, your Lord, He knows best who errs from His path, and He knows best of the guided ones.

118.The Wise Quran: So eat of what God's name has been pronounced upon, if you are believers in His signs.

119.The Wise Quran: What ails you that you do not eat from what God's name is pronounced upon, and indeed, He has detailed to you what He has made unlawful for you? Except what you are forced to; and indeed, many surely lead astray by their desires, without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord, He knows best of the transgressors.

120.The Wise Quran: And leave the outside of sin and the inside thereof; indeed, those who earn sin shall be recompensed for what they used to earn.

121.The Wise Quran: And do not eat of what the name of God has not been pronounced upon, and indeed, it is surely disobedience. And indeed, the devils inspire their friends that they may dispute with you; and if you obey them, indeed, you are idolaters.

122.The Wise Quran: Is he who was dead and We gave him life, and made for him a light with which he walks among men, like him whose similitude is in the darkness, from which he cannot come out? Thus is beautified to the disbelievers what they used to do.

123.The Wise Quran: And thus We have placed in every town the greatest of its sinners, that they may plot therein. And they plot only against themselves, and they do not perceive.

124.The Wise Quran: And when a sign comes to them, they say, 'We will not believe until we are given like what the messengers of God were given.' God knows best where to put His message. There shall befall those who sin, humiliation in God's sight, and grievous punishment for what they used to plot.

125.The Wise Quran: So whomsoever God wishes to guide, He expands his breast to the submission; and whomsoever He wishes to lead astray, He makes his breast narrow, straitened, as if he were ascending in the sky; thus God places the uncleanness on those who do not believe.

126.The Wise Quran: And this is the way of your Lord - straight. Certainly We have detailed the signs for a people who remember.

127.The Wise Quran: For them is the abode of peace with their Lord, and He is their patron for what they have done.

128.The Wise Quran: And the day He shall gather them all together, 'O assembly of the jinn! Certainly, you have got many of mankind.' And their clients among mankind shall say, 'Our Lord! Some of us profited by others; and we have reached our term which you delayed for us.' He says, 'The fire is your abode, to dwell therein forever.' - except what God wills; indeed, your Lord is wise, knowing.

129.The Wise Quran: And thus We make some of the wrongdoers patrons to some, for what they used to earn.

130.The Wise Quran: O assembly of jinn and mankind! Did there not come to you messengers from you relating to you My signs, and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours? They say, 'We bear witness against ourselves.' And the worldly life deceived them, and they bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

131.The Wise Quran: That is that your Lord is not one who destroys the towns unjustly while their people are heedless.

132.The Wise Quran: And for all are degrees of what they did; and your Lord is not heedless of what they do.

133.The Wise Quran: And your Lord is the rich, the possessor of mercy; if He wills He can remove you, and can cause what He wills to succeed you after you; as He raised you from the offspring of other people.

134.The Wise Quran: Indeed, what you are promised will surely come, and you cannot escape.

135.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O my people! Work according to your position, indeed, I am working; and soon you shall know whose is the end of the abode. Indeed, the unjust shall not prosper.'

136.The Wise Quran: They set apart for God, from what He created of tilth and cattle, a portion, and they say, 'This is God's;' - By their claim - 'And this is for our associates;' But what is for their associates does not reach to God, and what is for God then it reaches to their associates; evil is what they judge.

137.The Wise Quran: And thus have their associates beautified to many of the idolaters the killing of their children, to destroy them, and to confuse for them their religion; but had God willed they would not have done it, so leave them and what they have forged.

138.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'These cattle and tilth are inviolable; none shall eat them, except whom we will,' - By their claim - And there are cattle whose backs are prohibited, and cattle upon which God's name is not pronounced, forging against Him. He shall reward them for what they have forged.

139.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'What is in the wombs of these cattle is reserved for our males and unlawful for our wives, but if it is dead, then they are partners in it.' He will recompense them for their description; indeed, He is wise, knowing.

140.The Wise Quran: Certainly, lost are those who kill their children foolishly, without knowledge, and prohibit what God has provided them, forging against God; certainly, they have erred and are not guided.

141.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who produces gardens trellised, and untrellised, and the palms and the corn, different their fruit, and the olives, and the pomegranates, alike and unlike. Eat of its fruit when it fruits, and give its due on the day of its harvest, and do not be extravagant; indeed, He does not love the extravagant.

142.The Wise Quran: And of cattle are there some to ride on and to spread. Eat of what God has provided you, and do not follow the footsteps of the devil; indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

143.The Wise Quran: Eight pairs, - of the sheep two, and of the goats two; say, 'Are the two males unlawful, or the two females, or what the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge if you are truthful.'

144.The Wise Quran: And of the camels two, and of the cows two; say, 'Are the two males unlawful, or the two females, or what the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when God instructed you with this? Then who does more wrong than he who forges a lie against God, to lead mankind astray without knowledge? Indeed, God does not guide the wrongdoing people.'

145.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I cannot find in what is inspired to me anything unlawful for a taster to taste it; except that it be dead, or blood that has been shed, or the flesh of swine, - for indeed, it is uncleanness - or disobedience, consecrated to other than God. But whoever is forced, not seeking nor transgressing, then indeed, your Lord is forgiving, compassionate.'

146.The Wise Quran: And to those who became Jews We prohibited everything that has a solid hoof; and of the cows and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what their backs carry, or the entrails or what is mixed with bone; that is their recompense for their insolence. And indeed, We surely are truthful.

147.The Wise Quran: And if they deny you, then say, 'Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy, and His violence will not be turned back from the sinful people.'

148.The Wise Quran: Those who associate partners will say, 'Had God willed, we would not have associated partners nor our fathers; nor would we have prohibited anything.' Thus those who were before them denied until they tasted Our punishment. Say, 'Have you any knowledge with you? Then bring it forth to us. You follow not except conjecture, and you do not except lie.'

149.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Then God's is the reaching argument; and had He willed, surely He would have guided you all.'

150.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Bring your witnesses, those who bear witness that God has prohibited this.' Then if they bear witness, then do not bear witness with them; and do not follow the lust of those who say Our signs are lies, and those who do not believe in the hereafter, and they make peers with their Lord.

151.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Come! I will recite what your Lord has forbidden you, that you do not associate anything with Him, and with the parents, goodness, and do not kill your children out of poverty; - We will provide for you and them; - and do not draw near immoralities, what is apparent of them and what is concealed, and do not kill the soul, which God has forbidden except with the right; that He has instructed you with, perhaps you may become intelligent.'

152.The Wise Quran: And do not draw near to the wealth of the orphan, except with that which is best, until he reaches his strength; and give full measure and weight with justice. We do not task a soul except its capacity; and when you speak, then be just, though it be to a relative. And God's covenant fulfil. That He has instructed you with, perhaps you may remember.

153.The Wise Quran: And indeed, this is My straight way; so follow it. And do not follow the ways, then they will separate you from His way; that He has instructed you with, perhaps you may fear.

154.The Wise Quran: Then We gave Moses the Book, complete for him who does good, and an explanation of everything and a guidance and a mercy; perhaps in the meeting with their Lord they will believe.

155.The Wise Quran: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed. So follow it and fear; perhaps you may obtain mercy.

156.The Wise Quran: Lest you say, 'The Book was only sent down upon two parties before us; and indeed, we were certainly heedless of their study.'

157.The Wise Quran: Or, you should say, 'If that the Book was sent down on us, surely we would have been better guided than them.' So certainly there has come to you a clear proof from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy; then who does more wrong than he who calls God's signs lies, and turns away from them? We will reward those who turn away from Our signs with an evil punishment for that they turned away.

158.The Wise Quran: Are they waiting except that the angels should come to them, or that your Lord should come, or that some signs of your Lord should come? The day some signs of your Lord come, its faith shall profit no soul which did not believe before, or earned good by its faith. Say, 'Wait. Indeed, we are waiting.'

159.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who divided their religion and became sects, you are not of them in anything; their matter is only unto God, then He will inform them of what they used to do.

160.The Wise Quran: Whoever comes with the good deed, then for him is ten similitudes of it; and whoever comes with the evil deed, then he will not be recompensed except the like of it; and they will not be wronged.

161.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed me, my Lord has guided me to a straight way, a right religion, - the religion of Abraham, upright, and he was not of the idolaters.'

162.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, my prayer and my sacrifice and my life and my death belong to God, the Lord of the worlds.

163.The Wise Quran: He has no partner; and with that I have been commanded, and I am the first of those who submit.'

164.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Shall I seek a Lord other than God, and He is the Lord of all things?' And every soul earns not except against itself, and no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return and He will inform you of that concerning which you were disagreeing.'

165.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who made you vicegerents of the earth, and raised some of you above some in degree, to try you in what He has given you; - indeed, your Lord is swift in the punishment, and indeed, He is surely forgiving, compassionate.

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Mim.Sad.

2.The Wise Quran: A book revealed to you, so let there be no straitness in your breast from it - that you may warn with it, and a reminder to the believers.

3.The Wise Quran: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and do not follow patrons besides Him; little is what you remember.

4.The Wise Quran: And how many a town have We destroyed, and Our violence came upon it by night, or while they slept at noon;

5.The Wise Quran: And their cry, when Our violence came upon them, was only that they said, 'Indeed, we were unjust.'

6.The Wise Quran: Then surely We will definitely question those to whom it was sent, and surely We will definitely question the messengers.

7.The Wise Quran: And surely We will narrate to them with knowledge, and We were not absent.

8.The Wise Quran: The balance on that day is true, and He whose scales are heavy - then those, they are the prosperous.

9.The Wise Quran: And he whose scales are light - So those are the ones who lose themselves for that they used to wrong Our signs.

10.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We have established you in the earth, and We have made for you in it livelihood. Little is what you give thanks.

11.The Wise Quran: And certainly We created you, then We fashioned you, then We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' So they prostrated, except Iblis, he was not of those who prostrated.

12.The Wise Quran: He said, 'What prevented you that you did not prostrate when I commanded you?' He said, 'I am better than him; you created me of fire, and you created him of clay.'

13.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Then go down from it; it is not for you that you be proud in it, so go forth! Indeed, you are of the little ones.'

14.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Respite me to the day they are raised.'

15.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Indeed, you are of the respited.'

16.The Wise Quran: He said, 'For that you have led me into error, surely I will lie in wait for them in your straight path;

17.The Wise Quran: Then I will surely come to them, from before them and from behind them; and from their right and from their left, and you will not find most of them thankful.'

18.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Go forth from it, despised, expelled; certainly, whoever of them follows you, I will surely fill Hell with you all together.

19.The Wise Quran: And, O Adam, dwell you and your wife in the Garden and eat from wherever you will, but do not draw near this tree; then you will be of the unjust.'

20.The Wise Quran: Then the devil whispered to them to display to them what was hidden from them of their shame, and he said, 'Your Lord has only forbidden you this tree lest you should be two angels, or you should become of the immortals.'

21.The Wise Quran: And he swore to them both, 'Indeed, I am for you among the sincere advisers.'

22.The Wise Quran: So he directed both of them with deception, and when they tasted the tree, their shame became apparent to them, and they began to stitch upon themselves from the leaves of the garden. And their Lord called to them both, 'Did I not forbid you both from that tree, and say to both of you, indeed, the devil is to you a clear enemy?'

23.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves - and if you do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we shall surely be among the losers.'

24.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Go down, some of you an enemy to some. And for you in the earth there is an abode, and a provision to a time.'

25.The Wise Quran: He said, 'In it you shall live and in it you shall die, and from it you shall be brought forth.'

26.The Wise Quran: O children of Adam! Verily, We have sent down to you garments to cover your shame, and plumage; but the garment of piety, that is better. That is of the signs of God, perhaps they may remember.

27.The Wise Quran: O children of Adam! Let not the devil tempt you as he drove your parents from the garden, stripping from them their garments, to show them their shame; indeed, he sees you - he and his tribe, from where you see them not. Indeed, We have made the devils patrons of those who do not believe.

28.The Wise Quran: And when they do an immorality, they say, 'We found our fathers on it, and God has commanded us with it.' Say, 'Indeed, God does not command immorality; do you say against God what you do not know?'

29.The Wise Quran: Say: 'My Lord has commanded justice: - set steadfastly your faces at every mosque and call on Him, sincere to Him in the religion. As He originated you, shall you return.

30.The Wise Quran: A party He guided, and upon a party was error due; indeed, they took the devils for their patrons besides God, and they think that they are guided.'

31.The Wise Quran: O children of Adam! Take your adornment at every mosque; and eat and drink, but do not be extravagant, indeed, He does not love the extravagant.

32.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who has prohibited the adornment of God which He brought forth for His servants, and the good things of His providing?' Say, 'On the Day of Resurrection they shall only be for those who believed when in the the worldly life.' Thus do We detail the signs for a people who know.

33.The Wise Quran: Say, 'My Lord has only prohibited immoralities - what is apparent of it and what is concealed, and sin, and insolence without the right, and that you associate with God what He has sent down no authority for, and that you say against God what you do not know.'

34.The Wise Quran: And to every nation a term; so when their term comes they cannot keep it back an hour nor bring it on.

35.The Wise Quran: O children of Adam! If there should come to you messengers amongst you, narrating to you My signs; then whoever fears God and does right, then there is no fear on them, nor shall they grieve.

36.The Wise Quran: But those who say Our signs are lies, and are proud to them, those are the fellows of the fire, they shall dwell in it for ever.

37.The Wise Quran: And who is more unjust than he who forges against God a lie, or says His signs are lies? Those, their portion of the Book shall reach them, until when Our messengers come to take them in death, they say, 'Where is what you used to call upon besides God?' They say, 'They have gone astray from us; and they shall bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

38.The Wise Quran: He will say, 'Enter - amongst nations who have passed away before you, of jinns and mankind - into the fire.' Whenever a nation enters, it curses its sister; until, when they have reached in it all together, the last of them will say to the first, 'Our Lord! These led us astray, so give them double punishment of the fire.' He will say, 'For each is double but you do not know.'

39.The Wise Quran: And the first of them will say to the last of them, 'Then you have no superiority over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn.'

40.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who say Our signs are lies and are proud to them; the doors of heaven shall not be opened for them, and they shall not enter the garden until the camel shall pass into the needle's eye. And thus We reward the sinners.

41.The Wise Quran: For them is a bed of Hell-fire, and above them coverings. And thus We reward the wrongdoers.

42.The Wise Quran: But those who believe and do good works - We do not task a soul except its capacity - those are the fellows of the garden, they shall dwell in it for ever.

43.The Wise Quran: And We will remove what is in their breasts of ill feeling - there shall flow beneath them rivers, and they shall say, 'Praise be to God who guided us to this. And We would not have been guided had not God guided us. - Certainly, the messengers of our Lord came with truth.' And it shall be cried out to them, 'This is the Garden which you have as an inheritance for what you used to do.'

44.The Wise Quran: And the fellows of the Garden will call out to the fellows of the fire, 'Indeed, We have found what our Lord promised us is true; so have you found what your Lord promised is true?' They will say, 'Yes.' And an announcer amongst them will announce, 'The curse of God is on the unjust,

45.The Wise Quran: Those who hinder from the way of God and seek to make it crooked, and they are disbelievers in the hereafter.'

46.The Wise Quran: And between them there is a veil, and on al Aaraf are men who know each by their marks; and they shall cry out to the fellows of the Garden, 'Peace be on you.' They enter it not although they hope.

47.The Wise Quran: And when their sight is turned towards the fellows of the fire, they say, 'Our Lord! Do not place us with the unjust people.'

48.The Wise Quran: And the fellows of al Aaraf will cry out to the men whom they know by their marks, saying, 'Of no avail to you were your collections, and what you were proud;

49.The Wise Quran: Are these the ones who you swore God would not reach them with mercy? Enter the Garden; there is no fear upon you, nor shall you grieve.'

50.The Wise Quran: And the fellows of the fire shall cry out to the fellows of the Garden, 'Pour upon us water, or of what God has provided you.' They will say, 'Indeed, God has prohibited them both to the disbelievers;

51.The Wise Quran: Those who took their religion as a diversion and play; and whom the worldly life deceived.' So today We forget them as they forgot the meeting of this day of theirs, and that they denied Our signs.

52.The Wise Quran: And certainly We have brought them a Book explaining it on knowledge, a guidance and a mercy to a people who believe.

53.The Wise Quran: Do they wait except for its interpretation? - The day its interpretation shall come, those who forgot it before will say, 'Indeed, Our Lord's messengers came with the truth, so are there for us any intercessors so they intercede for us or could we return, so we would do other than that which we did?' Verily, they have lost themselves, and what they were forging has gone astray from them.

54.The Wise Quran: Indeed, your Lord is God who created the heavens and the earth in six days; then He made for the throne. He covers the night with the day - it pursues it incessantly - and the sun and the moon and the stars are subject to His command. Lo, His is the creation and the command, blessed is God, the Lord of the worlds.

55.The Wise Quran: Call on your Lord humbly and secretly, indeed, He does not love the transgressors.

56.The Wise Quran: And do not corruption in the earth after it has been righted; and call on Him with fear and hope; indeed, the mercy of God is near to the good-doers.

57.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who sends forth the winds as glad tidings before His mercy; until when they lift a heavy cloud, We drive it to a dead land, and send down therewith water, and bring forth therewith of all the fruits; thus We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may remember.

58.The Wise Quran: And the good land brings forth its plants by the permission of its Lord; and that which is bad does not bring forth except with difficulty. Thus We turn about the signs for a people who are grateful.

59.The Wise Quran: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people! Serve God, you have no god other than Him; indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great day.'

60.The Wise Quran: Said the chiefs of his people, 'Indeed, we surely see you in clear error.'

61.The Wise Quran: He said, 'O my people! There is no error in me; but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

62.The Wise Quran: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I give you sincere advice; and I know from God what you do not know.

63.The Wise Quran: Do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord on a man among you, that he may warn you, and that you may fear? And perhaps you may receive mercy.'

64.The Wise Quran: But they called him liar, So We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We drowned those who said Our signs were lies, indeed, they were a blind people.

65.The Wise Quran: And to 'Ad their brother Hud, he said, 'O my people! Serve God, you have no god other than Him; will you not then fear?'

66.The Wise Quran: Said the chiefs of those who disbelieved amongst his people, 'Indeed, we surely see you in foolishness, and indeed, we certainly think you are of the liars.'

67.The Wise Quran: He said, 'O my people! There is no foolishness in me; but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds;

68.The Wise Quran: I convey to you the messages of my Lord; and I am to you a sincere, faithful adviser.

69.The Wise Quran: Do you then wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord on a man among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you vicegerents after Noah's people and increased you extensively in make; remember then the benefits of God perhaps you may prosper.'

70.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Have you come to us that we may worship God alone, and leave what our fathers used to worship? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful.'

71.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Verily, uncleanness and wrath from your Lord have fallen on you; do you wrangle with me about names, which you have named - you and your fathers, for which God sent down no authority; wait then, indeed, I am with you of those who wait.'

72.The Wise Quran: So We saved him and those with him, by mercy from Us, and We cut off the roots of those who said Our signs were lies and were not believers.'

73.The Wise Quran: And to Thamud their brother Salih, He said, 'O my people! Worship God; you have no god other than Him. Certainly, there has come to you a clear proof from your Lord. This is the she-camel of God, a sign for you; leave her then to eat in the earth of God, and do not touch her with evil, so a painful punishment seizes you.

74.The Wise Quran: And remember when He made you vicegerents after 'Ad and settled you in the earth, you take for yourselves castles of its plains and carve out mountains into houses; and remember the benefits of God, and do not mischief in the earth, working corruption.'

75.The Wise Quran: Said the chiefs of those who were proud among his people to those who were weak, to those among them who believed, 'Do you know that Salih is sent from his Lord?' They said, 'Indeed, in that with which he has been sent we are believers.'

76.The Wise Quran: Said those who were proud, 'Indeed, in that which you believe we are disbelievers.'

77.The Wise Quran: Then they hamstrung the she-camel, and rebelled against the command of their Lord and said, 'O Salih! Bring us what you threatened us with, if you are of the messengers.'

78.The Wise Quran: Then the earthquake took them, and in the morning they lay prone in their dwellings;

79.The Wise Quran: And he turned away from them and said, 'O my people! Verily, I conveyed to you the message of my Lord, and I advised you sincerely; but you do not love sincere advisers.'

80.The Wise Quran: And Lot, when he said to his people, 'Do you approach the immorality which no one of the worlds has preceded you in?

81.The Wise Quran: Indeed, you approach men lustfully instead of women - nay, you are a people who exceed.'

82.The Wise Quran: And the answer of his people was only that they said, 'Drive them out of your town. Indeed, they are people who keep pure.'

83.The Wise Quran: So We saved him and his people, except his wife, she was of those who remained behind;

84.The Wise Quran: And We rained upon them a rain; - so see how was the end of the sinners.

85.The Wise Quran: And to Midian their brother Shuayb, he said, 'O my people! Serve God, you have no god other than Him. Certainly, there has come to you a clear proof from your Lord; so fulfil the measure and weight, and do not diminish to the people their things, and do not corruption in the earth after it has been righted. That is better for you if you are believers;

86.The Wise Quran: And do not sit in every path, threatening and hindering from the way of God he who believed in Him, and seeking to make it crooked. And remember when you were few and He multiplied you; and see how was the end of the corrupters.

87.The Wise Quran: And if there is a party of you who believe in that which I am sent with, and a party who do not believe, then be patient until God judges between us, and He is the best of the wise ones.'

88.The Wise Quran: Said the chiefs of those who were proud amongst his people, 'We will surely drive you out, O Shuayb! And those who believe with you, from our town; or you shall return to our religion.' He said, 'Even if we detest?

89.The Wise Quran: Verily, we shall have invented a lie against God if we return to your religion, after God has saved us from it; And it is not for us to return to it except that God, our Lord wills. Our Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; on God we rely. Our Lord! Open between us and between our people with truth, and you are the best of those who open.'

90.The Wise Quran: And the chiefs of those who disbelieved amongst his people said, 'If you follow Shuayb, indeed, you shall certainly be losers.'

91.The Wise Quran: So the earthquake seized them, and in the morning they lay in their dwellings prone.

92.The Wise Quran: Those who called Shuayb a liar, were as though they had not dwelt therein. - those who called Shuaib a liar, they were the losers.

93.The Wise Quran: So he turned away from them and said, 'O my people! Verily, I conveyed to you the messages of my Lord, and I advised you sincerely; so how should I grieve for a people who are disbelievers?

94.The Wise Quran: And We have not sent unto a city any prophet except We seized its people with trouble and hardship, that perhaps they might be humble;

95.The Wise Quran: Then We changed in place of evil, good, until they increased and said, 'Verily, hardship and ease touched our fathers;' then We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive. -

96.The Wise Quran: And if that the people of the towns had believed and feared, surely We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied, so We seized them for what they used to earn.

97.The Wise Quran: Are the people of the towns then secure from Our violence coming upon them by night, while they sleep?

98.The Wise Quran: Or are the people of the towns secure from Our violence coming upon them in the forenoon (Mid-morning to noon) while they play?

99.The Wise Quran: Are they then secure from the plot of God? But none feel secure from the plot of God except the people who shall lose.

100.The Wise Quran: And is it not a guide to those who inherit the earth after its people that had We willed We would have smited them in their sins, and set a stamp upon their hearts, so they do not hear?

101.The Wise Quran: Those cities, We relate to you their news. And certainly their messengers came to them with the clear proofs; but they were not to believe in what they called a lie before. - Thus God sets a stamp on the hearts of the disbelievers.

102.The Wise Quran: And We did not find in most of them a covenant; and indeed, We found most of them surely disobedient.

103.The Wise Quran: Then We raised up after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs; but they did them wrong, so see how was the end of the corrupters.

104.The Wise Quran: And Moses said, 'O Pharaoh! Indeed, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds;

105.The Wise Quran: Obligated on that I not say about God except the truth. Certainly, I have come to you with a clear proof from your Lord; so send the children of Israel with me.'

106.The Wise Quran: He said, 'If you have come with a sign, then bring it, if you are of the truthful.'

107.The Wise Quran: So he threw his rod down, and lo! It was a clear snake;

108.The Wise Quran: And he drew out his hand, and lo! It was white to the beholders.

109.The Wise Quran: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people, 'Indeed, this is surely a knowing magician;

110.The Wise Quran: He desires to drive you out of your land; - so what do you command?'

111.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Put him off and his brother; and send into the cities gatherers,

112.The Wise Quran: They will bring to you every knowing magician.'

113.The Wise Quran: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, 'Indeed there surely will be a reward for us if we are victors.'

114.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Yes, and indeed you surely will be of those who are near.'

115.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O Moses! Will you throw or shall we be the throwers?'

116.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Throw,' And when they threw down, they enchanted the people's eyes, and made them dread, and came with a great magic.

117.The Wise Quran: And We inspired to Moses that, 'Throw down your rod,' and behold, it swallowed what they falsified.

118.The Wise Quran: And the truth stood fast and vain was what they had done;

119.The Wise Quran: And they were conquered there and turned back as little ones.

120.The Wise Quran: And the magicians were thrown down, prostrating.

121.The Wise Quran: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the worlds,

122.The Wise Quran: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.'

123.The Wise Quran: Pharaoh said, 'You believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, this is surely a plot which you have plotted in the city that you may drive out from it its people, but soon you shall know.

124.The Wise Quran: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides, then I will surely crucify you all together.'

125.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Indeed, we to our Lord return.

126.The Wise Quran: And you do not take vengeance on us, except for that we believe in the signs of our Lord, when they come to us. Our Lord! Pour out on us patience, and cause us to die as those who submit.

127.The Wise Quran: And the chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, 'Will you leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the earth, and to leave you and your gods?' He said, 'We will slay their sons and we will let live their women, and indeed, we are supreme over them.'

128.The Wise Quran: Moses said to his people, 'Ask for aid from God and be patient; indeed, the earth is God's. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants, and the end is for those who fear.'

129.The Wise Quran: They said, 'We have been hurt before you came to us, and after you have come to us.' He said, 'It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy, and make you successors in the earth; and He will see how you act.'

130.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We seized Pharaoh's people with the years and scarcity of fruits, perhaps they may remember;

131.The Wise Quran: But when good came to them, they said, 'This is ours;' and if evil befalls them, they ascribe evil omens to Moses and those with him; lo, their evil omens are only with God, but most of them do not know.

132.The Wise Quran: And they said, 'Whatever sign you bring us with which to enchant us, so we will not believe in you.'

133.The Wise Quran: Then We sent on them the flood and the locusts and the lice and the frogs and the blood, signs detailed; but they were proud and were a sinful people.

134.The Wise Quran: And when the plague fell on them, they said, 'O Moses! Call on your Lord for us, because He has a covenant with you; indeed, if you remove the plague from us surely, we will believe in you; and surely we will send with you the children of Israel.'

135.The Wise Quran: But when We removed from them the plague until a term which they should reach, lo! They broke their promise.

136.The Wise Quran: So We took vengeance on them, and drowned them in the sea, for that they said Our signs were lies and were heedless of them.

137.The Wise Quran: And We gave as an inheritance to the people who had been weak, the eastern parts of the land and the western parts of it, which We had blessed; and the good word of your Lord was fulfilled on the children of Israel, for that they were patient; and We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had made and what they had built.

138.The Wise Quran: And We took the children of Israel across the sea; and they came upon a people devoted to idols they had, they said, 'O Moses! Make for us a god as they have gods.' He said, 'Indeed, you are ignorant people.

139.The Wise Quran: Indeed, these - destroyed is what they are given to; and vain is what they have done.'

140.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Shall I seek a god for you other than God, while He has favoured you over the worlds?'

141.The Wise Quran: And when We saved you from Pharaoh's people who were afflicting you with evil torment, killing your sons, and letting your women live; and in that was a great trial from your Lord.

142.The Wise Quran: And We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed them with ten, so the appointed time of his Lord of forty nights was completed. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, 'Be my vicegerent amongst my people, and do right, and do not follow the way of the corrupters.'

143.The Wise Quran: And when Moses came to Our appointed place, and his Lord spoke to him, he said, 'My Lord! Show me, - that I may look on you.' He said, 'You cannot see Me; but look upon the mountain, and if it remains in its place, then soon you will see Me;' but when his Lord became manifested to the mountain He made it dust, and Moses fell down in a swoon. And when he came to himself, he said, 'Glory be to You. I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers.'

144.The Wise Quran: He said, 'O Moses! Indeed, I have chosen you over mankind with My messages and with My words, so take what I have given you, and be of the thankful.'

145.The Wise Quran: And We wrote for him in the tablets an admonition of everything, and a detailing of everything: 'So take them with firmness, and command your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the disobedient;

146.The Wise Quran: I will turn from My signs those who are proud in the earth without right; and if they see every sign they shall not believe in it, and if they see the path of rectitude they shall not take it for a path; but if they see the path of error they shall take it for a path; - that is because they have said Our signs are lies and were heedless of them.'

147.The Wise Quran: And those who say Our signs and the meeting of the hereafter are lies, their works are void. Shall they be rewarded except for what they used to do?

148.The Wise Quran: And Moses' people after him took of their ornaments a calf - a body having a lowing sound; did they not see that it could not speak with them, nor guide them in the path? They took it and they were unjust;

149.The Wise Quran: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had indeed gone astray, they said, 'Indeed, if our Lord does not have mercy on us and forgive us we shall surely be of those who lose.'

150.The Wise Quran: And when Moses returned to his people angry and grieving, he said, 'Evil is what you have done in my place after me. Would you hasten on the command of your Lord? And he threw down the tablets and took his brother by the head dragging him to him. He said, 'Son of my mother! Indeed, the people weakened me and almost killed me; so let not the enemies rejoice over me, and put me not with the unjust people.'

151.The Wise Quran: He said, 'My Lord! Forgive me and my brother and enter us into Your mercy; and you are the most merciful of the merciful.'

152.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who took the calf, there shall reach them wrath from their Lord, and abasement in the worldly life; and thus We reward those who are forgers.

153.The Wise Quran: And those who did evil deeds, then repented after it and believed, indeed, your Lord, after it, is surely forgiving, compassionate.

154.The Wise Quran: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who - they fear their Lord.

155.The Wise Quran: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointed place; and when the earthquake seized them he said, 'My Lord! Had you willed, you would have destroyed them before and me. Will you destroy us for what the fools amongst us did? It is not except Your trial, with it you lead astray whom you will and guide whom you will; You are our patron. So forgive us and have mercy on us, and You are the best of those who forgive.
