156.The Wise Quran: And write down for us in this world good and in the hereafter; indeed, we have repented to you.' He said, 'My punishment - I strike with it whom I will; and My mercy embraces everything; and I will write it down for those who fear, and give the alms, and those who believe in Our signs, -

157.The Wise Quran: Those who follow the messenger - the illiterate prophet, whom they find written down with them in the Torah and the Gospel, bidding them what is reasonable and forbidding them what is wrong, and making lawful for them the good things, and making unlawful the bad things; and setting down for them their burdens and the fetters which were on them; so those who believe with him and aid him and help him and follow the light which has been sent down with him - those are the prosperous.'

158.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O mankind! Indeed, I am the messenger of God to you all, - of Him whose is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, there is no god but He. He gives life and He gives death.' So believe in God and His messenger, the illiterate prophet, - the one who believes in God and His words, - and follow him; that perhaps you may be guided.

159.The Wise Quran: And amongst Moses' people is a nation who guide with the truth, and with it they act justly.

160.The Wise Quran: And We cut them up into twelve tribes, nations; and We inspired to Moses, when his people asked him for water, 'Strike with your staff the rock!' And there gushed forth from it twelve springs, certainly, each people knew their drinking place. And We overshadowed them with the cloud; and We sent down upon them the manna and the quails, 'Eat of the good things We have provided you.' - And they did not wrong us, but they wronged themselves.

161.The Wise Quran: And when it was said to them, 'Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will, and say unburdening; and enter the gate prostrating; We will forgive you your sins; soon We will increase the good-doers.'

162.The Wise Quran: But those amongst them who did wrong changed it for a saying other than that which was said to them; and We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for that they were unjust.

163.The Wise Quran: And ask them about the town which stood by the sea, when they transgressed in the Sabbath; when their fish came to them visibly on their Sabbath day; but on the day they had no Sabbath, they did not come to them, thus We try them for that they used to disobey.

164.The Wise Quran: And when a nation of them said, 'Why do you warn a people whom God would destroy, or punish with severe punishment?' They said, 'As an excuse to your Lord, and that perhaps they may fear.'

165.The Wise Quran: So when they forgot what they had been reminded of, We saved those who forbade evil, and We seized those who did wrong with evil punishment, because they were disobeying.

166.The Wise Quran: So when they rebelled against what they were forbidden, We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'

167.The Wise Quran: And when your Lord proclaimed that He would surely send upon them till the Day of Resurrection, those who would afflict them with evil punishment; indeed, your Lord is surely swift in the punishment, and indeed, He is surely forgiving, compassionate.

168.The Wise Quran: And We cut them up in the earth into nations. Of them are the righteous, and of them are the reverse of that; and We have tried them with the good and the bad; perhaps they may return.

169.The Wise Quran: And there succeeded after them successors who inherited the Book. They take the goods of this nearer world and say, 'It will be forgiven us.' And if the like goods came to them they would take it. Was there not taken from them a covenant by the Book, that they should not say against God except the truth? And they have studied what is in it; and the abode of the hereafter is better for those who fear; so will you not become intelligent?

170.The Wise Quran: And those who hold fast by the Book and are steadfast in prayer - indeed, We will not waste the wages of those who do well.

171.The Wise Quran: And when We shook the mountain over them, as though it were a shadow, and they thought that it would fall upon them, 'Take what We have given you with strength, and remember what is in it; perhaps you may fear.'

172.The Wise Quran: And when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their offspring, and made them bear witness against themselves, 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yes, we bear witness.' - lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, 'Indeed, We were heedless of this;'

173.The Wise Quran: Or you say, 'Only our fathers associated others before, and we are offspring after them; will you then destroy us for what the vain-doers did?'

174.The Wise Quran: And thus We detail the signs; and perhaps they may return.

175.The Wise Quran: And read to them the news of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he withdrew from them, so the devil followed him, and he was of those who go astray.

176.The Wise Quran: And had We willed surely, We would have exalted him with it, but he inclined to the earth and followed his lust, so his similitude is as the similitude of the dog, if you attack it it hangs out its tongue, or if you leave it, it hangs out its tongue. That is the similitude of the people who say Our signs are lies. So narrate the story perhaps they may reflect.

177.The Wise Quran: Evil is the similitude of the people who say Our signs are lies and used to wrong themselves.

178.The Wise Quran: Whoever God guides, then he is the guided; and whoever He leads astray - then those - they are the losers.

179.The Wise Quran: And certainly We have created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind; they have hearts with which they do not understand; and they have eyes with which they do not see; and they have ears with which they do not hear; those are like cattle, nay, they go more astray. Those - they are the heedless.

180.The Wise Quran: And God's are the best names; so call on Him by them, and leave those who deviate from His names; soon they will be recompensed for what they used to do.

181.The Wise Quran: And of those whom We have created is a nation who guide with the truth and with it they act justly;

182.The Wise Quran: But those who say Our signs are lies, soon We will bring them down by degrees from where they do not know.

183.The Wise Quran: And I will give respite to them. Indeed, my plot is strong.

184.The Wise Quran: Do they not reflect? There is no madness in their companion? He is not except a clear warner.

185.The Wise Quran: Do they not behold the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and what things God has created, and that it may be, their term has verily drawn near? So in what story after it then will they believe?

186.The Wise Quran: Whoever God leads astray then there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their immoderation, blindly wandering.

187.The Wise Quran: They ask you about the Hour, when is its fixed time? - Say, 'Its knowledge is only with My Lord; none shall manifest it at its time but He; it is heavy in the heavens and the earth, it will not come to you except suddenly.' They will ask as though you were privy to it say, 'Its knowledge is only with God, - but most of mankind do not know.'

188.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I cannot control profit nor harm for myself, except what God wills. And if I knew the unseen, I would surely have much of good, and evil would not have touched me; I am only a warner and a herald of good tidings to a people who believe.'

189.The Wise Quran: He is the one who created you from one soul, and made from it its mate that he might dwell with her; and when he covered her she bore a light burden and passed with it; but when it grew heavy they called on God, their Lord, 'Surely if you give us a righteous one surely we shall be of the thankful.'

190.The Wise Quran: But when He gives them a righteous one they make for Him partners in what He has given them. But exalted is God above what they associate.

191.The Wise Quran: Do they associate what does not create anything, while they are created?

192.The Wise Quran: And no help can they give them, nor can they help themselves.

193.The Wise Quran: And if you call them to guidance they will not follow you. Equal on you whether you call them or you are silent.

194.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those whom you call on besides God are servants like you. So call on them, and let them answer you, if you are truthful.

195.The Wise Quran: Have they feet with which they walk, or have they hands with which they hold, or have they eyes with which they see, or have they ears with which they hear? Say, 'Call upon your partners; then plot against me, and do not give me respite.

196.The Wise Quran: Indeed, my patron is God, who has sent down the Book, and He protects the righteous.

197.The Wise Quran: And those whom you call on besides Him are not able to help you, nor can they help themselves.'

198.The Wise Quran: And if you call them to the guidance they do not hear, and you may see them looking towards you, while they do not see.

199.The Wise Quran: Take to pardon, and order what is kind, and turn away from the ignorant;

200.The Wise Quran: And if an incitement from the devil incites you then seek refuge with God; Indeed, he is hearing, knowing.

201.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who fear God, when an evil thought touches them from the devil, they remember, and lo, they are those who see.

202.The Wise Quran: But their brothers they increase them in error, then they cease not.

203.The Wise Quran: And when you do not bring them a sign, they say, 'Why have you not chosen it?' Say, 'I only follow what is inspired to me from my Lord; this is insight from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.'

204.The Wise Quran: And when the Quran is read, then listen to it and be silent; perhaps you may obtain mercy.

205.The Wise Quran: And remember your Lord in yourself humbly and with fear, and without the loudness of the words, in the morning (After sunrise to mid-morning) and the evening (Mid-afternoon to sunset); and be not of the heedless.

206.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who are with your Lord are not proud for His service, and they glorify Him, and to Him they prostrate.

1.The Wise Quran: They ask you about the spoils. Say, 'The spoils are for God and the messenger.' So fear God and act righteously among yourselves and obey God and His messenger if you are believers.

2.The Wise Quran: The believers are only those who when God is mentioned, their hearts become afraid, and when His signs are recited to them, they increase them in faith; and on their Lord they rely;

3.The Wise Quran: Those who are steadfast in prayer, and of what We have provided them they spend.

4.The Wise Quran: Those, they in truth are the believers; for them are degrees with their Lord, and forgiveness, and a generous provision.

5.The Wise Quran: As your Lord brought you out from your house with the truth, and indeed a party of the believers were surely averse.

6.The Wise Quran: They wrangle with you about the truth after what was made clear, as though they were being driven to death while they were looking on.

7.The Wise Quran: And when God promised you that one of the two parties should be yours, and you wished that the one not armed should be yours; but God desired to prove the truth true by His words, and cut off the roots of the disbelievers.

8.The Wise Quran: To prove the truth true, and to make vain the vain, although the sinners are averse.

9.The Wise Quran: When you asked for succour from your Lord, and He answered you, 'Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand of the angels following closely behind.'

10.The Wise Quran: God made it only glad tidings and to quiet your hearts with it; and help is only from God. Indeed, God is mighty, wise.

11.The Wise Quran: When He covered you with drowsiness, a security from Him, and He sent down upon you from the sky water to purify you with it, and remove from you the uncleanness of the devil, and to strengthen your hearts and make firm your feet with it.

12.The Wise Quran: When your Lord inspired to the angels - 'Indeed, I am with you; so make firm those who believe; I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve, - so strike above the necks, and strike from them every finger.'

13.The Wise Quran: That, because they split from God and His messenger. And whoever splits from God and His messenger, then indeed, God is severe in punishment.

14.The Wise Quran: That, so taste it; and that for the disbelievers is the punishment of the fire.

15.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When you meet those who disbelieve in swarms, then do not turn to them the backs.

16.The Wise Quran: And whoever turns his back that day to them, except turning to fight or rallying to a troop, then certainly, he has returned with anger of God, and his abode is Hell, and evil is the destination.

17.The Wise Quran: And you did not slay them, but God slew them; and you threw not when you threw, but God threw, and to try the believers with a good trial from Him; indeed, God is hearing, knowing.

18.The Wise Quran: That, and that God weakens the plot of the disbelievers.

19.The Wise Quran: If you ask for victory, then certainly, the victory has come to you. And if you desist, then it is better for you; and if you return, We will return. And your troop will avail you nothing, even if it be numerous. And that God is with the believers.

20.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Obey God and His messenger, and do not turn away from Him while you hear.

21.The Wise Quran: And do not be like those who say, 'We hear,' while they do not hear.

22.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the worst of creatures in God's sight are the deaf, the dumb, those who are not intelligent.

23.The Wise Quran: And if God had known good in them, surely He would have made them hear; and if He had made them hear, surely they would have turned away, while they swerved aside.

24.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Respond to God and His messenger when He calls you to what gives you life; and know that God comes in between man and his heart; and that to Him you shall be gathered.

25.The Wise Quran: And fear a trial which will not befall especially those of you who have done wrong; and know that God is severe in punishment.

26.The Wise Quran: And remember when you were few and weak in the earth, fearing that the people would snatch you away; then He sheltered you and strengthened you with His help, and provided you of the good things; perhaps you may give thanks.

27.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not be treacherous to God and the messenger; nor be treacherous to your trusts while you know.

28.The Wise Quran: And know that your wealth and your children are a trial, and that God - with Him is a great reward.

29.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! If you fear God He will make for you a discrimination, and He will cover from you your evil deeds, and He will forgive you; and God is the possessor of great grace.

30.The Wise Quran: And when those who disbelieved plotted against you to confine you or kill you or drive you out; and they plot, and God plots, and God is the best of the plotters.

31.The Wise Quran: And when Our verses were recited to them they said, 'Verily, we have heard. Had we willed, surely we would have said the like of this; this is not except legends of the former people.'

32.The Wise Quran: And when they said, 'O God! If this is the truth from you, then rain upon us stones from the sky or bring us painful punishment.'

33.The Wise Quran: But God would not punish them while you are amongst them; and God would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.

34.The Wise Quran: But what ails them that God should not punish them while they hinder from the Sacred Mosque, and they are not its guardians; its guardians are only the pious, but most of them do not know.

35.The Wise Quran: And their prayer at the House was nothing but whistling and clapping. So taste the punishment for that you disbelieved.

36.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to hinder from the way of God; and soon they will spend it, then it shall be for them a regret, then they shall be overcome. And those who disbelieve to Hell they shall be gathered.

37.The Wise Quran: That God may distinguish the bad from the good, and put the bad, some of it on the other, and heap it all up together, and put it in Hell. Those they are the losers.

38.The Wise Quran: Say to those who disbelieve, if they desist, what verily is past will be forgiven them; but if they return, then verily the course of the ancients has passed.

39.The Wise Quran: And fight them until there is no sedition and the religion, all of it, is for God; but if they desist, then indeed, God sees what they do.

40.The Wise Quran: And if they turn away, then know that God is your sovereign; excellent is the sovereign and excellent is the helper.

41.The Wise Quran: And know that whatever thing you take as spoils, then that, to God belongs a fifth of it, and to the messenger and to the relatives and the orphans and the poor and the wayfarer; if you believe in God and what We have revealed to Our servant on the day of the discrimination, the day the two armies met and God is powerful over everything.

42.The Wise Quran: When you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the far side, and the camels were below you; and if you had made an appointment certainly you would have failed in the appointment. But that God might accomplish a matter which was to be done, that he who was to perish might perish with a clear proof; and that he who was to live might live with a clear proof; and indeed, God is hearing, knowing.

43.The Wise Quran: When God showed them to you in your dream as few, and if He had shown them to you as many, surely you would have been timid, and surely you would have quarrelled about the matter; but God saved; indeed, He knows what the breasts own.

44.The Wise Quran: And when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes; and He made you few in their eyes; that God might accomplish a matter that was to be done; and to God the matters return.

45.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When you meet a troop, then be firm and remember God much; perhaps you may prosper.

46.The Wise Quran: And obey God and His messenger, and do not quarrel so be timid, and your wind goes; and be patient, indeed, God is with the patient.

47.The Wise Quran: And do not be like those who went forth from their homes with insolence, and to be seen of mankind, and they hinder from the way of God, and God encompasses what they do.

48.The Wise Quran: And when the devil beautified their works to them and said, 'No one of mankind to conquer you today, and indeed, I am a neighbour for you.' And when the two troops came in sight of each other, he turned back on his heels and said, 'Indeed, I am clear of you. Indeed, I see what you do not see. Indeed, I fear God, and God is severe in punishment.'

49.The Wise Quran: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was sickness said, 'Their religion has deceived these.' But whoever relies on God, then indeed, God is mighty, wise.

50.The Wise Quran: And if you could see when the angels take away the souls of those who disbelieve; they strike their faces and their backs, 'And taste the punishment of the burning!

51.The Wise Quran: That is for what your hands have sent forth and that God is no unjust one to His servants.'

52.The Wise Quran: Like the custom of Pharaoh's people and those who were before them. They disbelieved in the signs of God, and God seized them in their sins; indeed, God is strong, severe in punishment.

53.The Wise Quran: That is because God is not one who changes a favour which He has bestowed on a people, until they change what is in themselves, and that God is hearing, knowing.

54.The Wise Quran: Like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those who were before them. They said the signs of their Lord were lies, so We destroyed them in their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh's people; and all were wrongdoers.

55.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the worst of creatures in God's sight are those who disbelieve and they will not believe;

56.The Wise Quran: Those with whom you make a covenant, then they break their covenant everytime, and they do not fear.

57.The Wise Quran: If you definitely find them in the war, then make those who are behind them run by them, perhaps they may remember.

58.The Wise Quran: And if you fear from a people treachery, then throw back to them equally; indeed, God does not love the treacherous.

59.The Wise Quran: Do not think those who disbelieve can outstrip. Indeed, they will not escape.

60.The Wise Quran: Prepare for them whatever of strength and of companies of horses you can, to terrify therewith the enemy of God, and your enemy, and others besides them whom you do not know God knows them. And whatever thing you spend in God's way it will be repaid to you in full; and you shall not be wronged.

61.The Wise Quran: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it, and rely on God; indeed, He is the hearing, the knowing.

62.The Wise Quran: And if they desire to deceive you, then indeed, God is enough for you. He is the one who strengthened you with His help and with the believers;

63.The Wise Quran: And He united their hearts. If you had spent what is in the earth all together you could not have united their hearts, but God united them, indeed, He is mighty, wise.

64.The Wise Quran: O prophet! God is sufficient for you, and whoever follows you of the believers.

65.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Urge the believers to fight. If there are of you twenty patient, they shall conquer two hundred; and if there are of you a hundred they shall conquer a thousand of those who disbelieved, because they are a people who do not understand.

66.The Wise Quran: Now God has lightened for you; and He knows that there is weakness in you: so if there are of you a patient hundred, they will conquer two hundred; and if there are of you a thousand, they will conquer two thousand, with the permission of God, and God is with the patient.

67.The Wise Quran: It is not for a prophet to have captives until he has slaughtered in the land. You desire to have the goods of the world, and God desires the hereafter; and God is mighty, wise.

68.The Wise Quran: If not for a book from God that had gone forth, surely there would have touched you, for what you took, a great punishment.

69.The Wise Quran: So eat of what spoils you have taken - lawful, good; and fear God, indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

70.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Say to whoever is in your hands of the captives, 'If God knows good in your hearts, He will give you better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and God is forgiving, compassionate.'

71.The Wise Quran: And if they desire to betray you, so certainly they have betrayed God before. But He has given power over them; and God is knowing, wise.

72.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believed and emigrated and strove with their wealth and their souls in God's way, and those who gave refuge and helped, those, some of them are patrons of some. But those who believed, and have not emigrated, nothing of their patronage is for you, until they emigrate. But if they seek your help in the religion, then help is due from you, except against a people between whom and you there is a covenant; and God sees what you do.

73.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve, some of them are patrons of some; if you do not do it there will be sedition in the earth, and great corruption.

74.The Wise Quran: And those who believed and emigrated and strove in the way of God, and those who gave refuge and helped, those they are the believers in truth. For them is forgiveness and a generous provision.

75.The Wise Quran: And those who believed afterwards and emigrated and strove with you, then those are of you; and the possessors of blood relationships, some of them are more worthy of some in the Book of God. Indeed, God knows all things.

1.The Wise Quran: An immunity from God and His messenger to those of the idolaters with whom you made a covenant.

2.The Wise Quran: So go about in the land for four months, and know that you cannot escape God, and that God disgraces the disbelievers.

3.The Wise Quran: And a proclamation from God and His messenger to the people on the day of the greater pilgrimage, that God and His messenger are free of the idolaters. So if you repent, then it is better for you; but if you turn away, then know that you cannot escape God. And give those who disbelieve glad tidings of painful punishment.

4.The Wise Quran: Except those of the idolaters with whom you have a covenant, then they have not failed you in anything, and have not backed up anyone against you. So fulfil to them their covenant to their term. Indeed, God loves those who fear.

5.The Wise Quran: Then when the sacred months have passed, then kill the idolaters wherever you find them; and take them, and besiege them, and sit in wait for them in every place of ambush; but if they repent, and are steadfast in prayer, and give alms, then let them go their way; Indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

6.The Wise Quran: And if anyone of the idolaters seek your protection then protect him, until he hears the words of God. Then let him reach his place of safety. That, because they are a people who do not know.

7.The Wise Quran: How can there be for the idolaters a covenant with God and with His messenger, except those with whom you made a covenant near the sacred mosque? So long as they go straight with you, go straight with them; indeed, God loves those who fear.

8.The Wise Quran: How, while if they prevail against you they observe not kinship nor clientship in you? They please you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse; and most of them are disobedient.

9.The Wise Quran: They barter God's signs for a little price, and they hinder from His way; indeed they, evil is what they used to do.

10.The Wise Quran: They observe not in a believer kinship nor clientship; and those, they are the transgressors.

11.The Wise Quran: But if they repent and are steadfast in prayer and give alms, then your brothers in religion. We detail the signs to a people who know.

12.The Wise Quran: And if they break their oaths after their covenant and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief; indeed, they have no oaths, perhaps they may desist.

13.The Wise Quran: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths, and intended to expel the messenger? And they began with you the first time, are you afraid of them? But God has more right that you should fear Him, if you are believers.

14.The Wise Quran: Fight them; God will punish them by your hands, and disgrace them, and help you against them, and heal the breasts of a people who believe;

15.The Wise Quran: And remove the rage from their hearts; and God relents on whom He wills; and God is knowing, wise.

16.The Wise Quran: Or do you reckon that you would be left, while God knows not those of you who strive, and do not take other than God, and His messenger and the believers as intimates? And God is aware of what you do.

17.The Wise Quran: It is not for idolaters to repair to the mosques of God, bearing witness against themselves of disbelief; those, their works are void, and in the fire they will abide forever.

18.The Wise Quran: He only shall repair to the mosques of God who believes in God and the Last Day, and is steadfast in prayer, and gives the alms, and fears only God; - then it may be that those will be of the guided.

19.The Wise Quran: Do you make the giving drink to the pilgrims and the repairing to the Sacred Mosque like one who believes in God and the Last Day, and strives in the way of God? They are not equal in God's sight, and God does not guide the unjust people.

20.The Wise Quran: Those who believed and emigrated and strove in the way of God, with their wealth and their souls, are greater in rank with God, and those, they are the successful.

21.The Wise Quran: Their Lord gives them glad tidings of mercy from Him, and pleasure; and gardens they shall have wherein is lasting pleasure,

22.The Wise Quran: Abiding therein forever. Indeed, God, with Him is a great reward.

23.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take your fathers and your brothers for patrons if they prefer disbelief over belief; and whoever of you takes them for patrons, then those, they are the unjust.

24.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If your fathers, and your sons, and your brothers, and your wives, and your tribe, and the wealth which you have gained, and the commerce which you fear may be slack, and the dwellings with which you are pleased are dearer to you than God and His messenger, and striving in His way, - then wait until God brings His command, and God does not guide the disobedient people.'

25.The Wise Quran: Certainly, God has helped you in many a place and on the day of Hunain when your multitude pleased you, but it availed you nothing, and the earth was straitened for you with its vastness; then you turned back, retreating.

26.The Wise Quran: Then God sent down His tranquillity upon His messenger and upon the believers; and sent down armies which you could not see, and punished those who disbelieved; and that is the reward of the disbelievers.

27.The Wise Quran: Then God relents after that on whom He wills, and God is forgiving, compassionate.

28.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! The idolaters only are unclean; so let them not come near the Sacred Mosque after this their year. And if you fear poverty, then soon God will enrich you from His grace if He wills; indeed, God is knowing, wise.

29.The Wise Quran: Fight those who do not believe in God and the Last Day, and do not forbid what God and His messenger have forbidden, and do not practice the religion of truth from those who have been given the Book, until they give the tribute out of hand while they are as little ones.

30.The Wise Quran: The Jews say, 'Ezra is the son of God.' And the Christians say, 'The Messiah is the son of God.' That is their saying with their mouths, they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before. God fight them. How are they turned away?

31.The Wise Quran: They take their scholars and their monks and the Messiah, the son of Mary, for lords besides God; and they were not commanded except to serve one God, there is no god but He; Glory be to Him, above what they associate.

32.The Wise Quran: They desire to extinguish the light of God with their mouths, but God refuses except to perfect His light, though the disbelievers are averse.

33.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sent His messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over every religion, though the idolaters are averse.

34.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Indeed, many of the scholars and the monks surely consume the wealth of mankind with falsehood, and they hinder from the way of God; And those who treasure up gold and silver and do not spend it in the way of God, so give them glad tidings of painful punishment.

35.The Wise Quran: The day it shall be heated in the fire of Hell, and their foreheads shall be branded with it, and their sides and their backs, 'This is what you treasured up for yourselves; so taste what you were treasuring.'

36.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the number of months with God is twelve months in God's Book, on the day He created the heavens and the earth; of it, four are sacred; that is the correct religion. So do not wrong yourselves in them. And fight the idolaters one and all, as they fight you one and all, and know that God is with those who fear.

37.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the postponing is an increase in disbelief, by it those who disbelieve go astray. They make it lawful one year, and they make it unlawful another year, that they may come to an understanding as to the number which God has made unlawful, and make lawful what God has made unlawful. Beautified for them is the evil of their deeds, and God does not guide the disbelieving people.

38.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! What ails you when it is said to you, 'Go forth in the way of God,' You sink down heavily to the earth? Are you pleased with the worldly life instead of the hereafter? But what is the provision of the worldly life in the hereafter except a little.

39.The Wise Quran: Unless you go forth He will punish you with painful punishment, and will replace you with a people other than you, and you cannot hurt Him at all, and God is powerful over everything.

40.The Wise Quran: Unless you help him - and certainly, God helped him, when those who disbelieved drove him out, the second of two. When they both were in the cave; when he said to his companion, 'Do not grieve, indeed, God is with us;' Then God sent down His tranquillity upon him, and strengthened him with hosts which you did not see, and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, and the word of God it is the highest; and God is mighty, wise.

41.The Wise Quran: Go forth light and heavy and strive with your wealth and your souls in God's way; that is better for you, if you know.

42.The Wise Quran: Were there near goods, and a moderate journey, surely they would have followed you; but the distance was too far for them; and they will swear by God, 'If we could, certainly we would have gone forth with you.' They destroy themselves, and God knows indeed they are surely liars.

43.The Wise Quran: God pardon you; why did you give permission to them until it was made manifest to you those who were truthful, and you knew the liars?

44.The Wise Quran: Those who believe in God and the Last Day would not ask your permission, that they strive with their wealth and their souls; and God knows those who fear.

45.The Wise Quran: Only those ask your permission who do not believe in God and the Last Day, and their hearts are in doubt, so they, in their doubt, hesitate.

46.The Wise Quran: Had they desired to go forth, surely they would have prepared for it a preparation; but God was averse to their rising up, so He made them halt, and it was said, 'Sit with those who sit.'

47.The Wise Quran: Had they gone forth with you they would not have increased you except in ruin and they would certainly have hurried about in your midst seeking for you sedition; and amongst you are those who would have listened to them; and God knows the wrongdoers.

48.The Wise Quran: Certainly they had sought sedition before and had upset affairs for you; until the truth came, and God's command was made manifest, while they were averse.

49.The Wise Quran: And of them is he who says, 'Permit me, and do not try me.' Lo, in the trial they have fallen. And indeed, Hell shall surely encompass the disbelievers.

50.The Wise Quran: If good befalls you, it grieves them and if a calamity befalls you they say, 'Verily, we took our affairs before,' And they turn away while they are rejoicing.

51.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Nothing shall befall us except what God has written down for us; He is our sovereign, and on God let the believers then rely.'

52.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Do you await for us except one of the two best things? While we await for you that God will afflict you with a punishment from Him or by our hands? So wait, indeed, we are waiting with you.'

53.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Spend willingly or unwillingly; it shall not be accepted from you. Indeed, you are a disobedient people.'

54.The Wise Quran: And nothing prevents their spending from being accepted from them except that they disbelieve in God and in His messenger, and they come not to prayer except while they are lazy, and they spend not except while they are averse.

55.The Wise Quran: So let not their wealth please you nor their children, God only desires to punish them with it in the worldly life, and that their souls may pass away while they are disbelievers.

56.The Wise Quran: And they swear by God, indeed, they surely are of you; while they are not of you, but they are a divisive people.

57.The Wise Quran: If they could find a refuge, or caves, or a place to enter, surely they would turn to it, while they are in haste.

58.The Wise Quran: And of them is he who defames you concerning the charities; then if they are given from it, they are pleased; and if they are not given from it, then they are displeased.

59.The Wise Quran: And if they were pleased with what God and His messenger gave them, and said, 'God is enough for us. Soon God will give us of His grace, and His messenger. Indeed, we to God are desiring.'

60.The Wise Quran: The charities are only for the needy, and the poor and those who work on it, and those whose hearts are being united, and in the necks, and those in debt, and in the way of God, and the wayfarer; - an ordinance from God, and God is knowing, wise.

61.The Wise Quran: And of them are those who hurt the prophet, and they say, 'He is an ear.' Say, 'An ear of good for you, he believes in God, believes the believers, and is a mercy to those of you who believe.' And those who hurt the messenger of God for them is painful punishment.

62.The Wise Quran: They swear by God to you to please you; and God and His messenger have more right that they should please Him, if they are believers.

63.The Wise Quran: Do they not know that he who opposes God and His messenger, then that for him is the fire of Hell, to dwell in it forever? That is great disgrace.

64.The Wise Quran: The hypocrites are cautious lest there be revealed against them a chapter to inform them of what is in their hearts; say, 'Mock! Indeed, God will bring out what you are cautious of.'

65.The Wise Quran: And if you ask them, surely they will say, 'We were only plunging into vain discourse and playing;' Say, 'Is it God and His signs, and His messenger, you were mocking?'

66.The Wise Quran: Make no excuse. Verily, you have disbelieved after your belief; if We forgive one party of you, We will punish another party, for that they were sinners.

67.The Wise Quran: The hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, some of them are of some, they bid what is wrong and forbid what is right, and they clench their hands. They forget God, and He forgets them. Indeed, the hypocrites, they are the disobedient.

68.The Wise Quran: God has promised the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women and the disbelievers, Hell-fire, to dwell in it forever; it is enough for them. And God has cursed them, and for them is enduring punishment.

69.The Wise Quran: Like those who were before you. They were mightier than you in strength and more abundant in wealth and children; so they enjoyed their portion, and you enjoy your portion, as those before you enjoyed their portion; and you have plunged into vain discourse like the one who plunged into vain discourse. Those, their works are void in the world and the hereafter, and those, they are the losers.

70.The Wise Quran: Has there not come to them the news of those who were before them, the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud, and the people of Abraham and the companions of Midian and the overturned cities? Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs; and God was not to wrong them, but they were wronging themselves.

71.The Wise Quran: And the believers, men and women, some of them are patrons of some; they bid what is reasonable, and forbid what is wrong, and they are steadfast in the prayer, and give the alms, and obey God and His messenger. Those, God will have mercy on them. Indeed, God is mighty, wise.

72.The Wise Quran: God has promised the believers, men and women, gardens beneath which rivers flow; to dwell in it forever; and good dwellings in gardens of Eden, but the pleasure of God is greater. That, it is the great success.

73.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them; and their abode is Hell, and evil is the destination.

74.The Wise Quran: They swear by God they did not speak, and certainly they spoke the word of disbelief; and they disbelieved after their submission, and they intended what they could not attain; and they took not vengeance except that God and His messenger enriched them of His grace. So if they repent, it is better for them, and if they turn away, God will punish them with a painful punishment in the world and the hereafter. And they shall not have in the earth any patron nor helper.

75.The Wise Quran: And of them is he who made a covenant with God, 'If He gives us of His grace, surely we will give charity and we will surely be among the righteous.'

76.The Wise Quran: But when He gave them of His grace, they were stingy with it and turned away and they swerved aside.

77.The Wise Quran: So He has made the consequence hypocrisy in their hearts to the day they shall meet Him, because they failed God in what they promised Him, and because they used to lie.

78.The Wise Quran: Do they not know that God knows their secret and their secret discourse, and that God knows the unseen?

79.The Wise Quran: Those who defame those of the believers who give the charities willingly and those who find not except their effort, and who mock them, God mocks them and for them is painful punishment.

80.The Wise Quran: Ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them. If you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, God will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in God and His messenger, and God does not guide the disobedient people.

81.The Wise Quran: Those who were left behind rejoiced in their sitting behind God's messenger, and were averse to striving with their wealth and their souls in God's way, and they said, 'Do not go forth in the heat.' Say, 'The fire of Hell is more intense heat,' If they were to understand.

82.The Wise Quran: So let them laugh a little, and let them weep much, a recompense for what they have earned.

83.The Wise Quran: So if God returns you to a party of them, and they ask your permission to go out, then say, 'You shall not go out with me ever, and you shall not fight an enemy with me. Indeed, you were pleased with sitting the first time, so sit with those who stay behind.'

84.The Wise Quran: And do not pray over anyone of them who dies ever, nor stand over his grave. Indeed, they disbelieved in God and His messenger and died while they were disobedient.

85.The Wise Quran: And let not their wealth and their children please you, God only desires to punish them with it in the world, and their souls pass away while they are disbelievers.

86.The Wise Quran: And when a chapter is sent down, 'Believe in God and strive with His messenger,' Those who have the means among them ask your permission and say, 'Leave us to be with those who sit.'

87.The Wise Quran: They are pleased to be with those who stay behind. And a stamp is set upon their hearts so they do not understand.

88.The Wise Quran: But the messenger and those who believe with him strive with their wealth and their souls; and those, for them are the good things; and those, they are the prosperous.

89.The Wise Quran: God has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell in it forever; that is the great success.

90.The Wise Quran: And those who make excuses among the Bedouins came that permission be granted to them, and those who lied to God and His messenger sat. There shall befall those of them who disbelieved, a painful punishment.

91.The Wise Quran: On the weak, and on the sick, and on those who cannot find what to spend there is no straitness when they are sincere to God and His messenger. There is no way against the good-doers. And God is forgiving, compassionate.

92.The Wise Quran: Nor on those to whom, when they came to you that you should provide them with mounts, you said, 'I cannot find what to mount you on,' They turned away while their eyes poured forth with tears of grief that they could not find what to spend.

93.The Wise Quran: The way is only on those who ask your permission while they are rich; they are pleased to be with those who stay behind, and God has set a stamp on their hearts, so they do not know.

94.The Wise Quran: They will make excuses to you when you return to them. Say, 'Make no excuse, we will not believe you. Verily, God has informed us of your news. And God sees your works and His messenger; then you will be brought back to Him who knows the unseen and the seen; and He will inform you of what you used to do.'

95.The Wise Quran: They will swear to you by God when you return to them, that you may turn away from them. So turn away from them, indeed, they are unclean, and their abode is Hell, a recompense for what they have earned.

96.The Wise Quran: They swear to you that you may be pleased with them. But if you are pleased with them, then indeed, God is not pleased with the disobedient people.

97.The Wise Quran: The Bedouins are stronger in disbelief and hypocrisy and are more likely not to know the limits of what God has sent down on His messenger; and God is knowing, wise.

98.The Wise Quran: And of the Bedouins is he who takes what He spends as a debt, and awaits turns of fortune for you. Upon them will be the evil turn; God is hearing, knowing.

99.The Wise Quran: And of the Bedouins is he who believes in God and the Last Day, and takes what he spends as a means of nearness with God and the prayers of the messenger; lo, indeed, it is a means of nearness for them. God will make them enter into His mercy; indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

100.The Wise Quran: And the foremost, the first of the emigrants, and the helpers, and those who followed them in goodness, God is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him; and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell in it forever; that is the great success.

101.The Wise Quran: And among those around you of the Bedouins are hypocrites, and of the people of Al Madinah; they persist in hypocrisy; you do not know them, We, We know them. We will punish them twice, then they will be returned to a great punishment.

102.The Wise Quran: And others have confessed their sins. They have mixed a righteous deed with other evil. It may be that God will relent on them; indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

103.The Wise Quran: Take of their wealth charity to cleanse them and to purify them thereby; and pray for them; indeed, your prayer is a repose for them; and God is hearing, knowing.

104.The Wise Quran: Do they not know that God: He accepts the repentance from His servants, and takes the charities; and that God, He is the Relenting, the Compassionate.

105.The Wise Quran: And say, 'Work; and God will see your work, and His messenger, and the believers, and you will be brought back to the knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'

106.The Wise Quran: And others are put off to the command of God; whether He will punish them, or whether He will relent on them; and God is knowing, wise.

107.The Wise Quran: And those who have taken a mosque for harm, and for disbelief, and for division amongst the believers, and for an ambush for whoever warred against God and His messenger before. And surely they will swear, 'We desired not except good;' And God bears witness indeed, they are surely liars.

108.The Wise Quran: Do not stand in it ever. Certainly a mosque founded on piety from the first day has more right that you should stand in it. In it are men who love to be clean; and God loves the clean.

109.The Wise Quran: Then is he who founded his building on the fear and pleasure of God better, or he who founded his building on the edge of a crumbling precipice, so it crumbles with him into the fire of Hell? And God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

110.The Wise Quran: Their building which they built will not cease to be doubt in their hearts except their hearts are cut. And God is knowing, wise.

111.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God has bought from the believers their souls and their wealth, because for them is the Garden. They fight in the way of God, and they slay and they are slain. A true promise upon Him, in the Torah and the Gospel and the Quran; and who fulfils His covenant than God? So rejoice in your sale which you have made with Him. And that, it is the great success.

112.The Wise Quran: Those who repent, those who worship, those who praise, those who fast, those who bow down, those who prostrate, those who bid what is right and those who forbid what is wrong, and those who guard the limits of God, - And give glad tidings to those who believed.

113.The Wise Quran: It is not for the prophet and those who believe to ask forgiveness for the idolaters, even though they are relatives, after what has been made manifest to them, that they are the fellows of Hell.

114.The Wise Quran: And Abraham asking forgiveness for his father was only because of a promise which he had promised him; but when it was made manifest to him that he was an enemy to God, he disowned him; indeed, Abraham was compassionate, clement.

115.The Wise Quran: And God will not lead astray a people after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should fear. Indeed, God knows all things.

116.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; He gives life and He gives death; and you have not besides God a patron nor helper.

117.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly God has relented on the prophet and the emigrants, and the helpers, those who followed him in the hour of difficulty, after the hearts of a party of them had almost deviated; then He relented on them; indeed, with them He is pitying, compassionate.

118.The Wise Quran: And to the three of those who were left behind, until when the earth, with its vastness, was straitened for them, and their souls were straitened for them, and they thought that there was no refuge from God except to Him. Then He relented on them that they may repent; indeed, God, He is the Relenting, the Compassionate.

119.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Fear God and be with those who are truthful.

120.The Wise Quran: It was not for the people of Al Madinah, and those around them of the Bedouins, to stay behind the messenger of God and to prefer their souls to his soul: That is because neither thirst, nor fatigue, nor hunger befell them in God's way, nor do they step a step enraging the disbelievers, nor attain from an enemy an attainment, except a righteous deed is thereby written for them. Indeed, God does not waste the reward of the good-doers.

121.The Wise Quran: Nor do they spend an expenditure, small or great, nor do they cross a valley except it is written for them, that God may reward them the best of what they used to do.

122.The Wise Quran: And it is not for the believers to march forth one and all; and if a troop of every division of them march not forth, that they may obtain understanding in the religion, and that they may warn their people when they return to them, that perhaps they may beware.

123.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Fight those who are near to you of the disbelievers, and let them find sternness in you; and know that God is with those who fear.

124.The Wise Quran: And whenever a chapter is sent down, of them are those who say, 'Which of you has this increased in faith?' Then as for those who believed, it increases them in faith, and they rejoice.

125.The Wise Quran: And as for those in whose hearts is sickness, it adds uncleanness to their uncleanness, and they die while they are disbelievers.

126.The Wise Quran: Do they not see that they are tried in every year once or twice? Then they do not repent and they do not they remember.

127.The Wise Quran: And whenever a chapter is sent down, some of them look at others - 'Does any one see you?' - Then they turn away. God has turned away their hearts because they are a people who do not understand.

128.The Wise Quran: Certainly there has come to you a messenger from yourselves; mighty on him is what distresses you; eager over you, with the believers, pitying, compassionate.

129.The Wise Quran: But if they turn away, then say, 'God is enough for me, there is no god but He, on Him do I rely, and He is the Lord of the great throne.'

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Ra. Those are the signs of the Wise Book.

2.The Wise Quran: Is it a wonder to mankind that We inspired to a man from them that, 'Warn mankind and give glad tidings to those who believe that they have a true footing with their Lord'? The disbelievers say, 'Indeed, this is surely a clear magician.'

3.The Wise Quran: Indeed, your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days; then He made for the throne, to govern the affair; there is no intercessor, except after His permission. That is God, your Lord, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?

4.The Wise Quran: To Him is your return all together. God's promise is true; indeed, He begins the creation then He repeats it, that He may recompense those who believe and do good works with justice; but those who disbelieve, for them is a drink of hot water, and painful punishment, for that they disbelieved.

5.The Wise Quran: He is the one who made the sun a light, and the moon a light, and decreed for it mansions, that you may know the number of the years and the reckoning; God did not create that except with the truth. He details the signs to a people who know.

6.The Wise Quran: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day, and what God has created in the heavens and the earth, are signs to a people who fear.

7.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who do not hope for Our meeting, and are pleased with the worldly life, and are at ease with it, and those who, they are heedless of Our signs,

8.The Wise Quran: Those, their abode is the fire for what they have earned.

9.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believe and do good works, their Lord guides them by their faith; beneath them shall rivers flow in the Gardens of pleasure.

10.The Wise Quran: Their call therein shall be, 'Glory be to You, O God.' And their salutation therein shall be, 'Peace.' And the end of their call shall be, 'Praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.'

11.The Wise Quran: And if God should hasten for mankind the bad as they would hasten the good, their term would surely be fulfilled to them. But We will leave those who do not hope for Our meeting in their immoderation, blindly wandering.

12.The Wise Quran: And when distress touches man, he calls Us to his side or sitting or standing; but when We have removed from him his distress, he passes on as though he had not called on Us to a distress that touched him. Thus is beautified to the extravagant what they used to do.

13.The Wise Quran: And verily, We destroyed the generations before you when they did wrong, and there came to them their messengers with the clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus We reward the sinful people.

14.The Wise Quran: Then We made you vicegerents in the earth after them, that We may see how you do.

15.The Wise Quran: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear proofs, those who hope not for Our meeting say, 'Bring a Quran other than this; or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me that change it from the direction of my soul; I do not follow except what is inspired to me; indeed, I fear, if I rebel against my Lord, the punishment of a great day.'

16.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If God had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you. Verily, I have tarried a lifetime amongst you before it; so will you not become intelligent?'

17.The Wise Quran: And who is more unjust than he who forges against God a lie, or says His signs are lies? Indeed, the sinners shall not prosper.

18.The Wise Quran: And they serve besides God what neither harms them nor profits them, and they say, 'These are our intercessors with God.' Say, 'Do you inform God of what He does not know in the heavens and the earth? Glory be to Him and high is He above what they associate.

19.The Wise Quran: And mankind was not except one nation, then they disagreed; and if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, surely it would have been decided between them concerning that in which they disagree.

20.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'Why is a sign not sent down on him from his Lord?' So say, 'The unseen is only for God; so wait, indeed, I am with you of those who wait.'

21.The Wise Quran: And when We have let mankind taste mercy after distress has touched them, lo, they have a plot against Our signs. Say, God is more swift in plotting.' Indeed, Our messengers write down what you plot.

22.The Wise Quran: He is the one who makes you travel in the land and the sea, until when you are in the ships - and they sail with them with a good wind, and they rejoice in it, there comes to it a violent wind, and there comes to them the wave from every place, and they think that they are encompassed with them; they call on God, sincere in religion to Him, 'If you save us from this, we will surely be of those who thank.'

23.The Wise Quran: But when He has saved them, lo, they are insolent in the earth without right. O mankind! Your insolence is only against yourselves; the provision of the worldly life, then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you have done.

24.The Wise Quran: The similitude of the worldly life is only like water which We send down from the sky, and the plants of the earth, from which men and cattle eat are mingled with it; until when the earth takes its gilding and is adorned, and its people think that they have power over it. Our command comes to it by night or day, and We make it mown down - as though it had not yesterday been rich. - Thus We detail the signs to a people who reflect.

25.The Wise Quran: And God calls to the abode of peace, and He guides whom He wills to the straight way.

26.The Wise Quran: For those who do good is the best and an increase. And neither darkness nor abasement shall cover their faces. Those are the fellows of the Garden, they shall dwell in it for ever.

27.The Wise Quran: And those who have earned evil deeds, the recompense of an evil deed is like it; and abasement shall cover them. They shall not have any defender from God; as though their faces were veiled with pieces from the darkness of night; those are the fellows of the fire, they shall dwell in it for ever.

28.The Wise Quran: And the day We gather them all together then We will say to those who associated partners, 'Your place, you and your partners.' And We will part them; and their partners will say, 'Not us you were serving.

29.The Wise Quran: And God sufficed for a witness between us and you, that we were certainly heedless of your service.'

30.The Wise Quran: There every soul shall test what it did previously; and they shall be returned to God, their sovereign, the Truth, and there shall go astray from them what they were forging.

31.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who has power over hearing and sight? And who brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living? And who governs the affair?' And they will say, 'God.' Then say, 'Do you not then fear?'

32.The Wise Quran: That then is God, your Lord, the Truth. And what is there after the truth but error? How then are you turned away?

33.The Wise Quran: Thus is the word of your Lord proved true upon those who disobeyed, that they do not believe.

34.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Is there of your associates who originates creation, then repeats it?' Say, 'God originates creation, then repeats it. So how are you turned away?

35.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Is there of your associates who guides to the truth?' Say, 'God guides to the truth.' Is then He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed, or he who guides not except he is guided? What ails you then, how do you judge?

36.The Wise Quran: And most of them follow only conjecture; indeed, conjecture does not avail against the truth at all; indeed, God knows what they do.

37.The Wise Quran: And this Quran could not have been forged apart from God; but it verifies that which was before it, and details the Book, - there is no doubt in it, - from the Lord of the worlds.

38.The Wise Quran: Or they say, 'He has forged it.' Say, 'Then bring a chapter like it, and call whoever you can besides God, if you are truthful.'

39.The Wise Quran: Nay, they call that a lie, the knowledge of which they cannot encompass and its interpretation has not yet come to them; Thus denied those before them, then see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

40.The Wise Quran: And of them is he who believes in it; and of them is he who does not believe in it; and your Lord knows best of the corrupters.

41.The Wise Quran: But if they call you liar, then say, 'I have my work, and you have your work; you are clear of what I work, and I am clear of what you work.'

42.The Wise Quran: And of them are those who listen to you, but can you make the deaf hear, even though they are not intelligent?

43.The Wise Quran: And of them are those who look at you, but can you guide the blind, though they do not see?

44.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God does not wrong mankind at all; but mankind wrong themselves.

45.The Wise Quran: And the day He will gather them, as though they had not tarried except an hour of the day, they shall know each other. Lost are those who called the meeting with God a lie, and were not guided.

46.The Wise Quran: And whether We show you some of that which We promise them or We take you in death, then to Us is their return, then God is witness over what they do.

47.The Wise Quran: And for every nation, a messenger; and when their messenger comes, it is decided between them with justice, and they are not wronged.

48.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you are truthful?'

49.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I have no power over harm nor profit to myself, except what God wills. For every nation is a term; when their term comes, then they cannot delay it for an hour nor bring it on.'

50.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen? If His punishment comes to you by night or by day, what of it do the sinners seek to hasten?'

51.The Wise Quran: Is it then when it has fallen you will believe in it? Now? And certainly you were seeking to hasten it.

52.The Wise Quran: Then it shall be said to those who have done wrong, 'Taste the punishment of eternity. Are you recompensed except for what you used to earn?'

53.The Wise Quran: And they ask you to inform, 'Is it true?' Say, 'Yes, by my Lord. Indeed, it is surely true, and you cannot escape.'

54.The Wise Quran: And if every soul that has done wrong had whatever is in the earth, it would give it as a ransom. They will display repentance when they see the punishment; and it shall be decided between them with justice, and they shall not be wronged.

55.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed, what is in the heavens and the earth is for God. Lo, indeed, the promise of God is true. But most of them do not know.

56.The Wise Quran: He gives life and gives death, and to Him you will be returned.

57.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Verily there has come to you a warning from your Lord, and a healing for what is in the breasts, and a guidance and a mercy to the believers.

58.The Wise Quran: Say, 'In the grace of God and in His mercy, so in that let them rejoice.' It is better than what they collect.

59.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen what God has sent down for you of provision, and you have made of it unlawful and lawful?' Say, 'Does God permit you, or do you forge against God?'

60.The Wise Quran: And what will those who forge the lie against God think on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed, God is surely Lord of grace to mankind, but most of them do not give thanks.

61.The Wise Quran: And you are not in any affair, nor do you recite of it any Quran, nor do you do any work, except We are witnesses over you when you are engaged in it; nor does the weight of an atom escape from your Lord in the earth nor in the heaven; nor is there smaller than that or greater, but in a clear Book.

62.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed, the patrons of God, no fear shall be upon them nor shall they grieve, -

63.The Wise Quran: Those who believe and fear, -

64.The Wise Quran: For them are glad tidings in the worldly life and in the hereafter; there is no change to the words of God. That, it is the great success.

65.The Wise Quran: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, the glory belongs altogether to God; He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

66.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed, to God belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth. And those who call on other than God do not follow associates. They follow not except conjecture, and they do not except lie.

67.The Wise Quran: He is the one who made for you the night, that you may rest in it, and the day to see; indeed, in that surely are signs to a people who hear.

68.The Wise Quran: They say, 'God has taken a son.' Glory be to Him. He is the Rich. His is whatever is in the heavens, and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say against God what you do not know?

69.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, those who forge against God the lie shall not prosper.'

70.The Wise Quran: A provision in the world, then to Us is their return, then We will make them taste the severe punishment for that they disbelieved.

71.The Wise Quran: Recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, 'O my people! If my stay is grievous on you, and my reminding of the signs of God, then on God I rely. So put together your affair and your associates; then let not your affair be in doubt for you; then decide unto me, and do not give me respite.

72.The Wise Quran: And if you turn away, then I have not asked you for any reward; my reward is only on God, and I am commanded to be of those who submit.'

73.The Wise Quran: But they called him a liar; so We saved him, and those who were with him in the ship; and We made them vicegerents, and We drowned those who said Our signs were lies; then see how was the end of those who were warned.

74.The Wise Quran: Then We raised up after him messengers to their people, and they came to them with the clear proofs; but they were not to believe in what they had called a lie before. Thus We set a stamp on the hearts of the transgressors.

75.The Wise Quran: Then We raised up after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs; but they were proud, and were a sinful people;

76.The Wise Quran: And when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'Indeed, this is surely clear magic.'

77.The Wise Quran: Moses said, 'Do you say to the truth when it comes to you? Is this magic? But magicians shall not prosper.'

78.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers upon, and you two may have grandeur in the land? And we will not believe you two.'

79.The Wise Quran: And Pharaoh said, 'Bring me every knowing magician.'

80.The Wise Quran: And when the magicians came, Moses said to them, 'Throw down what you have to throw.'

81.The Wise Quran: And when they threw down, Moses said, 'What you have brought is magic. Indeed, God will soon make it vain; indeed, God rights not the work of those who do corruption.

82.The Wise Quran: And God verifies the truth by His words, though the sinners are averse.'

83.The Wise Quran: But none believed Moses, except offspring of his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their chiefs; lest he should afflict them. And indeed, Pharaoh was high in the earth, and indeed, he was of the extravagant.

84.The Wise Quran: And Moses said, 'O my people! If you believe in God, then rely on Him, if you are those who submit.'

85.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Upon God we rely. Our Lord! Do not make us a trial for the wrong doing people.

86.The Wise Quran: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.'

87.The Wise Quran: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, 'Settle for your people in Egypt houses; and make your houses a direction of prayer; and be steadfast in prayer, and give glad tidings to the believers.'

88.The Wise Quran: And Moses said, 'Our Lord! Indeed, You have given Pharaoh and his chiefs adornment and wealth in the worldly life; our Lord! That they may err from Your way. Our Lord! Obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so they do not believe until they see the painful punishment.'

89.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Verily, your call is answered; so go straight you two, and do not follow the way of those who do not know.'

90.The Wise Quran: And We brought the children of Israel across the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts followed them in insolence and enmity, until when the drowning overtook him, he said, 'I believe that there is no god but He in whom the children of Israel believe; and I am of the Muslims.'

91.The Wise Quran: 'Now? And verily, you rebelled before and you were of those who do corruption;

92.The Wise Quran: So today We will save you in your body, that you may be a sign to whoever is behind you, and indeed, many of mankind are surely heedless of Our signs.'

93.The Wise Quran: And verily, We settled the children of Israel a true settlement, and We provided them of the good things; and they did not disagree until the knowledge came to them. Indeed, your Lord shall decide between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they were disagreeing.

94.The Wise Quran: And if you are in doubt of what We have sent down to you, then ask those who read the Book before you; indeed, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so do not be of those who doubt.

95.The Wise Quran: And do not be of those who say the signs of God are lies, then you will be of those who lose.

96.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those upon whom your Lord's word is proved true will not believe,

97.The Wise Quran: Even though every sign comes to them, until they see the painful punishment.

98.The Wise Quran: And if it were not so, a city would have believed and its faith would have profited it. Except the people of Jonah; when they believed We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life, and We gave them provision for a time.

99.The Wise Quran: And if your Lord had willed, whoever is in the earth surely would have believed, all of them, all together; will you then force mankind until they become believers?

100.The Wise Quran: It is not for a soul to believe except with the permission of God; and He puts uncleanness on those who are not intelligent.

101.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Behold what is in the heavens and the earth.' But signs and warners do not avail a people who do not believe.

102.The Wise Quran: So do they wait except for the like of the days of those who passed away before them?' Say, 'Then wait. Indeed, I am with you of those who wait.'

103.The Wise Quran: Then We will save Our messengers and those who believe; thus is it due on us to save the believers.

104.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O mankind! If you are in doubt of my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve besides God; but I serve God, who causes you to die. And I am commanded to be of the believers.'

105.The Wise Quran: And, 'Make steadfast your face to the religion, upright, and do not be of the idolaters;

106.The Wise Quran: And call not, besides God, on what can neither profit you nor harm you. But if you do, indeed, you are then of the unjust.'

107.The Wise Quran: And if God touches you with harm, then there is none to remove it except He; and if He desires good for you, then there is none to repel His grace; He makes it fall on whom He wills of His servants; and He is the Forgiving, the Compassionate.

108.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O mankind! Verily the truth has come to you from your Lord. And he who is guided, then he is guided only for his soul; and he who errs, then he errs only against it; and I am not a trustee over you.'

109.The Wise Quran: And follow what is inspired to you, and be patient until God judges, and He is the best of the wise ones.

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Ra. A book, its signs are confirmed then detailed, from one wise, aware:

2.The Wise Quran: That you not worship except God, - indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a herald of glad tidings;

3.The Wise Quran: And that: ‘Seek forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him. He will cause you to enjoy a good provision to a named term, and He will give His grace to all possessors of grace. And if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great day.

4.The Wise Quran: To God is your return, and He is powerful over all things.’

5.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed they fold up their breasts, that they may hide from Him. Lo, when they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they conceal and what they display. Indeed, He knows what the breasts own.

6.The Wise Quran: And there is no creature in the earth but upon God is its provision. And He knows its settlement and its resting-place; all is in a clear Book.

7.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and His throne was on the water, that He might try you, which of you is best in deeds. But if you say, 'Indeed, you will be raised up after death,' Those who disbelieve will surely say, 'This is not except clear magic.'

8.The Wise Quran: And surely if We keep back from them the punishment to a numbered nation, they will surely say, 'What detains it?' Lo, the day it comes to them there is no turning it away from them, and what they mocked at will encompass them.

9.The Wise Quran: And surely if We make man taste mercy from us then We remove it from him, indeed, he is surely despairing, ungrateful;

10.The Wise Quran: And surely if We make him taste favour after distress has touched him, he will surely, definitely say, 'The evils have gone from me;' Indeed, he is surely exultant, boastful.

11.The Wise Quran: Except those who are patient and do good works; those, for them is forgiveness and a great reward.

12.The Wise Quran: Then perhaps you are leaving some of what is inspired to you and your breast is straitened by it that they say, 'Why is not a treasure sent down on him? Or an angel come with him? You are only a warner, and God is over everything a trustee.

13.The Wise Quran: Or they say, 'He has forged it.' Say, 'Then bring ten forged chapters like it; and call upon whom you can besides God, if you are truthful.'

14.The Wise Quran: And if they do not answer you, then know that it is revealed by the knowledge of God, and that there is no god but He. So are you those who submit?

15.The Wise Quran: Whoever desires the worldly life and its adornment, We will pay them in full their works therein, and they therein shall have no diminution.

16.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones for whom there is nothing in the hereafter except the fire; and void is what they made therein and vain is what they used to do.

17.The Wise Quran: Then is he who is upon a clear proof from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it, and before it is the book of Moses, a model and a mercy? Those believe in it; and whoever disbelieves in it of the confederates, then the fire is his promise. So do not be in doubt of it; indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of mankind do not believe.

18.The Wise Quran: And who is more unjust than he who forges against God a lie? Those shall be set before their Lord, and the witnesses shall say, 'These are those who lied against their Lord.' Lo, God's curse is on the unjust

19.The Wise Quran: Those who hinder from the way of God, and seek to make it crooked, and they are disbelievers in the hereafter.

20.The Wise Quran: Those cannot escape in the earth, and they have no patrons besides God. Doubled for them is the punishment. They could not hear, nor did they see.

21.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones who lose themselves; and what they forged has gone astray from them.

22.The Wise Quran: No doubt that in the hereafter, they are those who lose most.

23.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believed and did good works, and humbled themselves to their Lord, those are the fellows of the Garden; they shall dwell therein forever.

24.The Wise Quran: The similitude of the two parties is as the blind and the deaf, and the seeing and the hearing; Are they equal in similitude? Then will you not remember?

25.The Wise Quran: And certainly We sent Noah to his people, 'Indeed, I am to you a clear warner;

26.The Wise Quran: That you not worship except God. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.'

27.The Wise Quran: But the chiefs of those who disbelieved of his people said, 'We see you not but a mortal like us, and we do not see any follow you except those who they are the reprobates amongst us by a rash judgment; and we do not see you have any grace over us; nay, we think you are liars.'

28.The Wise Quran: He said, 'O my people! Have you seen if I am on a clear proof from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, but you are blinded to it; shall we force you to it while you are averse to it?

29.The Wise Quran: O my people! I ask of you no wealth for it; my reward is only upon God. And I will not drive away those who believe. Indeed, they shall meet their Lord. But I see you a people who are ignorant.

30.The Wise Quran: And, O my people! Who would help me against God if I drive them away? Then will you not remember?

31.The Wise Quran: I do not say to you, "With me are the treasures of God," nor "I know the unseen," and I do not say, "Indeed, I am an angel;" nor do I say for those whom your eyes despise, "God will not give them good;" - God knows best what is in their souls - indeed, I then will surely be of the unjust.'

32.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O Noah! Certainly you have wrangled with us, and multiplied wranglings with us; so bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful.'

33.The Wise Quran: He said, 'God will only bring it on you if He wills, and you cannot escape;

34.The Wise Quran: And my advice will not profit you, should I desire to advise you, if God desires to lead you into error. He is your Lord, and to Him you shall be returned.'

35.The Wise Quran: Or do they say, 'He has forged it'? Say, 'If I have forged it, then on me is my sin. But I am clear of what sins you do.'

36.The Wise Quran: And it was inspired to Noah that, 'None shall believe from your people except he who has believed already; so do not sorrow for what they do.

37.The Wise Quran: And make the ship under Our eyes, and Our inspiration; and do not address Me concerning those who have done wrong; indeed, they shall be drowned.'

38.The Wise Quran: And he made the ship, and everytime the chiefs of his people passed by him, they jested at him. He said, 'If you jest at us, then indeed, we shall jest at you as you jest,

39.The Wise Quran: And soon you shall know to whom a punishment will come which shall shame him, and on whom there shall alight a lasting punishment.'

40.The Wise Quran: Until when Our command came, and the oven boiled, We said, 'Load in it two of every pair, and your family - except him against whom the saying has preceded, and whoever believes.' And there believed not with him except a few.

41.The Wise Quran: And he said, 'Ride in it; In the name of God is its course, and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is certainly forgiving, compassionate.'
