42.The Wise Quran: And it sailed with them in waves like mountains; and Noah cried to his son - and he was apart, 'O my son! Ride with us and do not be with the disbelievers.'

43.The Wise Quran: He said, 'I will soon take refuge to a mountain which shall defend me from the water.' He said, 'There is no defender today from the command of God, except him on whom He has mercy.' And the waves came between them, and he was of the drowned.

44.The Wise Quran: And it was said, 'O earth! Swallow your water!' And, 'O heaven! Hold!' And the water abated; and the affair was decided, and it settled on Al-Judi, and it was said, 'Away with the unjust people!'

45.The Wise Quran: And Noah called to his Lord and said, 'My Lord! Indeed, my son is of my family, and indeed, your promise is true, and you are the wisest of the wise ones.'

46.The Wise Quran: He said, 'O Noah! Indeed, he is not of your family; indeed, it is a deed not right. So do not ask Me what you have no knowledge of. Indeed, I admonish you lest you be of the ignorant.'

47.The Wise Quran: He said, 'My Lord! Indeed, I seek refuge with you from asking you what I do not have knowledge of. And unless you forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be of the losers.'

48.The Wise Quran: It was said, 'O Noah! Go down with peace from Us and blessings on you and on the nations of those with you; and nations We will soon give enjoyment, then there shall touch them from Us a painful punishment.'

49.The Wise Quran: That is of the news of the unseen, which We inspire to you. You did not know it, nor did your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the end is for those who fear.

50.The Wise Quran: And to 'Ad their brother Hud. He said, 'O my people! Serve God; you have no god other than Him. You are not except forgers.

51.The Wise Quran: O my people! I ask you no reward for it; my reward is only from Him who originated me; so will you not become intelligent?

52.The Wise Quran: And O my people! Ask forgiveness of your Lord; then repent to Him; He will send the sky upon you pouring abundantly; and He will increase you in strength to your strength; And do not then turn away, sinners.'

53.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O Hud! You have not come to us with a clear proof; and we will not leave our gods for your saying, and we are not believers in you.

54.The Wise Quran: We only say some of our gods have attacked you with evil.' He said, 'Indeed, I call God to witness, and you bear witness that I am free from what you associate

55.The Wise Quran: Besides Him. So plot against me all together, then give me no respite.

111.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly there is in their story a lesson for possessors of understanding. It was not a forged narration, but a verification of what was before it, and a detailing of everything, and a guide and a mercy to a people who believe.

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Mim.Ra. Those are the signs of the Book, and that which is sent down to you from your Lord is the truth; but most of mankind do not believe.

2.The Wise Quran: God is the one who raised up the heavens without columns that you see; then He made for the throne, and subjected the sun and the moon; each one runs on to a named term; He governs the affair, He details the signs; perhaps you will be sure of the meeting with your Lord.

3.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who stretched out the earth and placed in it firm mountains and rivers, and of all the fruits He made in it pairs. He covers the night with the day; - indeed, in that surely are signs for a people who reflect.

4.The Wise Quran: And in the earth are neighbouring tracts, and gardens of grapes and corn and palms growing together and not growing together; they are watered with one water, and We make some of them excel over some in the fruit; indeed, in that surely are signs for a people who are intelligent.

5.The Wise Quran: And if you wonder, then wondrous is their speech: 'When we are dust, shall we surely be in a new creation?' Those are the ones who disbelieve in their Lord, and those, on their necks are the fetters, and those are the fellows of the fire; they shall dwell in it forever.

6.The Wise Quran: And they ask you to hasten on the evil before the good; and verily examples have passed away before them. And indeed, your Lord is possessor of forgiveness unto men, for their wrongdoing; and indeed, your Lord is surely severe in punishment.

7.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down upon him from his Lord?' You are only a warner, and for every people a guide.

8.The Wise Quran: God knows what each female bears, and what the wombs fall short of and that which it adds; and everything with Him is in measure.

9.The Wise Quran: Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Great, the Exalted.

10.The Wise Quran: Alike among you is he who conceals the speech and he who proclaims it, he who hides by night and he who goes freely by day.

11.The Wise Quran: For him are successive angels before him and behind him, who guard him at the command of God; indeed God does not change what a people have until they change what is in themselves. And when God wishes evil for a people, then there is no averting it, nor have they a protector besides Him.

12.The Wise Quran: He is the one who shows you the lightning, a fear and hope; and He brings up the heavy clouds.

13.The Wise Quran: And the thunder glorifies with His praise, and the angels for fear of Him. And He sends the thunderbolts and strikes with it whom He wills; and they dispute about God, and He is strong in might.

14.The Wise Quran: To Him is the call of truth, and those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches out his hand to the water to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it. And the call of the disbelievers is only in error.

15.The Wise Quran: And to God prostrates whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and their shadows in the mornings (After sunrise to mid-morning) and the evenings (Mid-afternoon to sunset).

16.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?' Say, 'God;' Say, 'Have you then taken besides Him patrons who cannot control profit or harm for themselves?' Say, 'Is the blind and the seeing equal? Or Is the darkness and the light equal? Or have they ascribed to God associates who can create as He creates, so that the creation seem alike to them?' Say, 'God is the creator of everything, and He is the One, the Subduer.'

17.The Wise Quran: He sends down from the sky water, and the valleys flow according to their measure, and the torrent carries a floating scum: and from what they heat in the fire, seeking ornaments or utensils, comes a scum like it; - thus God strikes the truth and the falsehood; - then as for the scum it is thrown off, and as for what profits mankind it stays in the earth. Thus God strikes out the similitudes.

18.The Wise Quran: For those who respond to their Lord is good; but those who do not respond to Him, if they had all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, surely they would give it for a ransom; those shall have an evil reckoning, and their habitation is Hell,- and evil is the bed.

19.The Wise Quran: Then is He who knows that what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? Only possessors of understanding remember.

20.The Wise Quran: Those who fulfil God's covenant and do not break the compact,

21.The Wise Quran: And those who join what God has commanded to be joined, and fear their Lord and dread the evil reckoning;

22.The Wise Quran: And those who are patient, seeking their Lord's face, and are steadfast in the prayer, and spend of what We have provided them secretly and openly, and ward off evil with good, those for them is the consequence of the abode.

23.The Wise Quran: Gardens of Eden, they shall enter them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, and their spouses and their offspring; and the angels shall enter unto them from every gate.

24.The Wise Quran: 'Peace be on you, because you were patient; and excellent is the consequence of the abode.'

25.The Wise Quran: And those who break God's covenant after contracting it, and cut what God has commanded to be joined, and do evil in the earth, those, for them is the curse, and for them is an evil home.

26.The Wise Quran: God extends and straitens provision for whom He wills; and they rejoice in the worldly life, and the worldly life is nothing in the hereafter, except a provision.

27.The Wise Quran: Those who disbelieve say, 'Unless a sign is sent down upon Him from his Lord.' Say, 'Indeed, God leads whom He wills astray, and guides to Himself whoever repents.'

28.The Wise Quran: Those who believe and whose hearts are at rest by the remembrance of God, - Lo, by the remembrance of God are the hearts at rest.

29.The Wise Quran: Those who believed and did good works, goodness for them and an excellent place of return.

30.The Wise Quran: Thus We have sent you to a nation before which nations have passed away, to recite to them that which We have inspired you with; and they disbelieve in the Merciful. Say, 'He is my Lord; there is no god but He; on Him I rely, and unto Him is my repentance.'

31.The Wise Quran: And though that was a Quran by which the mountains passed away, or by which the earth were cut up, or by which the dead were made to speak - . Nay, God's is the command altogether. Then do not those who believe know that if God wills surely He would have guided mankind altogether? And a sudden calamity shall not cease to overtake those who disbelieve for what they have done, or to alight close by their dwellings until God's promise comes; indeed, God will not fail in the promise.

32.The Wise Quran: And certainly messengers were mocked before you, but I granted respite to those who disbelieved then I seized them and how was My punishment?

33.The Wise Quran: Is then He who stands over every soul for what it has earned - ? And they ascribe partners to God. Say, 'Name them; or will you inform Him of what He does not know in the earth? Or of the apparent of the words?' Nay, their plot is beautified to those who disbelieve, and they are hindered from the way; and whomever God leads astray, then for him there is no guide.

34.The Wise Quran: For them is punishment in the worldly life; and surely the punishment of the hereafter is more severe, and they have no defender from God.

35.The Wise Quran: The similitude of the Garden which those who fear God are promised, beneath it rivers flow, its fruit is enduring, and its shade. That is the consequence of those who fear; and the consequence of the disbelievers is the fire.

36.The Wise Quran: And those to whom We gave the Book rejoice in that which We have sent down to you; but of the confederates are those who deny a part of it. Say, 'I am only commanded to serve God and not to associate partners with Him; to Him I call and to Him is my return.'

37.The Wise Quran: And thus We have sent it down, an Arabic judgment, and if you should follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against God any patron or defender.

38.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly We sent messengers before you, and We made for them wives and offspring; And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except with God's permission; for every period there is a book.

39.The Wise Quran: God blots out, and He confirms what He wills; and with Him is the mother of the Book.

40.The Wise Quran: And whether We show you a part of what We threaten them with, or We cause you to die, so only upon you is the communication, and upon Us is the reckoning.

41.The Wise Quran: Do they not see that We come to the land reducing it from its borders? God judges, there is none to reverse His judgment, and He is swift in the reckoning.

42.The Wise Quran: And certainly those who were before them plotted; but God's is the plotting altogether. He knows what every soul earns; and the disbelievers shall know whose is the consequence of the abode.

43.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'You are not a messenger.' Say, 'God sufficed for a witness between me and you; and whoever has knowledge of the Book.'

10.The Wise Quran: Their messengers said, 'Is there doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive you your sins, and respite you until a named term.' 11.The Wise Quran: Their messengers said to them, 'We are only mortals like you; but God is gracious unto whomsoever He will of His servants, and it is not for us to bring you an authority, except with His permission; and upon God then let the believers rely.

12.The Wise Quran: And what ails us that we rely not on God, and certainly He guided us in our ways? And surely we will definitely be patient on what hurt you cause us; and upon God then let those who rely rely.'

15.The Wise Quran: And they sought victory; and disappointed was every stubborn tyrant.

They say, 'If God had guided us surely we would have guided you. Equal on us whether we are impatient or patient, we have no escape.'

22.The Wise Quran: And the devil says, when the matter has been decided, 'Indeed, God promised you a promise of truth; And I promised you, but I failed you; and I had no authority over you. I only called you, and you responded to me; so do not blame me, but blame yourselves; I cannot help you, nor can you help me. Indeed, I disbelieved in that which you before ascribed to me. Indeed, the wrongdoers, for them is painful punishment.'

23.The Wise Quran: And those who believed and did good works, they shall be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever by permission of their Lord; their greeting therein is 'Peace.'

24.The Wise Quran: Do you not see how God strikes a similitude? A good word is like a good tree, its root is firm, and its branches are in the sky;

25.The Wise Quran: Giving its fruit at every season by permission of its Lord. And God strikes the similitudes for mankind perhaps they may remember.

26.The Wise Quran: And the similitude of a bad word is as a bad tree felled from above the earth, having no stability.

27.The Wise Quran: God makes firm those who believed with the firm saying in the worldly life and in the hereafter. And God leads the wrongdoers astray. And God does what He wills.

28.The Wise Quran: Do you not see those who have changed God's favours for disbelief, and have made their people to alight at the abode of perdition?

29.The Wise Quran: In Hell they shall broil, and an evil resting place.

32.The Wise Quran: God is the one who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down from the sky water, then brought forth from it fruits as a provision for you; and subjected to you the ships, to float in the sea by His command, and subjected for you the rivers;

34.The Wise Quran: And He gave you of all what you asked Him. And if you try to number God's favours, you cannot count them; indeed, man is surely unjust and ungrateful.

35.The Wise Quran: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this land safe, and turn me and my sons away from serving idols.

36.The Wise Quran: My Lord, indeed, they have led astray many among mankind; so whoever follows me, then indeed, he is of me; and whoever rebels against me, then indeed You are forgiving, compassionate.

40.The Wise Quran: 'My Lord! Make me steadfast in the prayer, and from my offspring. Our Lord! And accept my prayer.

42.The Wise Quran: And do not think God is heedless of what the wrongdoers do; He only respites them until the day in which the eyes shall stare.

43.The Wise Quran: Hurrying on, raising up their heads, with their gaze not turning back to them, and their hearts empty;

22.The Wise Quran: Your god is one god, and those who do not believe in the hereafter, their hearts deny and they are proud.

23.The Wise Quran: No doubt that God knows what they keep secret and what they disclose. Indeed, He does not love the proud.

24.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'What has your Lord sent down? They say, 'Legends of the former people.'

25.The Wise Quran: That they may bear their burdens entirely on the Day of Resurrection, and of the burdens of those whom they led astray without knowledge. Lo, evil is what they will bear.

26.The Wise Quran: Verily, those who were before them plotted, but God came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell down upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

27.The Wise Quran: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and will say, 'Where are My associates, those whom you were splitting concerning them?' Those who were given knowledge will say, 'Indeed, disgrace today, and evil are upon the disbelievers.'

28.The Wise Quran: Those whom the angels take in death wronging themselves, then they offered the peace: 'We have done no evil.' Nay, indeed, God knows what you used to do.

29.The Wise Quran: So enter the doors of Hell, to dwell therein for ever; so surely evil is the dwelling place of the proud.

30.The Wise Quran: And it will be said to those who fear, 'What has your Lord sent down?' They will say, 'Good.' For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the hereafter is better. And surely excellent is the home of the pious.

31.The Wise Quran: Gardens of Eden which they shall enter, beneath them rivers flow; therein they shall have what they will. Thus God rewards the pious.

32.The Wise Quran: Those whom the angels take in death, good. They say: 'Peace be on you. Enter the Garden for what you used to do.'

33.The Wise Quran: Do they wait except that the angels should come to them or your Lord's command should come? Thus did those who were before them; God did not wrong them; but they were wronging themselves.

34.The Wise Quran: And the evil of what they had done befell them, and they were surrounded by what they used to mock.

35.The Wise Quran: And those who associated partners said, 'Had God willed, we would not have served anything besides Him, neither we nor our fathers; nor would we have forbidden anything besides Him.' Thus did those who were before them. Then is there upon the messengers except the clear communication?

36.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly, We raised in every nation a messenger, 'Serve God, and avoid idols.' Then of them were those whom God guided, and of them were those upon whom error is due; so travel in the earth and see how was the end of the deniers.

37.The Wise Quran: If you are eager for their guidance, then indeed, God does not guide those who He leads astray, and they have no helpers.

38.The Wise Quran: And they swore with God the utmost of their oaths, 'God will not raise he who dies,' Nay, a promise upon Him in truth, but most of mankind do not know.

39.The Wise Quran: To explain to them that which they disagree about, and that those who disbelieved may know that they are liars.

40.The Wise Quran: Our only word to a thing, when We desire it, is that We say to it 'Be' and it is.

41.The Wise Quran: And those who emigrated in the way of God, after what they were wronged, We will surely, definitely give them good lodging in the world; and surely the reward of the hereafter is greater, if they know.

42.The Wise Quran: Those who are patient, and upon their Lord they rely.

43.The Wise Quran: And We did not send before you except men whom We inspired, - so ask the people of the Reminder, if you do not know, -

44.The Wise Quran: With the clear proofs and the scriptures; and We have sent down the Reminder to you, that you may make clear to mankind what has been sent down to them, and perhaps they may reflect.

45.The Wise Quran: Are those who plot evil deeds then secure from God causing the earth to sink with them or the punishment coming upon them from where they do not perceive?

46.The Wise Quran: Or that He will not seize them in their going to and fro, then they will not be able to escape?

47.The Wise Quran: Or that He will not seize them with a gradual destruction? But indeed, your Lord is surely pitying, compassionate.

48.The Wise Quran: Do they not regard whatever thing God has created; its shadow falls on the right and the left, prostrating to God and they are contemptible?

49.The Wise Quran: And to God prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth of creature, and the angels, and they are not proud.

50.The Wise Quran: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

51.The Wise Quran: And God says, 'Do not take two gods, He is only one god, So fear Me.'

52.The Wise Quran: His is what is in the heavens and the earth; and His is the lasting religion; then will you fear other than God?

53.The Wise Quran: And whatever favours you have is from God; then when distress touches you, then to Him you cry for help.

54.The Wise Quran: Then when He removes the distress from you, lo, a party of you join partners with their Lord.

55.The Wise Quran: That they may be ungrateful for what We have given them. Then enjoy, but soon you shall know.

56.The Wise Quran: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of what We have provided them. By God, surely you shall be questioned about what you forged.

57.The Wise Quran: And they assign to God daughters, glory be to Him, and for them is what they desire.

58.The Wise Quran: And when one of them is given glad tidings of a female, his face becomes dark, and he is repressed.

59.The Wise Quran: He hides himself from the people from the evil of what he has been given glad tidings about. Should he keep it in disgrace or bury it in the dust? Lo, evil is what they judge.

60.The Wise Quran: For those who do not believe in the hereafter is the evil similitude, and for God is the highest similitude. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

61.The Wise Quran: And if God were to chastise mankind for their wrong-doing He would not leave upon it any creature; but He respites them to a named term; and when their term comes they cannot put it off an hour, nor can they bring it on.

62.The Wise Quran: And they assign to God what they hate; and their tongues describe the lie that they shall have the best. No doubt that for them is the fire and that they will be neglected.

63.The Wise Quran: By God, certainly We sent to nations before you, but the devil beautified for them their works, and he is their patron today, and for them is painful punishment.

64.The Wise Quran: And We have not sent down to you the Book, except that you may explain to them that which they disagreed about, and as a guidance and a mercy to a people who believe.

65.The Wise Quran: And God sends down water from the sky, and therewith gives life to the earth after its death; indeed, in that surely is a sign to a people who hear.

66.The Wise Quran: And indeed, you have in cattle a lesson; We give you to drink from what is in their bellies, between chyme and blood, - pure milk, - easy to swallow for those who drink.

67.The Wise Quran: And of the fruits of the palms and the grapes you take therefrom strong drink and a good provision; indeed, in that is surely a sign for a people who are intelligent.

68.The Wise Quran: And your Lord inspired the bee, 'Take houses of the mountains, and of the trees, and of what they build.

69.The Wise Quran: Then eat of all fruits, and follow the ways of your Lord made smooth.' There comes forth from their bellies a drink, its colours are different; in it is a healing for mankind. Indeed, in that is surely a sign to a people who reflect.

70.The Wise Quran: And God created you; then He will take you in death; and amongst you is he who is sent back to the worst state of life, so that after knowledge he knows nothing. Indeed, God is knowing, powerful.

71.The Wise Quran: And God has favoured some of you over some in provision; but those who have been favoured will not restore their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they are equal in it. Is it then the favour of God they deny?

72.The Wise Quran: And God has made for you from yourselves spouses, and He has made for you from your spouses children and grandchildren; and has provided for you from the good things. Is it then in vanity they believe, and in the favour of God they disbelieve?

73.The Wise Quran: And they serve besides God what does not control for them any provision at all from the heavens and the earth, and they are not able.

74.The Wise Quran: So do not strike the similitudes for God. Indeed, God knows, and you do not know.

75.The Wise Quran: God has struck out a similitude; an owned slave, he has no power over anything; and one whom We have provided a good provision from Us, and he spends from it secretly and openly. Are they equal? Praise be to God. Nay, most of them do not know.

76.The Wise Quran: And God has struck out a similitude: two men, one of them dumb, he has no power over anything, and he is a burden upon his sovereign; wherever he directs him he does not come with good; is he equal with him who commands justice, and is on a straight way?

77.The Wise Quran: God's is the unseen of the heavens and the earth; and the matter of the hour is not but as a twinkling of the eye, or it is nearer. Indeed, God is powerful over everything.

78.The Wise Quran: And God brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers knowing nothing; and He made for you the hearing and the eyes and the hearts, perhaps you may give thanks.

79.The Wise Quran: Do they not see the birds subjected in the vault of the sky? None holds them up but God; indeed, in that are signs to a people who believe.

80.The Wise Quran: And God has made for you of your houses a repose; and made for you of the skins of cattle, houses, which you find light on the day you travel and the day you abide; and of their wool and their fur and their hair is furniture and chattels for a time.

81.The Wise Quran: And God has made for you, from what He has created, shades; and has made for you shelters from the mountains; and He has made for you shirts to protect you from the heat, and shirts to protect you from your violence. Thus does He fulfil His favour upon you, perhaps you may submit.

82.The Wise Quran: But if they turn away, then only upon you is the clear communication.

83.The Wise Quran: They recognise the favour of God, then they deny it, and most of them are the disbelievers.

84.The Wise Quran: And the day We shall raise up a witness from every nation, then there is no permission for those who disbelieved, and they shall not be taken back into favour.

85.The Wise Quran: And when those who did wrong see the punishment, then it shall not be lightened for them and they will not be given respite.

86.The Wise Quran: And when those who associated partners see their partners, they shall say, 'Our Lord! These are our partners, those on whom we used to call besides You.' But they will offer to them the speech, 'Indeed, you are surely liars.'

87.The Wise Quran: And they shall offer to God on that day the peace; and what they used to forge shall go astray from them.

88.The Wise Quran: Those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of God, We will increase them in punishment above punishment, for that they were doing corruption.

89.The Wise Quran: And the day We will raise up in every nation a witness against them from themselves, and We will bring you as a witness against these; and We have sent down on you the Book, a clarification for everything, and a guidance, and a mercy, and glad tidings to those who submit.

90.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God commands justice and good and giving to the relatives, and He forbids immorality and wrong and insolence; He admonishes you, perhaps you may remember.

91.The Wise Quran: And fulfil God's covenant when you have covenanted, and do not break the oaths after their asseveration and verily you have made God a surety over you. Indeed, God knows what you do.

92.The Wise Quran: And do not be like her who breaks her yarn after strength into untwisted strands; you take your oaths as mutual deceit, one nation being more numerous than another nation; God only tries you by it, and He will surely, definitely make manifest to you on the Day of Resurrection that concerning which you were disagreeing.

93.The Wise Quran: And had God willed, surely He would have made you one nation; but He leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills; and surely you will definitely be questioned about what you used to do.

94.The Wise Quran: And do not take your oaths as mutual deceit, lest a foot slip after it is firmly planted, and you taste evil for that you hindered from the way of God, and for you is great punishment.

95.The Wise Quran: And do not sell God's covenant for a little price; indeed, what is with God, it is better for you, if you know.

96.The Wise Quran: What is with you is spent, and what is with God endures; and surely We will definitely recompense those who are patient their reward with the best of what they used to do.

97.The Wise Quran: Whoever does good works whether male or female, and he is a believer, then surely We will definitely give him life, a good life; and surely We will definitely recompense them their reward with the best of what they used to do.

98.The Wise Quran: And when you read the Quran, seek refuge with God from the stoned devil.

99.The Wise Quran: Indeed, he has no authority over those who believe and rely upon their Lord.

100.The Wise Quran: His authority is only over those who take him for a patron, and those who they associate partners with Him.

101.The Wise Quran: And when We change a verse in place of verse, - and God knows best what He sends down, - they say, 'You are only a forger.' Nay, most of them do not know.

102.The Wise Quran: Say, 'The Holy Spirit sent it down from your Lord with the truth, to make firm those who believe, and as a guidance and glad tidings to those who submit.'

103.The Wise Quran: And certainly We know that they say, 'Only a mortal teaches him.' The tongue of him whom they incline to is foreign, and this is clear Arabic tongue.

104.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who do not believe in God's signs, God will not guide them, and for them is painful punishment.

105.The Wise Quran: Only those who do not believe in the signs of God forge the lie, and those they are the liars.

106.The Wise Quran: Whoever disbelieves in God after his belief, except one who is forced and whose heart is quiet in the faith, but whoever's breast is expanded in disbelief, then on them is wrath from God, and for them is great punishment.

107.The Wise Quran: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the hereafter and that God does not guide the disbelieving people.

108.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones God has set a stamp on their hearts and their hearing and their sight. And those they are the heedless.

109.The Wise Quran: No doubt that in the hereafter they will be the losers.

110.The Wise Quran: Then indeed, your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been tried, then strove and were patient, indeed, your Lord after it surely is forgiving, compassionate.

111.The Wise Quran: The day every soul will come to wrangle for itself, and every soul shall be paid in full for what it did, and they shall not be wronged.

112.The Wise Quran: God has struck a similitude: a city which was safe and quiet, its provision coming to it in abundance from every place, then it was unthankful for God's favours, so God made it taste the clothing of hunger and fear, for what they used to do.

113.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly there came to them a messenger from them, but they called him a liar, so the punishment seized them, while they were wrongdoers.

114.The Wise Quran: So eat of what God has provided you lawful and good; and give thanks for the favours of God, if it is Him you serve.

115.The Wise Quran: He has only forbidden you that which dies of itself, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and what has been dedicated to other than God; but he who is forced, not seeking nor transgressing, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

116.The Wise Quran: And do not say to what your tongues describe, the lie, 'This is lawful and this is unlawful, 'To forge the lie against God; indeed, those who forge against God the lie shall not prosper.

117.The Wise Quran: A little enjoyment - and for them is painful punishment.

118.The Wise Quran: And to those who became Jews We have forbidden what We have narrated to you before; and We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

119.The Wise Quran: Then indeed, your Lord to those who have done evil in ignorance, then repented after that and did right, indeed, your Lord after it is surely forgiving, compassionate.

120.The Wise Quran: Indeed, Abraham was a nation obedient to God, upright, and he was not of the idolaters;

121.The Wise Quran: Thankful for His favours; He chose him and He guided him to the straight way.

122.The Wise Quran: And We gave him good in the world; and indeed, in the hereafter he will surely be among the righteous.

123.The Wise Quran: Then We inspired to you, 'Follow the faith of Abraham, upright; and he was not of the idolaters.'

124.The Wise Quran: The Sabbath was only made for those who disagreed concerning it; and indeed, your Lord will surely judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they were disagreeing.

125.The Wise Quran: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good warning; and wrangle with them in the best way; indeed, your Lord, He knows best who has erred from His way, and He knows best the guided ones.

126.The Wise Quran: And if you punish, then punish with the like of what you were punished with; but if you are patient, surely it is best for those who are patient.

127.The Wise Quran: And be patient; and your patience is not except with God. And do not grieve over them; and do not be in a strait at what they plot.

128.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God is with those who fear and those who they are good-doers.

1.The Wise Quran: Glory be to the one who took His servant by night from the sacred mosque to the remote mosque, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

2.The Wise Quran: And We gave Moses the Book and made it a guidance to the children of Israel: 'Do not take a trustee besides Me.'

3.The Wise Quran: Offspring of whom We carried with Noah; indeed, he was a thankful servant.

4.The Wise Quran: And We decreed to the children of Israel in the Book, 'You shall surely do corruption in the earth twice, and surely you shall rise to a great height.'

5.The Wise Quran: So when the promise for the first of the two came, We raised against you servants of Ours, possessors of strong valour, and they searched the midst of the homes; and it was a promise to be done.

6.The Wise Quran: Then We gave back to you the turn to prevail over them, and We aided you with wealth and sons, and made you more numerous.

7.The Wise Quran: If you do good, you do good for your souls; and if you do evil, then it is for it. So when the promise for the last came, to harm your faces and to enter the mosque as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had got the upper-hand over, destroying.

8.The Wise Quran: It may be your Lord will have mercy on you; and if you return We will return, and We have made Hell a prison for the disbelievers.

9.The Wise Quran: Indeed, this Quran guides to that which is most straight, and gives glad tidings to the believers, those who do good works, that for them is a great reward;

10.The Wise Quran: And that those who do not believe in the hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

11.The Wise Quran: And man prays for evil as he prays for good; and man is ever hasty.

12.The Wise Quran: And We made the night and the day two signs; and We blot out the sign of the night and We make the sign of the day visible, that you may seek grace from your Lord, and that you may know the number of the years and the reckoning; and We have detailed everything in detail.

13.The Wise Quran: And every man's augury We have fastened on his neck; and We will bring forth for him on the Day of Resurrection a book which he will encounter wide open.

14.The Wise Quran: 'Read your book, your soul suffices for a reckoner against you today.'

15.The Wise Quran: Whoever is guided then he is only guided for his soul: and whoever errs, then he errs only against it; nor shall a burdened soul bear the burden of another. Nor do We punish until We have sent a messenger.

16.The Wise Quran: And when We desire to destroy a city We command its affluent ones but they disobey therein; so the word is justified against it, and We destroyed it, destroying.

17.The Wise Quran: And how many of the generations have We destroyed after Noah. Your Lord is enough aware of, sees the sins of His servants.

18.The Wise Quran: Whoever desires the transitory life, We hasten for him in it what We will, for whom We desire. Then We have made Hell for him; to broil in, blamed, expelled.

19.The Wise Quran: And whoever desires the hereafter, and strives for it, its striving while he is a believer, then those, their striving shall be thanked.

20.The Wise Quran: To all, these and these, will We extend from the gifts of your Lord; and the gifts of your Lord are not restricted.

21.The Wise Quran: See how We have favoured some of them over some, and surely the hereafter is greater in degrees and greater in favour.

22.The Wise Quran: Do not make with God another god, so you sit blamed, forsaken.

23.The Wise Quran: And your Lord has decreed that you not serve except Him; and to parents, be good. Whether one or both of them reach old age with you, then do not say to them, 'Fie!' And do not chide them, and speak to them a noble speech.

24.The Wise Quran: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy, and say, 'My Lord! Have mercy on them as they brought me up a little one.'

25.The Wise Quran: Your Lord knows best what is in your souls if you are righteous, then indeed, He is forgiving to those who frequently repent.

26.The Wise Quran: And give the relative his due and the poor and the wayfarer; and waste not wastefully.

27.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the wasteful are the devil's brothers; and the devil is ungrateful to his Lord.

28.The Wise Quran: But if you turn away from them seeking mercy from your Lord, which you hope for, then speak to them an easy speech.

29.The Wise Quran: And do not make your hand fettered to your neck, nor extend it out all the extension, so you sit down blameworthy, stripped off.

30.The Wise Quran: Indeed, your Lord extends provision to whomsoever He will and He straitens. Indeed, He is aware of, sees His servants.

31.The Wise Quran: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty; We will provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is a great sin.

32.The Wise Quran: And draw not near fornication; Indeed, it is an immorality, and an evil way.

33.The Wise Quran: And do not kill the soul which God has forbidden, except with the right; and whoever is killed unjustly, verily, We have made for his next-of-kin authority; but let him not exceed in killing; indeed, he is helped.

34.The Wise Quran: And draw not near the wealth of the orphan, except with that which is best, until he reaches his strength, and fulfil the covenant; indeed, the covenant is ever enquired of.

35.The Wise Quran: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with the straight balance; that is best and a better determination.

36.The Wise Quran: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge; indeed, the hearing and the eye and the heart, all of those shall be enquired of.

37.The Wise Quran: And do not walk on the earth exultantly; indeed, you cannot make a hole in the earth, and you cannot reach the mountains in height.

38.The Wise Quran: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, hateful.

39.The Wise Quran: That is of what your Lord has inspired to you of wisdom. And do not make with God another god, so you will be thrown in Hell, blameworthy, expelled.

40.The Wise Quran: Has your Lord chosen for you sons, and has He taken, females from the angels? Indeed, you surely say a great speech.

41.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We have turned about in this Quran, that they may remember, but it only increases them in aversion

42.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If there were with Him gods, as they say, then surely they would have sought a way to the possessor of the throne.’

43.The Wise Quran: Glory be to Him and exalted is He above what they say, a great exaltation.

44.The Wise Quran: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them, glorify Him. And there is not a thing but glorifies with His praise, but you do not understand their glorification. Indeed, He is clement, forgiving.

45.The Wise Quran: And when you read the Quran We place between you and those who do not believe in the hereafter a covering veil.

46.The Wise Quran: And We have made coverings upon their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears, dulness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn on their backs in aversion.

47.The Wise Quran: We know best that which they listen to when they listen to you; and when they discourse secretly - when the wrongdoers say, 'You only follow a man bewitched. '

48.The Wise Quran: See how they strike the similitudes for you and err, and cannot find a way.

49.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'When we have become bones and broken particles shall we surely be raised up in a new creation?'

50.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Be you stones, or iron,

51.The Wise Quran: Or a creation of what is great in your breasts.' Then they shall say, 'Who will restore us?' Say, 'He who originated you the first time;' Then soon they will shake their heads towards you, and they will say, 'When will it be?' Say, 'It may be that it is near.'

52.The Wise Quran: On the day He shall call on you and you shall answer with His praise, and you will think you have not tarried except a little.

53.The Wise Quran: And say to My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, the devil incites between them; indeed the devil is ever to man a clear enemy.

54.The Wise Quran: Your Lord knows you best; if He wills, He will have mercy on you, or if He wills, He will punish you. We have not sent you as a trustee over them.

55.The Wise Quran: And your Lord knows best who is in the heavens and the earth; and verily, We have favoured some prophets over some. And We gave David Psalms.

56.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Call on those whom you claimed besides Him; but they have no power to remove distress from you, nor to change.

57.The Wise Quran: Those on whom they call seek the means of approach to their Lord, which of them is nearest: and they hope for His mercy and they fear His punishment; indeed, the punishment of your Lord is a thing to beware of.

58.The Wise Quran: And there is no city but We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with severe punishment; - that is in the Book inscribed.

59.The Wise Quran: And nothing prevented us from sending the signs, except that the former people said they were lies; And We gave Thamud the visible she-camel, but they wronged her. And We do not send the signs except to frighten.

60.The Wise Quran: And when We said to you, 'Indeed, your Lord encompasses mankind.' And We made the vision which We showed you and the cursed tree in the Quran only a trial for mankind; and We frighten them, but it only increases them in great immoderation.

61.The Wise Quran: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam.' So they prostrated except Iblis. He said, 'Shall I prostrate to one whom you created from clay?'

62.The Wise Quran: Said he, 'Do you see this one whom you have honoured above me, indeed, if you respite me to the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his offspring except a few.'

63.The Wise Quran: Said He, 'Go! And whoever of them follows you - then indeed, Hell is your recompense, an ample recompense.

64.The Wise Quran: And frighten whoever you are able among them with your voice; and drive them with your horses and your footmen; and partner with them in the wealth and the children; and promise them.' And the devil promises them not except deception.

65.The Wise Quran: 'Indeed, My servants, you have no authority over them; And your Lord suffices for a trustee.'

66.The Wise Quran: Your Lord is the one who drives the ships for you in the sea that you may seek of His grace; indeed, He is ever compassionate to you.

67.The Wise Quran: And when distress touches you in the sea, whoever you call on errs except Him; but when He delivers you to the land, you turn away; and man is ever ungrateful.

68.The Wise Quran: Are you then secure from Him causing the side of the land to sink with you or sending upon you a storm of stones? Then you will not find for you a trustee.

69.The Wise Quran: Or are you secure that He will not send you back into it another time, and send upon you a violent wind, and drown you because you disbelieved? Then you will find therein no follower for you against Us.

70.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We have honoured the children of Adam, and We carried them in the land and the sea, and We provided them of the good things, and We favoured them over many of those whom We have created, favour.

71.The Wise Quran: The day We will call all people with their leader; then whoever is given his book in his right hand, then those shall read their book, and they shall not be wronged the filament on a date-seed.

72.The Wise Quran: And whoever in this is blind, then he shall be blind in the hereafter; and more astray from the way.

73.The Wise Quran: And indeed, they were near to tempting you from that which We inspired to you, that you should forge against Us other than it; and then they surely would have taken you for a friend.

74.The Wise Quran: And had We not made you firm, you would have almost leant towards them a little:

75.The Wise Quran: Then We would have made you taste the double of life and the double of death; then you would have found no helper for you against Us.

76.The Wise Quran: And indeed, they were almost going to frighten you from the land, that they may drive you out from it; and then they would not have tarried behind you except a little.

77.The Wise Quran: The course of those of Our messengers whom We have sent before you; and you shall find no change in Our course.

78.The Wise Quran: Be steadfast in prayer from the declining of the sun until the darkness of the night, and the reading of the dawn; indeed, the reading of the dawn is ever witnessed.

79.The Wise Quran: And for the night, watch therein an addition for you. It may be that your Lord will raise you to a praiseworthy station.

80.The Wise Quran: And say, 'My Lord! Make me enter a truthful entrance; and make me come forth a truthful coming forth; and make for me from you a helping authority.'

81.The Wise Quran: And say, 'Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is ever vanishing.'

82.The Wise Quran: And We send down of the Quran that which is a healing and a mercy to the believers, but it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.

83.The Wise Quran: And when We bestow favour on man he turns away and goes aside, but when evil touches him he is ever in despair.

84.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Each works according to his likeness, and your Lord knows best who he is most guided in way.'

85.The Wise Quran: And they will ask you of the spirit. Say, 'The spirit is of the command of my Lord, and you have been given of the knowledge not except a little.'

86.The Wise Quran: And surely if We had willed We would have surely taken away that which We have inspired to you; then you would not find a trustee for you in it against us,

87.The Wise Quran: Except a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His grace upon you is great.

88.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If mankind and jinns gathered together to bring the like of this Quran, they could not bring the like of it though some of them were backers to some.'

89.The Wise Quran: And certainly We have turned about for mankind in this Quran of every similitude; but most of mankind refuse except disbelief.

90.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'We will not believe in you, until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us;

91.The Wise Quran: Or there be for you a garden of palms and grapes, and you cause rivers to flow forth amidst it, streaming;

92.The Wise Quran: Or you cause the sky to fall down, as you have claimed, on us in pieces; or you bring God and the angels face to face;

93.The Wise Quran: Or there be for you a house of gold; or you ascend into the sky; and we will not believe in your ascension, until you send down on us a book which we may read.' Say, 'Glory be to my Lord. Was I except a mortal messenger?'

94.The Wise Quran: And nothing prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came to them, except that they said, 'Has God sent a mortal messenger?'

95.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If there were angels in the earth walking in quiet, We would have surely sent down upon them from the heaven an angel messenger.'

96.The Wise Quran: Say, 'God suffices for a witness between me and you; indeed, He is aware of, sees His servants.'

97.The Wise Quran: And whoever God guides, then he is the guided; and whoever He leads astray, then you shall not find patrons for them besides Him; and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, and dumb, and deaf; their abode is Hell; whenever it abates We will increase for them the blaze.

98.The Wise Quran: That is their reward for that they disbelieved in Our signs, and said, 'When We are bones and broken particles, shall we surely be raised up a new creation?'

99.The Wise Quran: Do they not see that God who created the heavens and the earth is able to create the like of them? And He has made for them a term, there is no doubt in it, but the wrongdoers refuse except disbelief.

100.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If you control the treasuries of the mercy of my Lord, then surely you would withhold from fear of spending; and man is ever niggardly.'

101.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We gave Moses nine clear signs; then ask the children of Israel when he came to them, and Pharaoh said to him, 'Indeed, I think you, O Moses! Bewitched.'

102.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Verily, you know none sent down these except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence; and indeed, I surely think you, O Pharaoh! Destroyed.'

103.The Wise Quran: And he desired that he frighten them from the land; so We drowned him and who were with him, all together.

104.The Wise Quran: And after him We said to the children of Israel, 'Dwell in the land; and when the promise of the hereafter comes, We will bring you as a mixed crowd.'

105.The Wise Quran: And in truth We have sent it down, and in truth it has come down; and We have not sent you, except as a herald of glad tidings and a warner.

106.The Wise Quran: And a Quran which We have divided, that you may read it to mankind at intervals, and We sent it down, descending gradually.'

107.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Believe in it, or do not believe; indeed, those who were given the knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, they fall to the chins prostrating.

108.The Wise Quran: And they say, "Glory be to our Lord. Indeed, the promise of our Lord is surely to be done"

109.The Wise Quran: And they fall to the chins weeping, and it increases them in humility.'

110.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Call on God, or call on the Merciful, whichever you call on; His are the best names. And do not be loud in your prayers nor be silent therein, but seek a way between that.'

111.The Wise Quran: And say, 'Praise be to God, who has not taken a son, and has not had a partner in the kingdom, nor had a patron out of weakness.' And magnify Him greatly.

1.The Wise Quran: Praise be to God, the one who sent down to His servant the Book, and has not made in it crookedness.

2.The Wise Quran: Straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him, and to give glad tidings to the believers, those who do good works, that they will have a good reward;

3.The Wise Quran: They will stay in it forever.

4.The Wise Quran: And to warn those who say, 'God has taken a son.'

5.The Wise Quran: They have no knowledge of it, nor their forefathers. A great word it is that comes forth from their mouths; they say not except a lie.

6.The Wise Quran: And perhaps you will kill yourself grieving upon their footsteps, if they do not believe in this narration.

7.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have made what is on the earth an adornment for it; that We may test which of them is best in works.

8.The Wise Quran: And indeed, We will surely make what is on it barren soil.

9.The Wise Quran: Or did you think the men of the cave and Ar Raqim were a wonder among Our signs?

10.The Wise Quran: When the youths took refuge in the cave and said, 'Our Lord, give us mercy from Yourself, and furnish us with right direction in our affair.'

11.The Wise Quran: So We struck their ears in the cave for a number of years.

12.The Wise Quran: Then we raised them up that We might know which of the two parties would best calculate the time that they had tarried.

13.The Wise Quran: We narrate to you their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

14.The Wise Quran: And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, 'Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will not call upon a god besides Him. Surely, certainly then we would have spoken exceeding the due bounds.

15.The Wise Quran: These, our people, have taken other gods besides Him though they do not bring a clear authority for them. And who is more wrong than he who forges a lie against God?'

16.The Wise Quran: And when you have gone apart from them and what they serve except God, then take refuge in the cave, and your Lord will spread for you of His mercy and will facilitate for you ease from your affair.

17.The Wise Quran: And you see the sun when it rises, inclining towards their cave, possessed of the right; and when it sets, across from them, possessed of the left; and they are in the opening of it. That is of the signs of God. Whoever God guides, then he is guided, and whoever He leads astray, then you will not find a rightly directed patron for him.

18.The Wise Quran: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them over, possessed of the right and possessed of the left, while their dog stretched its forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled with terror of them.

19.The Wise Quran: And thus We raised them that they might question one another between them. A speaker among them said, 'How long have you tarried?' They said, 'We have tarried a day or part of a day.' They said, 'Your Lord knows best what you have tarried. So send one of you with this your silver to the city and let him see what food is purest and let him come to you with provision from it; let him be courteous and do not let anyone perceive you.

20.The Wise Quran: Indeed they, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or turn you back to their religion. And you will not prosper then, ever.'

21.The Wise Quran: And in like manner We disclosed them that they might know that the promise of God is true, and that, the Hour, there is no doubt of it. When they disputed between them the affair, then they said, 'Build over them a building; their Lord knows them best.' Said those who prevailed over their affair, 'Surely We will raise over them a mosque.'

22.The Wise Quran: Soon they will say, 'Three, and the fourth of them was their dog.' And they will say, 'Five, and the sixth of them was their dog.' Guessing at the unseen. And they will say, 'Seven, and the eighth of them was their dog.' Say, 'My Lord knows best their number; none knows them but a few.' So do not argue about them except with an evident argument, and do not ask any one of them for a decision concerning them.

23.The Wise Quran: And do not say, regarding anything, 'Indeed, I will do that tomorrow.'

24.The Wise Quran: Except 'If God wills.' And remember your Lord when you forget, and say, 'Perhaps my Lord will guide me to nearer than this right direction.'

25.The Wise Quran: And they tarried in their cave three hundred years and add nine.

26.The Wise Quran: Say, 'God knows best what they tarried. His is the unseen of the heavens and the earth. See with Him and hear! They have no patron besides Him, and He makes none to share in His judgment.'

27.The Wise Quran: And recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. None can change His words and you will not find a place of refuge besides Him.

28.The Wise Quran: And keep yourself patient with those who call upon their Lord in the morning (After sunrise to mid-morning) and the afternoon (Noon to mid-afternoon) seeking His face. And let not your eyes pass from them desiring the adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his lust and whose affair exceeds just limits.

29.The Wise Quran: And say, 'The truth is from your Lord, so let him who will believe; and let him who will disbelieve.' Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire, its walls will surround them; And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which burns the faces. Evil is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

30.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We will not waste the reward of he who does good works.

31.The Wise Quran: Those, for them are gardens of Eden; beneath them the rivers flow; they shall be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they shall wear green robes of fine silk, and of brocade; reclining therein on raised couches; excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

32.The Wise Quran: And strike for them a similitude: two men, for one of them, We made two gardens of grapes, and surrounded them with palms, and put corn between the two.

33.The Wise Quran: Each of the two gardens brought forth its fruit and did not fail in anything of it. And We caused a river to flow forth in the midst of them.

34.The Wise Quran: And he had fruit, and he said to his fellow, as he was conversing with him, 'I am greater than you in wealth and mightier of household.'

35.The Wise Quran: And he entered his garden, wronging himself; he said, 'I do not think that this will ever perish;

36.The Wise Quran: I do not think that the Hour is coming; and if I am returned to my Lord, I will find a better one than it in exchange.'

37.The Wise Quran: Said his fellow, as he was conversing with him, 'Have you disbelieved in he who created you from dust, then from a sperm, then shaped you as a man?

38.The Wise Quran: But as for me, He is God, my Lord, and I will not associate with my Lord anyone.

39.The Wise Quran: Why could you not have said, when you went into your garden, "What God wills! There is no strength except with God." To look at, I am less than you in wealth and children,

40.The Wise Quran: Perhaps my Lord will give me better than your garden, and will send upon it thunderbolts from the sky, then it will become bare slippery soil;

41.The Wise Quran: Or its water will become sunk, so you will not be able to seek it.'

42.The Wise Quran: And his fruits were encompassed, and he began to wring his hands over what he spent on it, and it had fallen down on its trellises, and he said, 'O would that I had not associated anyone with my Lord.'

43.The Wise Quran: And there was no host to help him besides God and he was helpless.

44.The Wise Quran: There, the patronage is for God, the Truth. He is best for reward, and best for consequence.

45.The Wise Quran: And strike for them a similitude of the worldly life; like water which We send down from the sky, and the plants of the earth mingle with it; then it becomes dry plants scattered by the winds; and God is powerful over everything.

46.The Wise Quran: Wealth and children are an adornment of the worldly life; but enduring good works are better with your Lord, as a reward, and better as a hope.

48.The Wise Quran: And they will be presented before your Lord in ranks, - Surely, certainly you have come to Us as We created you the first time. Nay, you claimed that We would not make for you an appointment.

49.The Wise Quran: And the Book shall be placed, and you will see the sinners in fear of what is in it; and they will say, 'O woe to us! What is this Book, it leaves not a small thing nor a great thing but has counted it.' And they will find all that they did present, and your Lord will not wrong anyone.

50.The Wise Quran: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' So they prostrated except Iblis. He was of the jinn, and he disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you then take him and his offspring as patrons besides Me, while they are an enemy to you? Evil is the exchange for wrongdoers.

51.The Wise Quran: I did not make them witnesses of the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor of the creation of themselves, and I am not one who takes the misleaders as assistants.

52.The Wise Quran: And on the day He will say, 'Call My partners, those who you claimed.' Then they will call them but they will not answer them. And We will make a barrier between them.

53.The Wise Quran: And the sinners will see the fire, and will think that they are going to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

55.The Wise Quran: And nothing prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came to them, and from seeking forgiveness of their Lord, except the course of the former people comes upon them, or the punishment comes upon them face to face.

56.The Wise Quran: We send not the messengers except as bearers of glad tidings and warners. Those who disbelieve contend with falsehood in order to rebut the truth thereby; and they take My signs and what they were warned in jest.

57.The Wise Quran: And who is more wrong than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, then turned away from them and forgot what his hands have sent forward? Indeed, We have made coverings upon their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears, dulness. And if you call them to the guidance, then they will not be guided then, ever.

58.The Wise Quran: And your Lord is the Forgiver, the possessor of mercy. If He were to chastise them for what they have earned, surely, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Nay, for them is an appointed time; they will not find an escape besides it.

59.The Wise Quran: And these towns We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We appointed a time for their destruction.

60.The Wise Quran: And when Moses said to his servant, 'I will not give up until I reach the point where the two seas meet, or I go on for a long time.'

73.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Do not chastise me for what I forgot, and do not impose a difficult command on me.'

75.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Did I not tell you, indeed, you cannot have patience with me?'

76.The Wise Quran: He said, 'If I ask you about anything after it, then do not accompany me. You have now arrived at my excuse.'

78.The Wise Quran: He said, 'This is the parting between me and you. I will give you the interpretation of that with which you could not have patience.

79.The Wise Quran: As for the ship it belonged to poor people, working in the sea, so I wished to damage it, for behind it was a king who seized every ship by force.

80.The Wise Quran: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would impose on them immoderation and disbelief.

81.The Wise Quran: So we desired that their Lord gives them in exchange better than him in purity and nearer mercy.

82.The Wise Quran: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan youths in the city, and beneath it was a treasure belonging to them both, and their father was a righteous man, so their Lord desired that they should reach their strength, and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord; and I did not do it on my command.
