1.The Wise Quran: A chapter which We have sent down and determined, and We sent down in it clear signs; perhaps you may remember.

2.The Wise Quran: The fornicatress and the fornicator, then flog each one of them a hundred lashes, and do not let pity for them take hold of you in God's religion, if you believe in God and the Last Day; and let a party of the believers witness their punishment.

3.The Wise Quran: And the fornicator shall marry none but a fornicatress or an idolatress; and the fornicatress none shall marry her but a fornicator or an idolater; that is forbidden to the believers.

4.The Wise Quran: And those who accuse chaste women then do not bring four witnesses, then flog them eighty lashes, and do not accept their testimony ever, and those, they are the disobedient.

5.The Wise Quran: Except those who repented after that and did right, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

6.The Wise Quran: And those who accuse their wives and have no witnesses except themselves, then the testimony of one of them shall be to testify four times that by God, indeed, he is surely of the truthful;

7.The Wise Quran: And the fifth that the curse of God be on him if he is of the liars.

8.The Wise Quran: And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bears testimony four times that, by God, indeed, he is surely of the liars;

9.The Wise Quran: And the fifth that the wrath of God be on her if he is of the truthful.

10.The Wise Quran: And were it not for God's grace upon you and His mercy, and that God is relenting, wise.

11.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who came with the lie are a band of you. Do not think it bad for you, nay, it is good for you; for every man of them is what he earned of the sin; and he of them who had the greater share of it, for him is great punishment.

12.The Wise Quran: Why did not, when you heard it, the believing men and believing women think good in themselves, and say, 'This is a clear lie?'

13.The Wise Quran: Why did they not bring four witnesses to it? But since they did not bring the witnesses, then those, with God they are the liars.

14.The Wise Quran: And if not for God's grace upon you, and His mercy in the world and the hereafter, surely there would have touched you, for that concerning which you spread abroad, great punishment.

15.The Wise Quran: When you received it with your tongues, and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and reckoned it a light thing, while with God it was great.

16.The Wise Quran: And why did you not say when you heard it, 'It is not for us to speak of this. Glory be to You. This is a great slander.'

17.The Wise Quran: God admonishes you that you return not to the like of it ever, if you are believers;

18.The Wise Quran: And God makes clear for you the signs, and God is knowing, wise.

19.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who love that immorality should spread amongst those who believe, for them is painful punishment in the world and the hereafter; and God knows, and you do not know.

20.The Wise Quran: And if not for God's grace upon you, and His mercy, and that God is pitying, compassionate.

21.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Do not follow the footsteps of the devil, and whoever follows the footsteps of the devil, then indeed, he commands immorality and wrongdoing; and if not for God's grace upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but God purifies whom He wills, and God is hearing, knowing.

22.The Wise Quran: And let not those amongst you who possess grace and ample means swear that they will not give to the relatives and the poor and the emigrants in the way of God, And let them pardon and overlook. Do you not like that God should forgive you? And God is forgiving, compassionate.

23.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who accuse chaste heedless believing women, are cursed in the world and the hereafter; and for them is great punishment.

24.The Wise Quran: The day their tongues and their hands and their feet shall bear witness against them of what they did.

25.The Wise Quran: On that day God will pay them in full their recompense the truth; and they shall know that God, He is the clear truth.

26.The Wise Quran: The bad women to the bad men, and the bad men to the bad women; and the good women to the good men, and the good men to the good women; those are clear of what they say, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision.

27.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Do not enter into houses other than your houses, until you have asked permission and invoked peace upon its people, that is better for you; perhaps you may remember.

28.The Wise Quran: And if you find no one in it, then do not enter it until permission is given to you, and if it is said to you, 'Go back!' Then go back, it is purer for you; and God knows what you do.

29.The Wise Quran: It is no crime against you that you enter uninhabited houses, in which is a provision for you; and God knows what you show and what you hide.

30.The Wise Quran: Say to the believers that they lower their gaze and guard their private parts; that is purer for them; indeed, God is aware of what they do.

31.The Wise Quran: And say to the believing women that they lower their gaze and guard their private parts, and display not their ornaments, except what is apparent of it; and let them make their head coverings fall upon their bosoms and not display their ornaments except to their husbands or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons, or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or what their right hands possess, or the followers not possessors of intelligence among the men, or children those to whom the pudenda of women is not apparent; and let them not strike with their feet to make known what they conceal of their ornaments; and repent to God all together, O believers! Perhaps you may prosper.

32.The Wise Quran: And marry the single amongst you, and the righteous among your male servants and your female servants. If they are needy, God will enrich them of His grace, and God is immense, knowing.

33.The Wise Quran: And let those who find not marriage, keep chaste, until God enriches them of His grace. And those who seek the writing from what your right hands possess, then write it for them, if you know good in them, and give them of the wealth of God which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, that you may seek the goods of the worldly life; and whoever compels them, then indeed, God after their compulsion is forgiving, compassionate.

34.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly We have sent down to you manifest signs, and a similitude of those who have passed away before you, and an admonition to those who fear.

35.The Wise Quran: God is the light of the heavens and the earth; the similitude of His light is like a niche in which is a lamp, the lamp is in a glass, the glass is as if it were a glittering star lit from a blessed tree, an olive, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost give light though no fire touched it, - light upon light. - God guides to His light whom He wills; and God strikes the similitudes for mankind, and God knows all things.

36.The Wise Quran: In houses God has permitted to be raised and His name to be remembered therein; therein glorifying Him, in the mornings (After sunrise to mid-morning) and the evenings (Mid-afternoon to sunset),

37.The Wise Quran: Men whom neither merchandise nor selling diverts from the remembrance of God and steadfastness in prayer and giving alms, they fear a day in which hearts and eyes shall turn about;

38.The Wise Quran: That God may recompense them for the best of what they did, and give them increase of His grace; and God provides whom He wills without reckoning.

39.The Wise Quran: But those who disbelieve, their works are like a mirage in a plain, the thirsty one thinks it water till when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing; and he finds God with him; and He pays him in full his reckoning, and God is swift in the reckoning.

40.The Wise Quran: Or like darkness in a deep sea, there covers it a wave above which is a wave, above which is a cloud, - darkness some of it above some, - when he puts out his hand he can almost not see it; and him who God did not make light for, then there is no light for him.

41.The Wise Quran: Have you not seen that God, whoever is in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him, and the birds expanding their wings? Each one verily knows its prayer and its glorification, and God knows what they do.

42.The Wise Quran: And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to God is the destination.

43.The Wise Quran: Have you not seen that God drives the clouds, then re-unites them, then makes them a heap, and you see the rain come forth from their midst? And He sends down from the sky mountains with hail therein, and He makes it fall on whom He wills, and He turns it from whom He wills; the flash of His lightning almost goes off with the sight.

44.The Wise Quran: God turns about the night and the day. Indeed, in that surely is a lesson for the possessors of eyes.

45.The Wise Quran: And God created every creature from water, and of them is one that walks on its belly, and of them is one that walks on two feet, and of them is one that walks on four. God creates what He wills; indeed, God is powerful over everything.

46.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly We have sent down manifest signs, and God guides whom He wills to a straight path.

47.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'We believe in God and in the messenger, and We obey.' Then a party of them turn away after that. And those are not with the believers.

48.The Wise Quran: And when they are called to God and His messenger to judge between them, behold, a party of them turn aside.

49.The Wise Quran: But if the truth is with them, they come to him submissively.

50.The Wise Quran: Is there a sickness in their hearts, or do they doubt, or do they fear that God and His messenger would be unjust to them? Nay, those they are the wrongdoers.

51.The Wise Quran: The speech of the believers, when they are called to God and His messenger to judge between them, is only that they say, 'We heard and we obeyed.' And those they are the prosperous.

52.The Wise Quran: And whoever obeys God and His messenger and dreads God and fears Him, then those they are the successful.

53.The Wise Quran: And they swore with God the utmost of their oaths, surely if you command them, they would surely, definitely go forth. Say, 'Do not swear, reasonable obedience; indeed, God is aware of what you do.'

54.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Obey God and obey the messenger; but if you turn away then only upon him is what is placed on him, and upon you is what is placed on you. And if you obey him, you are guided; and nothing is upon the messenger except the clear communication.'

55.The Wise Quran: God promises those of you who believe and do good works that He will surely give them succession in the earth as He gave succession to those who were before them, and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and He will surely give them after their fear, safety in exchange; they worship Me, they do not associate anything with Me; but whoever disbelieves after that, then those they are the disobedient.

56.The Wise Quran: And be steadfast in the prayer and give the alms and obey the messenger, perhaps you may obtain mercy.

57.The Wise Quran: Do not think those who disbelieve can escape in the earth. And their abode will be the fire and surely evil is the destination.

58.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Let those whom your right hands possess, and those amongst you who have not reached puberty, ask permission of you three times: before the prayer of dawn, and when you put off your clothes at noon, and after the prayer of nightfall; three times of privacy for you; there is no crime upon you nor upon them after these while you are continually going one about the other. Thus God makes clear for you the signs, and God is knowing, wise.

59.The Wise Quran: And when the children among you reach puberty then let them ask permission as those before them asked permission. Thus God makes clear for you His signs, and God is knowing, wise.

60.The Wise Quran: And the postmenopausal among the women, who do not hope for marriage, it is no crime on them that they put off their clothes, without displaying their ornaments; but that they abstain is better for them, and God is hearing, knowing.

61.The Wise Quran: There is no straitness on the blind, and no straitness on the lame, and no straitness on the sick, and none upon yourselves that you eat from your houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts, or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or what you possess the keys of, or of your friend, there is no crime on you that you eat all together or separately. And when you enter houses then greet on yourselves a salutation from God, blessed, good. Thus God makes clear for you the signs, perhaps you may become intelligent.

62.The Wise Quran: Only those are believers who believe in God and His messenger, and when they are with him upon a matter of collective action go not away until they have asked his permission; indeed, those who ask your permission, those are the ones who believe in God and His messenger. So when they ask your permission for some affair of theirs, then give permission to whom you will of them, and ask forgiveness for them of God; indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

63.The Wise Quran: Do not make the call of the messenger between you like the call of some of you to some; certainly, God knows those who slip covertly away among you, avoiding. And let those who act contrary to his command beware lest a trial befalls them or a painful punishment befalls them.

64.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed, God's is what is in the heavens and the earth. Verily, He knows what you are on; and the day they shall be returned to Him, then He will inform them of what they did, and God knows all things.

1.The Wise Quran: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His servant that he might be to the worlds a warner;

2.The Wise Quran: The one who for Him is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and who has not taken a son, and who has no partner in His kingdom, and He created all things, and He decreed it determinately.

3.The Wise Quran: And they take besides Him gods which create nothing, but are themselves created, and cannot control for themselves harm or profit, and cannot control death, or life, or resurrection.

4.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'This is not except a lie which he has forged, and another people have helped him at it;' But verily, they have produced an injustice and a lie.

5.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'Legends of the former people, which he has got written down while they are dictated to him morning and evening.'

6.The Wise Quran: Say, 'He sent it down who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth; indeed, He is ever forgiving, compassionate.'

7.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'What ails this messenger that he eats food and walks in the markets? - unless there be sent down to him an angel and be a warner with him.

8.The Wise Quran: Or there be thrown to him a treasury, or he have a garden to eat therefrom.' And the wrongdoers say, 'You only follow a man bewitched.'

9.The Wise Quran: See how they strike the similitudes for you and err and cannot find a way.

10.The Wise Quran: Blessed is He who, if He wills, He will make for you better than that, gardens beneath which rivers flow, and can make for you palaces.

11.The Wise Quran: Nay, they call the Hour a lie; but We have prepared for those who call the Hour a lie a blaze:

12.The Wise Quran: When it sees them from a far-off place they shall hear its raging and roaring;

13.The Wise Quran: And when they are thrown into a narrow place thereof, fastened together, they shall call thereof for destruction.

14.The Wise Quran: Call not today for one destruction, but call for many destructions.

15.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Is that better or the garden of eternity which was promised to those who fear - which is ever for them a recompense and a destination?'

16.The Wise Quran: They shall have therein what they will, to dwell therein forever; it is of your Lord a promise to be demanded.

17.The Wise Quran: And the day He shall gather them and what they served besides God, and He shall say, 'Was it you who led these My servants astray, or did they err from the way?'

18.The Wise Quran: They shall say, ' Glory be to You, it was not appropriate for us to take any patrons besides You; but You gave them and their fathers enjoyment until they forgot the Reminder and were a lost people.'

19.The Wise Quran: And now have they proved you liars for what you say, and they cannot ward off or help. And he of you who does wrong We will make him taste great punishment.

20.The Wise Quran: We have not sent before you any messengers but indeed they surely ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you a trial to others, will you be patient? Your Lord is ever seeing.

21.The Wise Quran: And those who do not hope to meet Us say, 'Unless the angels are sent down to us, or we see our Lord.' Indeed, they were proud in their souls and they rebelled, a great rebellion.

22.The Wise Quran: The day they shall see the angels - no glad tidings on that day for the sinners, and they shall say, 'A forbidden ban.'

23.The Wise Quran: And We will go on to the works which they have done, and make them like scattered motes.

24.The Wise Quran: The fellows of the Garden on that day shall be in a better abode and a better noonday rest.

25.The Wise Quran: The day the heavens shall be split asunder with the clouds, and the angels shall be sent down, descending gradually.

26.The Wise Quran: The true kingdom on that day shall belong to the Merciful, and it shall be a difficult day for the disbelievers.

27.The Wise Quran: And the day when the wrongdoers shall bite his hands and say, 'O I wish I had taken a way with the messenger.

28.The Wise Quran: O woe to me! I wish I had not taken so-and-so for a friend.

29.The Wise Quran: He indeed led me astray from the Reminder after it had come to me, and ever is the devil, to man, a deserter.'

30.The Wise Quran: The messenger said, 'O my Lord! Indeed my people have taken this Quran as a thing to be shunned.'

31.The Wise Quran: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the sinners; and your Lord sufficed for a guide and a helper.

32.The Wise Quran: Those who disbelieve said, 'Unless the Quran be sent down to him all at once.' - thus - that We may make firm your heart with it, and We have arranged it well, distinctly.

33.The Wise Quran: And they will not come to you with a similitude except We come to you with the truth and the best interpretation.

34.The Wise Quran: Those who shall be gathered upon their faces to Hell, - Those are in the worst place, and err most from the path.

35.The Wise Quran: And verily, We gave Moses the Book, and We appointed with him his brother Aaron as minister;

36.The Wise Quran: And We said, 'Go both of you to the people, those who said Our signs are lies.' Then We destroyed them, destroying.

37.The Wise Quran: And the people of Noah, when they said the messengers were liars, We drowned them, and We made them a sign for mankind; and We prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

38.The Wise Quran: And 'Ad and Thamud and the people of Ar Rass, and many generations between them.

39.The Wise Quran: For all We have struck the similitudes, and all We destroyed, destroying.

40.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly they have come upon the city which was rained on, the rain of evil; then do they not see it? Nay, they do not hope to be raised up.

41.The Wise Quran: And when they see you they take you not except in jest, 'Is this he whom God has sent as a messenger?

42.The Wise Quran: He almost would have misled us from our gods, had we not been patient about them.' But soon they shall know when they see the punishment, who errs most from the path.

43.The Wise Quran: Have you seen him who takes his lusts for his god? Will you then be a trustee over him?

44.The Wise Quran: Or do you think that most of them will hear or become intelligent? They are not except like cattle. Nay, they err more from the way.

45.The Wise Quran: Have you not looked to your Lord how He has stretched out the shadow? But had He willed surely He would have made it stationary; and We made the sun a director to it,

46.The Wise Quran: Then We contract it towards Us with an easy contraction.

47.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who made the night a garment for you; and the sleep a rest, and made the day a resurrection.

48.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who sent the winds with glad tidings before His mercy; and We send down from the sky pure water,

49.The Wise Quran: To give life thereby to the dead country, and to give it for drink to what We have created, the cattle and many folk.

50.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly We have turned it about amongst them, that they may remember; but most of mankind refuse except disbelief.

51.The Wise Quran: And had We willed, surely We would have raised in every city a warner.

52.The Wise Quran: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive with them with it, a great striving.

53.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who loosed the two seas, this agreeable, sweet and this salt, bitter. And He made between them a barrier, and a ban forbidden.

54.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who has created mortals from the water, and has made for him blood relationship and marriage relationship; and your Lord is powerful.

55.The Wise Quran: And they serve, instead of God, what neither profits them nor hurts them; and the disbeliever is ever a partisan against his Lord.

56.The Wise Quran: We have only sent you to give tidings and to warn.

57.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I do not ask of you a reward for it, except for him who wishes to take to his Lord a way.'

58.The Wise Quran: And rely upon the Living, the one who dies not; and glorify with His praise, and He is aware enough of the sins of His servants.

59.The Wise Quran: The one who created the heavens and the earth, and what is between them in six days, then He made for the throne; the Merciful. So ask one aware of Him.

60.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'Prostrate to the Merciful!' They say, ' What is the Merciful? Shall we prostrate to what you order us?' And it increases their aversion.

61.The Wise Quran: Blessed is He who has placed in the heaven towers, and has placed therein a lamp and an illuminating moon.

62.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who made the night and day alternating for whoever desires to remember or wishes to be thankful.

63.The Wise Quran: And the servants of the Merciful are those who walk upon the earth lowly, and when the ignorant address them, they say, 'Peace.'

64.The Wise Quran: And those who spend the night prostrating to their Lord and standing;

65.The Wise Quran: And those who say, 'Our Lord! Turn from us the punishment of Hell; indeed, its punishment is persistent;

66.The Wise Quran: Indeed, it is evil as an abode and a station.'

67.The Wise Quran: And those who when they spend are neither extravagant nor miserly, and ever between that is a stand;

68.The Wise Quran: And those who do not call upon another god with God; And do not kill the soul which God has prohibited except with the right; And do not commit fornication, - and whoever does that shall meet with a penalty;

69.The Wise Quran: Doubled for him shall be the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he shall be therein for ever despised.

70.The Wise Quran: Except him who repented and believed and did good works, then those, God will change their evil deeds to good, and God is ever forgiving, compassionate.

71.The Wise Quran: And whoever repented and did good works, then indeed, he repents to God, repentance. -

72.The Wise Quran: And those who do not testify falsely; and when they pass by idle speech, pass by it honourably;

73.The Wise Quran: And those who when they are reminded of the signs of their Lord do not fall upon them deaf and blind;

74.The Wise Quran: And those who say, 'Our Lord! Grant us from our spouses and our offspring coolness of eyes, and make us a model to the pious.'

75.The Wise Quran: Those shall be rewarded with the upper chamber for that they were patient: and they shall meet therein with salutation and peace,

76.The Wise Quran: To dwell in it forever; a good abode and station.

77.The Wise Quran: Say, 'My Lord esteems you not but for your prayer, and verily you have denied, so soon will be an obligation.'

1.The Wise Quran: Ta.Sin.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: Those are the signs of the clear Book;

3.The Wise Quran: Perhaps you would kill yourself that they will not be believers.

4.The Wise Quran: If We will We send down upon them from the heaven a sign, so their necks remain bowed before it.

5.The Wise Quran: And there comes not to them any new reminder from the Merciful that they do not turn away from.

6.The Wise Quran: So verily, they have denied. Then there shall come to them news of that at which they mocked.

7.The Wise Quran: Have they not looked to the earth, how many we caused to grow therein of every noble kind?

8.The Wise Quran: Indeed, in that surely is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

9.The Wise Quran: And indeed, your Lord, surely, He is the Mighty, the Compassionate.

10.The Wise Quran: And when your Lord called Moses, 'Go to the unjust people,

11.The Wise Quran: To the people of Pharaoh, will they not fear?'

12.The Wise Quran: He said, 'My Lord! Indeed, I fear that they will call me liar;

13.The Wise Quran: And my breast is straitened, and my tongue is not fluent; so send for Aaron,

14.The Wise Quran: And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they may kill me.'

15.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Not so, but go, both of you, with Our signs, Indeed, We are with you listening.

16.The Wise Quran: So go both of you to Pharaoh and say, "Indeed, we bear a message of the Lord of the worlds,

17.The Wise Quran: Send with us the children of Israel."'

18.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you tarried among us for years of your life;

19.The Wise Quran: And you did your deed which you did, and you are of the ungrateful.'

20.The Wise Quran: He said, 'I did it, behold, and I was of those who err.

21.The Wise Quran: So I fled from you when I feared you, but my Lord granted me judgment, and made me one of the messengers;

22.The Wise Quran: And that is a favour which you reproach me with, that you have enslaved the children of Israel.'

23.The Wise Quran: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of the worlds?'

24.The Wise Quran: He said, 'The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between both of them, if you were sure.'

25.The Wise Quran: He said to those around him, 'Do you not hear?'

26.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.'

27.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Indeed, your messenger who is sent to you is surely mad.'

28.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Lord of the east and the west, and what is between both of them, if you are intelligent.'

29.The Wise Quran: He said, 'If you take a god besides me I will surely make you one of the imprisoned.'

30.The Wise Quran: He said, 'If I come to you with something clear?'

31.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Then bring it, if you are of the truthful.'

32.The Wise Quran: So he threw down his rod, and behold, it was a clear serpent.

33.The Wise Quran: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the beholders.

34.The Wise Quran: He said to the chiefs around him, 'Indeed, this is surely a knowing magician

35.The Wise Quran: He desires to drive you out from your land by his magic, so what do you advise?'

36.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Put him off and his brother, and send into the cities gatherers.

37.The Wise Quran: They will bring to you every knowing magician.'

38.The Wise Quran: So the magicians were assembled at an appointed place on a known day,

39.The Wise Quran: And it was said to the people, 'Are you assembled?'

40.The Wise Quran: Perhaps we may follow the magicians if they gain the upperhand.

41.The Wise Quran: So when the magicians came they said to Pharaoh, 'Shall we, indeed, have a reward if we gain the upper hand?'

42.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Yes; and, indeed, you shall then be of those who are brought near.'

43.The Wise Quran: Moses said to them, 'Throw down what you have to throw down.'

44.The Wise Quran: So they threw down their ropes and their rods and said, 'By Pharaoh's might, indeed, surely it is we who shall gain the upper hand.'

45.The Wise Quran: Then Moses threw down his rod, and behold, it swallowed what they falsified.

46.The Wise Quran: Then the magicians were thrown down prostrating.

47.The Wise Quran: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the worlds,

48.The Wise Quran: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.'

49.The Wise Quran: He said, 'You believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your chief who has taught you magic, So surely soon you shall know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all together.'

50.The Wise Quran: They said, 'No harm; indeed, we to our Lord return.

51.The Wise Quran: Indeed, we hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, that we are the first of the believers.'

52.The Wise Quran: And We inspired Moses, 'Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be followed.'

53.The Wise Quran: Then Pharaoh sent into the cities gatherers,

54.The Wise Quran: 'Indeed these are surely a small company,

55.The Wise Quran: And indeed, they are surely enraging us;

56.The Wise Quran: And indeed, we are surely altogether cautious.'

57.The Wise Quran: So We expelled them from gardens and springs,

58.The Wise Quran: And treasures and a noble station; -

59.The Wise Quran: Thus, - and We made the children of Israel to inherit them.

60.The Wise Quran: So they followed them at sunrise.

61.The Wise Quran: Then when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Moses said, 'Indeed, we are surely overtaken.'

62.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Not so; indeed, with me is my Lord, soon He will guide me.'

63.The Wise Quran: Then We inspired Moses, 'Strike with your rod the sea.' And it parted, and each part was like the great mountain.

64.The Wise Quran: And We brought near there, the others.

65.The Wise Quran: And we saved Moses and those with him all together;

66.The Wise Quran: Then We drowned the others.

67.The Wise Quran: Indeed, in that surely is a sign but most of them are not believers.

68.The Wise Quran: And indeed, your Lord, surely, He is the Mighty, the Compassionate.

69.The Wise Quran: And recite to them the story of Abraham;

70.The Wise Quran: When he said to his father and his people, 'What do you serve?'

71.The Wise Quran: They said, 'We serve idols, so we will remain devoted to them.'

72.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Can they hear you when you call,

73.The Wise Quran: Or profit you or harm?'

74.The Wise Quran: They said, 'No; but we found our fathers doing thus.'

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: Those are the signs of the wise Book,

3.The Wise Quran: A guidance and a mercy to the good-doers,

4.The Wise Quran: Those who are steadfast in the prayer and give the alms and they, they are sure of the hereafter;

5.The Wise Quran: Those are on guidance from their Lord, and those - they are the prosperous.

6.The Wise Quran: And among mankind is he who buys the diversion of narration, to lead astray from God's path, without knowledge, and to make jest of it; those, for them is shameful punishment.

7.The Wise Quran: And when Our signs are recited to him, he turns away, proudly, as if he had not heard them, as if in his two ears were dulness. So give him glad tidings of painful punishment.

8.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who believed and did good works, for them are the Gardens of pleasure,

9.The Wise Quran: To dwell therein forever; - God's promise in truth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

10.The Wise Quran: He created the heavens without pillars that you can see, and He threw upon the earth firm mountains lest it should move with you; and He dispersed in it of every creature; and We send down from the heavens water, and We caused to grow therein of every noble kind.

11.The Wise Quran: This is God's creation. So show Me what those besides Him have created. Nay, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

12.The Wise Quran: And certainly we gave Luqman wisdom, saying, 'Thank God; and whoever thanks God is only thankful for his own soul; and whoever is ungrateful, then indeed, God is free of need, praiseworthy.'

13.The Wise Quran: And when Luqman said to his son while admonishing him, 'O my son! Associate none with God, indeed, such association is a great wrong.'

14.The Wise Quran: And We have instructed man with his parents. His mother bore him with weakness upon weakness; and his weaning is in two years. 'Be thankful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the destination.

15.The Wise Quran: But if they strive with you that you should associate with Me that which you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them. But associate with them in the world with kindness, and follow the way of him who repents to Me; then unto Me is your return, then I will inform you of what you used to do.

16.The Wise Quran: 'O my son! Indeed it, if it is the weight of a grain of mustard seed, and it be in a rock or in the heavens or in the earth, God will bring it forth. Indeed God is subtle, aware.

17.The Wise Quran: O my son! Be steadfast in prayer, and bid what is reasonable and forbid what is wrong; be patient of what befalls you, indeed, that is of the determination of affairs.

18.The Wise Quran: And twist not your cheek proudly to mankind, and do not walk in the earth exultantly; indeed, God does not like every arrogant boaster.

19.The Wise Quran: And be moderate in your walk, and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of voices is the voice of the asses.'

20.The Wise Quran: Have you not seen that God has subjected to you what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and has poured down upon you His favours, outwardly and inwardly? But among men are those who dispute about God, without knowledge, and without guidance, and without an illuminating book.

21.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'Follow what God has sent down,' they say, 'Nay, we will follow what we found our fathers agreed upon.' Though the devil calls them to the punishment of the blaze?

22.The Wise Quran: And whoever submits his face to God, and does good, then indeed, he has grasped the firm handle; And to God is the end of affairs.

23.The Wise Quran: And whoever disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve you; to us is their return, then We will inform them of what they did; indeed, God knows what the breasts own.

24.The Wise Quran: We will let them enjoy themselves a little; then we will force them to harsh punishment.

25.The Wise Quran: And if you should ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely, definitely say, 'God.' Say, 'Praise be to God.' Nay, most of them do not know.

26.The Wise Quran: To God belongs what is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, God, He is free of need, praiseworthy.

27.The Wise Quran: And if that what is in the earth of tree were pens, and the sea - increase it after it seven seas, - the words of God would not be spent. Indeed, God is mighty, wise.

28.The Wise Quran: Your creation and your resurrection are not except as one soul; indeed God is hearing, seeing.

29.The Wise Quran: Do you not see that God joins the night to the day and joins the day to the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each runs on to a named term? And that God of what you do is aware?

30.The Wise Quran: That is because God, He is the Truth, and that what they call on besides Him is the falsehood, and that God, He is the High, the Great.

31.The Wise Quran: Do you not see that the ship runs in the sea by the favour of God, that He may show you of His signs? Indeed, in that are signs to every patient, grateful one.

32.The Wise Quran: And when a wave like shadows covers them, they call on God, sincere in their religion; then when He saves them to the land, then among them is he who is moderate. And none deny our signs except every ungrateful traitor.

33.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Fear your Lord and dread the day when a father shall not atone for his son, nor shall a child atone anything for his father. Indeed, the promise of God is true. So let not the worldly life deceive you; and let not the deceiver deceive you about God.

34.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God, with Him is the knowledge of the Hour; and He sends down the rain; and He knows what is in the wombs; and no soul knows what it shall earn tomorrow; and no soul knows in what land it shall die; indeed, God is knowing, aware.

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.The Wise Quran: Alif.Lam.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: The revelation of the Book, there is no doubt in it, from the Lord of the worlds.

3.The Wise Quran: Or do they say, 'He has forged it?' Nay, it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people, to whom no warner has come before you, perhaps they may be guided.

4.The Wise Quran: God is the one who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days; then He made for the throne. You have no patron besides Him and no intercessor; then will you not remember?

5.The Wise Quran: He governs the affair from the heaven to the earth; then it ascends to Him in a day, the measure of which is a thousand years of what you number.

6.The Wise Quran: That is the knower of the unseen and the seen; the Mighty, the Compassionate,

7.The Wise Quran: The one who made good everything He has created, and He began the creation of man from clay;

8.The Wise Quran: Then He made his progeny from an extract of contemptible water;

9.The Wise Quran: Then He fashioned him and blew into him of His spirit, and made for you the hearing and the eyes and the hearts; little is what you give thanks.

10.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'When we are lost in the earth, shall we indeed be in a new creation?' Nay they are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord.

11.The Wise Quran: Say, 'The angel of death, who has been entrusted with you, shall take you, then to your Lord you shall be returned.'

12.The Wise Quran: And if you could see when the sinners hang down their heads before their Lord, 'Our Lord! We have seen and we have heard; so send us back, we will do right. Indeed, we are sure.'

13.The Wise Quran: And if We had willed, surely We would have given every soul its guidance; but the word from Me is true; - I will surely fill Hell with the jinn and mankind all together.

14.The Wise Quran: So taste because you forgot the meeting of this your day; indeed, We have forgotten you. And taste the punishment of eternity for what you used to do.

15.The Wise Quran: Only those believe in Our signs who, when they are reminded of them fall down prostrating and glorify with praise of their Lord and they are not proud.

16.The Wise Quran: Their sides forsake the beds, they call on their Lord with fear and hope; and of what We have bestowed on them, they spend.

17.The Wise Quran: No soul knows what is hidden for them of coolness of eyes; a reward for what they used to do.

18.The Wise Quran: Then is he who is a believer like him who is disobedient? They are not equal.

19.The Wise Quran: As for those who believed and did good works, then for them are gardens of refuge, an entertainment for what they used to do.

20.The Wise Quran: But as for those who are disobedient, their refuge is the fire. Every time they desire to go forth from it, they shall be returned to it, and it will be said to them, 'Taste the punishment of the fire which you called a lie.'

21.The Wise Quran: And We will surely make them taste of the nearer punishment before the greater; perhaps they may return.

22.The Wise Quran: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, then turns away from them? Indeed, We will take retribution from the sinners.

23.The Wise Quran: And We certainly gave Moses the Book; so do not be in doubt concerning the reception of it; and We made it a guidance to the children of Israel.

24.The Wise Quran: And We made amongst them leaders guiding by Our command, since they were patient and were sure of Our signs.

25.The Wise Quran: Indeed, your Lord, He will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they were disagreeing.

26.The Wise Quran: Is it not conspicuous to them how many generations We have destroyed before them? They walk in their dwellings. Indeed, in that surely are signs: will they not then hear?

27.The Wise Quran: Have they not seen that We drive the water to sterile land, and bring forth thereby crops from which their cattle and themselves eat? Will they not then see?

28.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'When will be this, the victory, if you are truthful?'

29.The Wise Quran: Say, 'On the day of the victory their faith shall not profit those who disbelieved, nor shall they be respited;'

30.The Wise Quran: So turn from them and wait; indeed, they are waiting.

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Fear God and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites; indeed, God is ever knowing, wise.

2.The Wise Quran: And follow what is inspired to you from your Lord; indeed, God is ever aware of what you do.

3.The Wise Quran: And rely upon God, and God sufficed for a trustee.

4.The Wise Quran: God has not made for any man two hearts in his inside; and He has not made your wives whose backs you liken to the backs of your mothers as your mothers. And He has not made your adopted sons your sons. That is your saying with your mouths, but God says the truth, and He guides to the way.

5.The Wise Quran: Call them by their fathers; it is more just in God's sight; but if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brothers in religion and your clients. And there is no crime upon you for what mistakes you make therein; but what your hearts do purposely - but God is ever forgiving merciful.

6.The Wise Quran: The prophet is more worthy of the believers than their souls, and his wives are their mothers. And the possessors of blood relationships, some of them are more worthy of some in the Book of God than the believers and the emigrants; except that you do kindness to your patrons, that is written in the Book.

7.The Wise Quran: And when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah, and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a strong covenant.

8.The Wise Quran: That He may ask the truthful of their truth. And He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful punishment.

9.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Remember God's favour upon you when hosts came to you and We sent upon them a wind and hosts you could not see; - and God sees what you do.

10.The Wise Quran: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes deviated, and the hearts reached the throats, and you thought the thoughts about God.

11.The Wise Quran: There the believers were tried and shaken with a severe shaking.

12.The Wise Quran: And when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is sickness said, 'God and His messenger promised us not except deception.'

13.The Wise Quran: And when a party of them said, 'O people of Yathrib; there is no place for you, so return.' And a party of them asked permission of the prophet, saying, 'Indeed, our houses are exposed; but they were not exposed, they only wished to flee.

14.The Wise Quran: And if they had been entered upon from its regions then had been asked the trial, they would surely have given it; and they would not have tarried in it except a little.

15.The Wise Quran: And certainly, they had covenanted with God before, not to turn their backs; and God's covenant shall be enquired of.

16.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Flight will not avail you if you flee from death or killing; and then you shall not be granted enjoyment except a little.'

17.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who is it that can save you from God, if He wish you evil, or wish you mercy?' And they will not find for themselves besides God a patron or a helper.

18.The Wise Quran: Verily, God knows those who hinder among you, and those who say to their brothers, 'Come to us,' and they come not to the battle but a little.

19.The Wise Quran: Covetous towards you. But when fear comes, you see them looking towards you, their eyes rolling like one who faints from death; but when the fear departs, they will assail you with sharp tongues, covetous of the best. Those have not believed, so God will make their works void, and that is easy for God.

20.The Wise Quran: They think the confederates have not departed; and if the confederates come, they would wish they were in the desert among the Bedouins, asking about your news. And if they were among you they would not fight except a little.

21.The Wise Quran: Certainly you have in the messenger of God a good example for whoever hopes for God and the Last Day, and remembers God much.

22.The Wise Quran: And when the believers saw the confederates they said, 'This is what God and His messenger promised us; God and His messenger are true.' And it only increased them in faith and submission.

23.The Wise Quran: Among the believers are men who have been true to what they promised God. And among them is he who has fulfilled his vow, and among them is he who waits and they have not changed, changing.

24.The Wise Quran: That God may reward the truthful for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if He wills, or relent on them. Indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

25.The Wise Quran: And God drove back those who disbelieved in their rage; they attained no good. God sufficed the believers in the fight, and God is strong, mighty.

26.The Wise Quran: And He sent down those of the people of the Book who backed them from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts; a part you slew and you took captive a part.

27.The Wise Quran: And He caused you to inherit their land, and their houses, and their properties and a land you had not trodden, and God is ever powerful over everything.

28.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Say to your wives, 'If you desire the worldly life and its adornments, then come, I will provide for you and release you, a beautiful release.

29.The Wise Quran: But if you desire God and His messenger and the home of the hereafter, then indeed, God has prepared for those of you who do good a great reward.'

30.The Wise Quran: O women of the prophet! Whoever of you commits manifest immorality, the punishment shall be doubled for her twice; and that is easy unto God.

31.The Wise Quran: And whoever of you is obedient to God and His messenger and does right, We will give her her reward twice, and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

32.The Wise Quran: O women of the prophet! You are not like any other women; if you fear then do not be soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is sickness yearn; but speak a reasonable speech.

33.The Wise Quran: And stay in your houses and do not display yourselves, the display of the former times of ignorance; and be steadfast in the prayer, and give the alms, and obey God and His messenger; - God only desires to remove from you the uncleanness, people of the house! And to purify you, purifying.

34.The Wise Quran: And remember what is recited in your houses of the signs of God and wisdom; Indeed, God is subtle, aware.

35.The Wise Quran: Indeed, men who submit and women who submit, and men who believe and women who believe, and obedient men and obedient women, and truthful men and truthful women, and patient men and patient women, and humble men and humble women, and men who give charity and women who give charity, and men who fast and women who fast, and men who guard their private parts and women who guard, and men who remember God much, and women who remember, God has prepared for them forgiveness and a great reward.

36.The Wise Quran: It is not for a believing man or for a believing woman, when God and His messenger have decided an affair, to have a choice in their affair; and whoever rebels against God and His messenger certainly, has erred a clear error.

37.The Wise Quran: And when you said to the one who God had shown favour to and you had shown favour to, 'Keep your wife to yourself and fear God;' And you concealed in your soul what God was to display; and you feared men, and God has more right that you should fear Him; and when Zayd had fulfilled his desire of her We married her to you that there should be no straitness on the believers concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they have fulfilled their desire of them; and the command of God is to be done.

38.The Wise Quran: There is no straitness on the prophet about what God has ordained for him; - the course of God with those who have passed away before, - and God's command is a decreed decree.

39.The Wise Quran: Those who convey God's messages and fear Him and do not fear anyone except God, - and God sufficed for a reckoner.

40.The Wise Quran: Muhammad is not the father of anyone of your men, but the messenger of God, and the seal of the prophets; and God knows all things.

41.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Remember God with much remembrance,

42.The Wise Quran: And glorify Him morning (Dawn to sunrise) and evening (Mid-afternoon to sunset).

43.The Wise Quran: He is the one who prays for you and His angels, to bring you out of the darkness into the light, and He is compassionate to the believers.

44.The Wise Quran: Their salutation on the day they meet Him shall be 'Peace.' And He has prepared for them a noble reward.

45.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a herald of glad tidings and a warner,

46.The Wise Quran: And as one who calls to God with His permission, and as an illuminating lamp.

47.The Wise Quran: And give glad tidings to the believers, that for them is great grace from God.

48.The Wise Quran: And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites; and disregard their harm, and rely upon God, and God suffices for a trustee.

49.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! When you marry believing women then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is no waiting period for you to count concerning them; so provide for them and release them, a beautiful release.

50.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Indeed, We make lawful for you your wives to whom you have given their wages, and what your right hand possesses out of the booty that God has granted you, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts, those who emigrated with you, and any believing woman if she gives herself to the prophet, if the prophet desires to marry her; - exclusively for you, apart from the believers. Certainly, We know what We ordained for them concerning their wives and what their right hands possess, that there should be no straitness on you; and God is forgiving, compassionate.

51.The Wise Quran: You may put off whomever you will of them and take to yourself whomever you will, and whoever you desire of those whom you had set aside - and it shall be no crime against you. That is nearer to cooling their eyes and that they should not grieve, and should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And God knows what is in your hearts; and God is knowing, clement.

52.The Wise Quran: It is not lawful for you to take women after, nor to change them for wives, even though their beauty please you; except what your right hand possesses, and God is ever watchful over all things.

53.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Do not enter the houses of the prophet, except permission is given to you, for a meal, - not watching till it is cooked. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, then disperse, not engaging in familiar discourse. Indeed, that would annoy the prophet and he is shy of you, but God is not shy of the truth. And when you ask them for an article, then ask them from behind a veil; that is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not for you to hurt the messenger of God, nor to marry his wives after him ever; indeed, that is with God great.

54.The Wise Quran: Whether you display a thing or conceal it, and indeed, God knows all things.

55.The Wise Quran: There is no crime against them concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or what their right hands possess; and fear God, - indeed, God is witness over all things.

56.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God and His angels pray for the prophet. O those who believe! Pray for him and greet him greetings.

57.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who annoy God and His messenger, God has cursed them in the world and the hereafter, and He has prepared for them shameful punishment.

58.The Wise Quran: And those who annoy believing men and believing women for other than what they have earned, then certainly, they bear calumny and manifest sin.

59.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Say to your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers, to let down over them their outer garments; that is nearer for them to be known and not annoyed; and God is forgiving, compassionate.

60.The Wise Quran: Surely if the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a sickness and the agitators in Al Madinah do not desist, We will surely, definitely incite you against them. Then they shall not dwell near you therein except for a little while.

61.The Wise Quran: Cursed wherever they are found, taken and slain, a slaying.

62.The Wise Quran: God's course with those who have passed away before; and you shall never find in God's course any change.

63.The Wise Quran: Mankind will ask you about the Hour; say, 'The knowledge of it is only with God, and what will make you know? Perhaps the Hour is near?'

64.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God has cursed the disbelievers and has prepared for them a blaze.

65.The Wise Quran: To dwell therein for ever; they shall not find a patron nor a helper.

66.The Wise Quran: The day their faces will be turned about in the fire they shall say, 'O, would that we had obeyed God and obeyed the messenger.'

67.The Wise Quran: And they shall say, 'Our Lord! Indeed, we obeyed our chiefs and our great men and they led us astray from the path.

68.The Wise Quran: Our Lord! Give them double punishment and curse them, a great curse.'

69.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Do not be like those who annoyed Moses; but God cleared him of what they said, and he was regarded in the sight of God.

70.The Wise Quran: O those who believe! Fear God and speak a straight-forward speech.

71.The Wise Quran: He will correct for you your works, and forgive you your sins; and whoever obeys God and His messenger, then certainly he has attained a great success.

72.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it, and were afraid of it; but man bore it; indeed, he is ever unjust and ignorant.

73.The Wise Quran: That God may punish the hypocrites men and women, and the idolaters and idolatresses; and God will relent on the believers, men and women; and God is ever forgiving, compassionate.

1.The Wise Quran: Praise be to God, the one who for Him is whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth; and His is the praise in the hereafter, and He is the Wise, the Aware.

2.The Wise Quran: He knows what goes into the earth, and what comes forth from it, and what descends from the sky, and what ascends in it; and He is the Compassionate, the Forgiving.

3.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'The Hour shall not come to us.' Say, 'Nay, by my Lord, surely it shall definitely come to you. The knower of the unseen.' Not an atom's weight, or less than that or greater, escapes Him in the heavens and in the earth, but it is in a clear Book;

4.The Wise Quran: That He may reward those who believed and did good works; those, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision.

5.The Wise Quran: But those who strive concerning Our signs to frustrate; those, for them is a punishment of a painful plague.

6.The Wise Quran: And those to whom knowledge has been given see that what is sent down to you from your Lord is the truth, and guides unto the way of the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

7.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you that when you are torn all to pieces, indeed you shall be in a new creation?

8.The Wise Quran: Has he forged against God a lie, or is madness in him?' Nay, those who do not believe in the hereafter are in the punishment and in far error.

9.The Wise Quran: Have they not looked at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We will We sink the earth with them, or make to fall upon them a portion of the heaven; indeed, in that surely is a sign to every repentant servant.

10.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We gave David grace from us, 'O mountains! Echo praises with him, and the birds!' And We softened for him iron,

11.The Wise Quran: 'Make coats of mail, and measure well the links. And do right; indeed, I see what you do.'

12.The Wise Quran: And to Solomon the wind; its morning journey was a month, and its evening journey was a month; and We made to flow for him a fountain of molten brass; and of the jinns some to work before him by the permission of his Lord; and whoever deviates amongst them from Our command We will give him to taste the punishment of the blaze;

13.The Wise Quran: They made for him what he willed of chambers and images, and dishes like troughs, and firm pots; work, O family of David! Thankfully; and few is it of My servants who are thankful.

14.The Wise Quran: And when We decreed for him death, they were not directed to his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff; and when he fell down it was made manifest to the jinns that, if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in the shameful punishment.

15.The Wise Quran: Certainly, Sheba had in their dwellings a sign: two gardens, on the right and on the left, 'Eat from the provision of your Lord; and give thanks to Him. A good country and a forgiving Lord.'

16.The Wise Quran: But they turned away, and We sent against them the flood of the dyke; and We changed for them their two gardens into two gardens that grew bitter fruit and tamarisk, and some few lote trees.

17.The Wise Quran: That We recompensed them because they disbelieved; and do We recompense except the ungrateful?

18.The Wise Quran: And We made between them and the cities which We have blessed, cities easy to be seen; and We measured out the journey between them: 'Travel in them safely night and day.'

19.The Wise Quran: And they said, 'Our Lord! Make a greater distance between our journeys;' And they wronged themselves, and We made them legends; and We tore them all to pieces; indeed, in that surely are signs for every patient, grateful one.

20.The Wise Quran: And Iblis verified his suspicion concerning them, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.

21.The Wise Quran: And he had no authority over them, except that We might know who it was that believed in the hereafter from him who amongst them was in doubt; And your Lord is guardian over everything.

22.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Call on those whom you claim besides God;' They cannot control the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth; nor have they any partnership in either; nor has He amongst them any supporter;

23.The Wise Quran: Nor is intercession of any avail with Him, except for him whom He permits; until when terror is removed from their hearts, they will say, 'What said your Lord?' They will say, 'The truth.' And He is the High, the Great.

24.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Who provides for you out of the heavens and the earth?' Say, 'God.' And indeed, we or you are surely upon guidance or in clear error.

25.The Wise Quran: Say, 'You shall not be asked about our sins, nor shall we be asked about what you do.

26.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Judge, the Knowing.'

27.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Show me those whom you have joined to Him as partners. Not so, nay, He is God, the Mighty, the Wise.'

28.The Wise Quran: We have not sent you to mankind one and all except as a herald of glad tidings and a warner; but most of mankind do not know.

29.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'When shall this promise be, if you are truthful?'

30.The Wise Quran: Say, 'For you is the appointment of a day that you shall not put back by an hour nor put it forward.'

31.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'We will never believe in this Quran or in what is before it;' But if you could see when the wrongdoers are stationed before their Lord, bandying argument the one against the other. Those who were thought weak shall say to those who were proud, 'If not for you certainly we would have been believers.'

32.The Wise Quran: Those who were proud shall say to those who were thought weak, 'Did we hinder you from the guidance after when it came to you? Nay, you were sinners.'

33.The Wise Quran: And those who were thought weak shall say to those who were proud, 'Nay, plotting night and day, when you were commanding us to disbelieve in God, and to make peers for Him.' And they shall display repentance when they see the punishment; and We will put the fetters on the necks of those who disbelieved. Shall they be rewarded except for what they used to do?

34.The Wise Quran: We have not sent a warner in a town except its affluent ones said, 'Indeed, we disbelieve in what you are sent with.'

35.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'We have more wealth and children, and We shall not be punished.'

36.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, my Lord extends provision to whom He wills or restricts, but most of mankind do not know.'

37.The Wise Quran: And neither your wealth nor your children is that which will bring you to a near approach to Us, except whoever believed and did good works; then those, for them is a double reward for what they did, and they in the upper chambers shall be secure.

38.The Wise Quran: And those who strive concerning Our signs to frustrate, those shall be arraigned in the punishment.

39.The Wise Quran: Indeed my Lord extends provision to whomever He wills of His servants, or restricts it for him. And whatever thing you shall expend, then He will repay it; and He is the best of providers.

40.The Wise Quran: And on the day He will gather them all together, then He will say to the angels, 'Did these used to worship you?'

41.The Wise Quran: They shall say, 'Glory be to You. You are our patron instead of them. Nay, they used to worship the jinns, most of them are believers in them.'

42.The Wise Quran: But today they cannot control for each other either profit or harm; and We will say to those who have done wrong, 'Taste the punishment of the fire, which you used to deny.'

1.The Wise Quran: Praise be to God, the originator of the heavens and the earth; who makes the angels messengers possessors of wings, two or three or four; He increases in creation what He wills; indeed, God is powerful over everything.

2.The Wise Quran: What God opens to mankind of mercy, then none can withhold it; and what He withholds, then none can send if forth after Him; And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

3.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Remember the favours of God upon you; is there any creator besides God, who provides for you from the sky and the earth? There is no god but He; so how are you turned away?

4.The Wise Quran: And if they call you liar, then certainly, messengers were called liars before you, and to God affairs return.

5.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Indeed, God's promise is true; so let not the worldly life deceive you, and let not the deceiver deceive you about God.

6.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the devil is to you an enemy, so take him as an enemy; he only calls his crew to be among the fellows of the blaze.

12.The Wise Quran: And the two seas are not equal: this agreeable, sweet, its drink is easy to swallow, and this salt, bitter. And from each you eat fresh meat, and bring forth ornaments which you wear; and you may see the ships cleave through it, that you may seek of His grace, and perhaps you may give thanks.

13.The Wise Quran: He makes the night to enter into the day and makes the day to enter into the night; and He subjects the sun and the moon, each runs on to a named term. That is God, your Lord. His is the kingdom; but those you call on besides Him do not possess the husk of a date seed.

14.The Wise Quran: If you call upon them they hear not your call, and if they hear they cannot answer you; and on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association; and none can inform you like one who is aware.

16.The Wise Quran: If He wills, He will remove you, and bring a new creation;

18.The Wise Quran: And no burdened soul shall bear the burden of another; and if a heavily laden one calls to its load, nothing of it shall be carried, even though he is a relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord in the unseen and who are steadfast in the prayer; and whoever purifies himself, purifies himself only for his soul; and to God is the destination.

20.The Wise Quran: Nor darkness and the light,

21.The Wise Quran: Nor the shade and the heat,

24.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth, a herald of glad tidings and a warner; and there is no nation but a warner has passed away in it.

25.The Wise Quran: And if they deny you, then certainly, those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, and with the scriptures, and with the illuminating Book.

26.The Wise Quran: Then I seized those who disbelieved, and how was My disapproval.

27.The Wise Quran: Do you not see that God sends down from the heaven water, and We bring forth therewith fruits, their colours are different? And among the mountains are tracks: white and red, their colours are different, and intensely black.

28.The Wise Quran: And of mankind and the creatures and the cattle, its colours are different. Thus. Only those of His servants who have knowledge fear God; indeed, God is mighty, forgiving.

29.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who recite the Book of God, and are steadfast in prayer, and spend of what We have provided them, in secret and in public, hope for a commerce that shall not come to nothing;

30.The Wise Quran: That He may pay them in full their wages, and give them increase of His grace; indeed, He is forgiving, grateful.

31.The Wise Quran: And that which We have inspired you with of the Book it is the truth, verifying what was before it; indeed, God of His servants surely is aware, seeing.

32.The Wise Quran: Then We gave the Book for an inheritance to those whom We chose of Our servants, and of them is he who wrongs himself, and of them is he who is moderate, and of them is he who is foremost in good works with the permission of God; that it is the great grace.

38.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God knows the unseen of the heavens and the earth; indeed, He knows what the breasts own.

39.The Wise Quran: He is the one who made you vicegerents in the earth, and whoever disbelieves, then upon him is his disbelief; and their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers with their Lord except in hatred; and their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers except in loss.

40.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you considered your associates whom you call on besides God?' 41.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God holds the heavens and the earth lest they should decline; and if they should decline there is none to hold them after Him; indeed, He is clement, forgiving.

42.The Wise Quran: And they swore with God the utmost of their oaths, surely, if a warner comes to them, they would surely, definitely be more guided than any of the nations; then when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion,

43.The Wise Quran: Being proud in the land, and plotting evil; but the plotting of evil only entangles its people; so do they wait except for the course of the former people? But you shall not find any change in the course of God; and you shall not find any alteration in the course of God.

44.The Wise Quran: Have they not travelled in the land and seen how was the end of those before them? And they were stronger than them in might. And God - there is nothing in the heavens nor in the earth that can frustrate Him. Indeed, He is knowing, powerful.

45.The Wise Quran: And if God should chastise mankind for what they have earned, He would not leave on its back any creature; but He respites them to a named term. And when their term comes, then indeed, God sees His servants.
