37.The Wise Quran: The ways of the heavens, and may mount up to the god of Moses; for indeed, I surely think him a liar.' And thus was beautified for Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and He was hindered from the way; but Pharaoh's plot was not except in ruin.

38.The Wise Quran: And he who believed said, 'O my people! Follow me, I will guide you to the way of the right direction.

39.The Wise Quran: O my people! This, the worldly life is only a provision, but indeed, the hereafter, it is the abode of stability.

40.The Wise Quran: Whoever does evil, he shall only be recompensed with the like of it; and whoever does right, whether male or female and a believer, then those shall enter the Garden; they shall be provided therein without count.

41.The Wise Quran: O my people! What ails me that I call you to salvation, and you call me to the fire?

42.The Wise Quran: You call me to disbelieve in God, and to join with Him what I have no knowledge of; and I call you to the Mighty, the Very Forgiving.

43.The Wise Quran: No doubt that what you call me to, there is no call for it in the world nor in the hereafter, and that our return is to God, and that the extravagant, they are the fellows of the fire.

44.The Wise Quran: And soon you will remember what I say to you; and I entrust my affair to God, surely, God sees the servants.'

45.The Wise Quran: So God guarded him from the evils of what they plotted, and there encompassed the people of Pharaoh the evil punishment.

46.The Wise Quran: The fire, they are exposed to it morning (After sunrise to mid-morning) and afternoon (Noon to mid-afternoon); and on the day the Hour shall arise: 'Admit the people of Pharaoh into the severest punishment!'

47.The Wise Quran: And when they argue in the fire, and the weak say to those who were proud, 'Indeed, We were followers of yours, so can you avail us against a portion of the fire?'

48.The Wise Quran: Those who were proud shall say, 'Indeed, we are all in it; indeed, God certainly has judged between the servants.'

49.The Wise Quran: And those who are in the fire shall say to the keepers of Hell, 'Call upon your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment.'

50.The Wise Quran: They shall say, 'Did not your messengers come to you with the clear proofs?' They shall say, 'Yea.' They shall say, 'Then call!' - but the call of the disbelievers is only in error.

51.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We will surely help Our messengers, and those who believe, in the worldly life and on the day the witnesses shall stand;

52.The Wise Quran: The day their excuse shall not avail the unjust; and for them is the curse, and for them is an evil abode.

53.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We gave Moses the guidance; and We made the children of Israel inherit the Book,

54.The Wise Quran: A guidance and a reminder for possessors of understanding.

55.The Wise Quran: So be patient; indeed, God's promise is true: and ask forgiveness for your sins, and glorify with praise of your Lord in the afternoon (Noon to mid-afternoon) and the morning (Dawn to sunrise).

56.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of God without authority having come to them, there is nothing in their breasts but pride; they shall not attain it. So seek refuge with God, surely He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

57.The Wise Quran: Surely the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of mankind do not know.

58.The Wise Quran: The blind and the seeing are not alike, nor those who believe and do good works and the evildoer; little is what you remember.

59.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the Hour is surely coming; there is no doubt in it; but most of mankind do not believe.

60.The Wise Quran: And your Lord said, 'Call upon Me, I will respond to you; indeed, those who are proud for My worship shall soon enter Hell, contemptible.'

61.The Wise Quran: God is the one who made for you the night to rest therein, and the day to see by; indeed, God is surely a possessor of grace upon mankind, but most of mankind give no thanks.

62.The Wise Quran: That is God, your Lord, the Creator of everything. There is no god but He, so how are you turned away?

63.The Wise Quran: Thus those who used to deny the signs of God were turned away.

64.The Wise Quran: God is the one who made for you the earth a resting-place, and the heaven a building, and He fashioned you and made good your forms; and provided you of the good things. That is God, your Lord; then blessed is God, the Lord of the worlds.

65.The Wise Quran: He is the Living, there is no God but He. So call on Him, sincere to Him in the religion; praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

66.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, I am forbidden to serve those whom you call on besides God, since the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I am commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.

67.The Wise Quran: He is the one who created you from dust, then from a sperm, then from a clot, then He brings you forth a child; then you reach your strength; then you become old, - and of you is he who dies before, - and that you may reach a named term, and perhaps you may become intelligent.

68.The Wise Quran: He is the one who gives life and causes death, and when He decrees a matter, then He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.

69.The Wise Quran: Have you not seen those who dispute concerning the signs of God, how they are turned away?

70.The Wise Quran: Those who call the Book, and what We have sent Our messengers with, a lie, but soon they shall know -

71.The Wise Quran: When the fetters are on their necks and the chains, they are dragged

72.The Wise Quran: In hot water. Then in the fire they shall be burned.

73.The Wise Quran: Then it shall be said to them, 'Where is what you used to associate

74.The Wise Quran: Besides God?' They shall say, 'They have strayed away from us; nay, we did not call before upon anything.' - Thus does God lead the disbelievers astray.

75.The Wise Quran: That is because you used to rejoice in the earth without right; and because you used to be exultant.

76.The Wise Quran: Enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein; for evil is the abode of the proud.

77.The Wise Quran: So be patient; indeed, the promise of God is true; and whether We show you some of what We promise them, or We surely cause you to die, then unto us they shall be returned.

78.The Wise Quran: And certainly we sent messengers before you: of them are those whose stories We have related to you, and of them are those whose stories We have not related to you; and it was not for a messenger that he comes with a sign, except with God's permission; but when God's command came it was decided with truth, and there the vain-doers lost.

79.The Wise Quran: God is the one who made for you the cattle, that you may ride of them; - and of them you eat,

80.The Wise Quran: And you have in them advantages; and that you may attain upon them a want in your breasts; upon them and upon the ships you are carried.

81.The Wise Quran: And He shows you His signs; so which of God's signs do you deny?

82.The Wise Quran: Have they not travelled in the land and seen how was the end of those before them, they were more numerous than them and stronger in might, and traces in the land? But of no avail to them was what they had earned.

83.The Wise Quran: And when their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, they rejoiced in what knowledge they had; but they were encompassed by what they used to mock at.

84.The Wise Quran: And when they saw Our punishment they said, 'We believe in God alone, and we disbelieve in what we used to associate with Him.'

85.The Wise Quran: But their faith was of no avail to them when they saw Our punishment - the course of God which certainly has passed away among His servants, and there the disbelievers lost.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.The Wise Quran: Ha.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: A revelation from the Merciful, the Compassionate;

3.The Wise Quran: A book whose signs are detailed; an Arabic Quran for a people who know;

4.The Wise Quran: A herald of glad tidings and a warner. Then most of them turn away and they do not hear,

5.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'Our hearts are in coverings from what you call us to, and in our ears is dulness, and between us and you there is a veil; so work; Indeed we are working.'

6.The Wise Quran: Say, 'I am only a mortal like you, I am inspired that your god is one god; So go straight to Him, and ask forgiveness of Him;' and woe to the idolaters,

7.The Wise Quran: Those who do not give the alms, and they in the hereafter, they are disbelievers.

8.The Wise Quran: Surely those who believe and do good works, for them is a reward unending.

9.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Do you indeed disbelieve in the one who created the earth in two days, and do you make peers for Him? That is the Lord of the worlds.'

10.The Wise Quran: And He placed thereon firm mountains above it and blessed it, and apportioned therein its foods in four days alike for those who ask.

11.The Wise Quran: Then He made for the heaven and it was smoke, and He said to it and to the earth, ' Come, you two, whether you will or no.' They said, 'We come willingly.'

12.The Wise Quran: And He decreed them seven heavens in two days, and inspired every heaven with its bidding: and We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps and a guard; that is the decree of the Mighty, the Knowing.

13.The Wise Quran: But if they turn away, then say, 'I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of 'Ad and Thamud':

14.The Wise Quran: When the messengers came to them from before them and from behind them 'Serve none but God' They said, 'If our Lord willed, surely He would send down angels; so indeed, we in what you are sent with disbelieve.'

15.The Wise Quran: And as for 'Ad, they were proud in the land without right, and they said, 'Who is stronger than us in strength?' Did they not see that God, the one who created them He is stronger than them in strength? And they denied Our signs.

16.The Wise Quran: And We sent upon them an intensely cold wind in unfortunate days, that We might make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life; - but surely the punishment of the hereafter is more disgraceful, and they shall not be helped.

17.The Wise Quran: And as for Thamud We guided them; but they preferred blindness to guidance, and the thunderbolt of the punishment of abasement caught them for what they used to earn;

18.The Wise Quran: But We saved those who believed and used to fear.

19.The Wise Quran: And the day the enemies of God shall be gathered together into the fire, marshalled along;

20.The Wise Quran: Until when they come to it, their hearing and their eyesight and their skins shall bear witness against them of what they used to do.

21.The Wise Quran: And they shall say to their skins, 'Why have you borne witness against us?' They shall say, 'God gave us speech who has given speech to everything; and He created you at first, and unto Him shall you be returned;

22.The Wise Quran: And you could not conceal yourselves that your hearing and your eyesight should not be witness against you, nor your skins; but you thought that God did not know much of what you do.

23.The Wise Quran: And that thought of yours which you thought concerning your Lord has destroyed you, and you have become of the losers.'

24.The Wise Quran: And if they are patient, still the fire is a lodging for them; and if they ask for favour again, they shall not be taken into favour.

25.The Wise Quran: And We appointed for them companions, then they beautified for them what was before them and what was behind them; and due against them was the sentence on the nations who passed away before them; both of jinns and of mankind; indeed, they were the losers.

26.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say, 'Do not listen to this, the Quran, and make idle speech concerning it, perhaps you may gain the upper hand.'

27.The Wise Quran: But surely We will make those who disbelieve taste a severe punishment; and surely We will recompense them with the worst of that which they used to do.

28.The Wise Quran: That is the recompense of the enemies of God, - the fire. For them is an eternal abode therein a recompense for that they denied Our signs.

29.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieved say, 'Our Lord, show us those who have led us astray amongst the jinns and mankind; We will place them beneath our feet, and they shall both be among the lowest.'

30.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is God,' and then go straight, the angels descend upon them, 'Fear not and do not grieve, but receive the glad tidings of the Garden which you were promised;

31.The Wise Quran: We are your patrons in the worldly life and in the hereafter, and you shall have therein what your souls desire, and you shall have therein what you call for,

32.The Wise Quran: An entertainment from the Forgiving, the Compassionate.'

33.The Wise Quran: And who is better in speech than he who called to God and did good works, and said, 'Indeed, I am of those who submit.'?

34.The Wise Quran: And the good deed and the evil deed are not equal; repel with what is best, and behold the one whom between you and him was enmity shall be as if he were a warm patron.

35.The Wise Quran: But none shall receive it, except those who are patient; and none shall receive it except the possessor of great fortune.

36.The Wise Quran: And if an incitement from the devil incites you, then seek refuge in God; indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

37.The Wise Quran: And of His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate to the sun nor to the moon; but prostrate to God who created them, if it is Him you serve.

38.The Wise Quran: And if they are proud, then those who are with your Lord glorify Him by night and day, and they do not tire.

39.The Wise Quran: And of His signs, that you may see the earth humble, and when We send water upon it it stirs and swells; indeed, He who has given it life is surely the giver of life to the dead; indeed, He is powerful over everything.

40.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who deviate from Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is he who is cast into the fire better, or he who comes safe on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you will; indeed, He sees what you do.

41.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the reminder when it comes to them, - and indeed, it is surely a mighty Book.

42.The Wise Quran: Falsehood shall not come to it, from before it, nor from behind it, - a revelation from one wise, praiseworthy.

43.The Wise Quran: Nothing is said to you but what was said to the messengers before you, indeed, your Lord is surely the possessor of forgiveness and the possessor of painful punishment.

44.The Wise Quran: And had We made it a foreign Quran, surely they would have said, 'If only its signs are detailed. Foreign and Arabic?' say, 'It is, for those who believe, a guidance and a healing. But those who do not believe, in their ears is dulness, and it is blindness to them; these are called to from a far place.'

45.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We gave Moses the Book, and it was disagreed about; but had it not been for your Lord's word already passed it would have been decided between them, and indeed they surely are in hesitating doubt of it.

46.The Wise Quran: Whoever does right then it is for his soul, and whoever does evil then it is against it, and your Lord is not unjust to His servants.

47.The Wise Quran: To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour: and no fruits come forth from their calyxes, and no female conceives, or is delivered, except with His knowledge. And the day He shall call to them, 'Where are My partners?' They shall say, 'We confess unto you there is no witness amongst us.'

48.The Wise Quran: And what they used to call on before shall go astray from them, and they shall think there is no escape for them.

49.The Wise Quran: Man does not tire of praying for the good, but if the evil touches him, then he is hopeless, despairing.

50.The Wise Quran: But if We make him taste mercy from Us after distress has touched him he will surely, definitely say, 'This is for me, and I do not think the Hour is coming; and surely if I am brought back to my Lord, indeed, I shall surely have the best with Him.' And We will surely, definitely inform those who disbelieved of what they did and We will surely, definitely make them taste harsh punishment.

51.The Wise Quran: And when We have been gracious to man, he turns away and goes aside; but when evil touches him he is one of copious prayer.

52.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you seen if it is from God and you disbelieve in it, who is more in error than he who is in remote schism?'

53.The Wise Quran: We shall show them Our signs in the regions and in themselves, until it is clear to them that it is the truth. And does your Lord not suffice that He is witness over all things?

54.The Wise Quran: Lo, indeed, they are in doubt about the meeting of their Lord. Lo, indeed, He encompasses everything.

1.The Wise Quran: Ha.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: 'Ayn.Sin.Qaf.

3.The Wise Quran: Thus God, the Mighty, the Wise, inspires you and those before you.

4.The Wise Quran: His is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and He is the High, the Great.

5.The Wise Quran: The heavens almost cleave asunder from above them; and the angels glorify with praise of their Lord, and ask forgiveness for those who are on the earth. Lo, indeed, God - He is the Forgiving, the Compassionate.

6.The Wise Quran: And those who take patrons besides Him, God is guardian over them, and you are not a trustee over them.

7.The Wise Quran: And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Quran, that you may warn the mother of the cities, and whoever is around it; and warn of the Day of Gathering, there is no doubt in it; a party in the Garden and a party in the blaze.

8.The Wise Quran: And if God had willed He would have made them one nation; but He makes whom He wills enter in His mercy; and the wrongdoers have neither patron nor helper.

9.The Wise Quran: Or do they take other patrons besides Him? And God, He is the patron, and He gives life to the dead, and He is powerful over everything.

10.The Wise Quran: And whatever thing you disagreed about, then the judgment of it is God's. That is God, my Lord. Upon Him I rely and to Him I repent.

11.The Wise Quran: Originator of the heavens and the earth, He has made for you from yourselves mates; and of the cattle mates; He creates you thereby. There is nothing like Him, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

12.The Wise Quran: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, He extends provision to whom He wills, and straitens. Indeed, He knows all things.

13.The Wise Quran: He has ordained for you of the religion what He instructed Noah with, and what We inspired you with, and what We instructed Abraham and Moses and Jesus with, - to be steadfast in religion, and not separate therein; a great thing to the idolaters is that which you call them to. God chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever repents.

14.The Wise Quran: And they did not separate except after the knowledge had come to them, through envy among themselves; and had it not been for a word already passed from your Lord to a named term, it would surely have been decided between them; but indeed, those who have been given the Book as an inheritance after them, are surely in hesitating doubt concerning it.

15.The Wise Quran: So to that then call, and go straight as you are commanded, and do not follow their lusts; and say, 'I believe in what God has sent down of the Book; and I am commanded to be just between you. God is our Lord and your Lord; we have our works and you have your works; there is no argument between us and you. God will assemble us together and to Him is the destination.'

16.The Wise Quran: But those who argue about God after He has been responded to, their arguments shall be rebutted before their Lord; and upon them is wrath, and for them is severe punishment.

17.The Wise Quran: God is the one who has sent down the Book with truth, and the balance; and what shall make you know? Perhaps the Hour is near.

18.The Wise Quran: Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it; and those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Lo, indeed, those who dispute concerning the Hour are certainly in far error.

19.The Wise Quran: God is subtle with His servants; He provides for whom He wills. And He is the Strong, the Mighty.

20.The Wise Quran: Whoever desires the tilth of the hereafter, We increase for him in his tilth; and whoever desires the tilth of the world, We give him of it: but in the hereafter he shall have no portion.

21.The Wise Quran: Or have they associates who have made lawful for them of the religion what God has not permitted? And if not for the word of decision, surely it would have been decided between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers, for them is painful punishment.

22.The Wise Quran: You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will befall them; and those who believe and do good works are in meadows of the gardens, they shall have what they please with their Lord; that, it is the great grace.

23.The Wise Quran: That is what God gives good news of to His servants who believe and do good works. Say, 'I do not ask for it a payment, except the love among the relatives.' And whoever gains a good deed, We increase good for him therein; indeed, God is forgiving, grateful.

24.The Wise Quran: Or do they say he has forged against God a lie? But if God wills He would set a seal upon your heart; but God blots out the falsehood and verifies the truth by His words; indeed, He knows what the breasts own.

25.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who accepts the repentance from His servants and pardons the evil deeds, and He knows what you do.

26.The Wise Quran: And He answers those who believe and do good works, and gives them increase of His grace; and the disbelievers, for them is severe punishment.

27.The Wise Quran: And if God extends the provision to His servants surely they would rebel in the earth. But He sends down by measure what He wills; indeed, of His servants He is aware, seeing.

28.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sends down the rain after they have despaired; and disperses His mercy, and He is the praiseworthy patron.

29.The Wise Quran: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and what He has dispersed in both of them of creatures; and He is able to gather them when He wills.

30.The Wise Quran: And whatever of misfortune befalls you it is for what your hands have earned; And He pardons much;

31.The Wise Quran: And you are not able to escape in the earth; and besides God you have no patron nor helper.

32.The Wise Quran: And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.

33.The Wise Quran: If He wills, He calms the wind, and they become motionless on its back; indeed, in that surely are signs for every patient, grateful one.

34.The Wise Quran: Or He makes them founder for what they have earned; and He pardons much.

35.The Wise Quran: And let those who dispute concerning Our signs know they have no escape.

36.The Wise Quran: And whatever thing you are given it is a provision of the worldly life; and what is with God is better and more lasting for those who believe and rely on their Lord,

37.The Wise Quran: And those who avoid the great of sins and immoralities, and when they are angry they forgive,

38.The Wise Quran: And those who respond to their Lord, and are steadfast in the prayer, and their affairs go by counsel amongst themselves, and from what We have provided them they spend,

39.The Wise Quran: And those who when wrong befalls them, they defend themselves.

40.The Wise Quran: And the recompense of evil is evil like it; and whoever pardons and does well, then his reward is on God; indeed, He does not love the wrongdoers.

41.The Wise Quran: And surely whoever defends himself after he has been wronged, for those, there is no way against them.

42.The Wise Quran: The way is only against those who wrong mankind and rebel in the earth without right; those, for them is painful punishment.

43.The Wise Quran: And surely whoever is patient and forgives, indeed, that is surely of the determination of affairs.

44.The Wise Quran: And whomsoever God leads astray, he has no patron after Him; and you shall see the wrongdoers when they see the punishment say, 'Is there any way to return?'

45.The Wise Quran: And you shall see them exposed to it humbled with abasement, looking with a secret glance. And those who believe shall say, 'Indeed, the losers are those who have lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection.' Lo, indeed, the wrongdoers are in lasting punishment.

46.The Wise Quran: And they shall have no patrons to help them besides God, and whomsoever God leads astray, there is no way for him.

47.The Wise Quran: Respond to your Lord before a day comes from God for which there is no averting; no refuge for you on that day; and for you there is no denial.

48.The Wise Quran: And if they turn away, then We have not sent you as a guardian over them, nothing is upon you except the communication. And indeed, when We have made man taste mercy from us he rejoices in it; but if there befall them an evil for what their hands have sent forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.

49.The Wise Quran: God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, He creates what He wills, He grants to whom He wills females, and He grants to whom He wills males,

50.The Wise Quran: Or He pairs them, males and females; and He makes whom He wills barren; indeed, He is knowing, powerful.

51.The Wise Quran: And it is not for any mortal that God should speak to Him, except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger and inspiring, with His permission, what He wills; indeed, He is high, wise.

52.The Wise Quran: And thus We have inspired to you a spirit of Our command; you did not know what the Book was, nor the faith; but We made it a light, We guide with it whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, you surely guide to a straight path,

53.The Wise Quran: The way of God, the one for whom is what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. Lo, to God the affairs tend.

40.The Wise Quran: Can you make the deaf to hear, or guide the blind, or him who is in clear error?

41.The Wise Quran: And whether We take you away, We will surely take vengeance on them;

42.The Wise Quran: Or We show you that which We have promised them; surely We have power over them.

43.The Wise Quran: So hold fast unto that which has been revealed to you; surely you are upon a straight path.

44.The Wise Quran: And surely it is a reminder to you and to your people; and soon you will be questioned.

45.The Wise Quran: And ask those whom We have sent before you amongst Our messengers: Did We make gods besides the Merciful for them to serve?

46.The Wise Quran: And certainly We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said, 'Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds;'

47.The Wise Quran: But when he came to them with Our signs, lo, they laughed at them.

48.The Wise Quran: And We did not show them a sign, but it was greater than its sister; and We seized them with the punishment, perhaps they may return.

49.The Wise Quran: And they said, 'O magician! Pray for us to your Lord, by the covenant He has made with you; indeed, we surely are guided.'

50.The Wise Quran: And when We removed from them the punishment, behold they broke their word.

51.The Wise Quran: And Pharaoh proclaimed amongst his people; he said, 'O my people! Is not the kingdom of Egypt mine? And these rivers that flow beneath me? Can you then not see?

52.The Wise Quran: Or am I better than this, the one who - he is contemptible, and can hardly explain himself?

53.The Wise Quran: So if only bracelets of gold were cast upon him, or the angels came with him, accompanying.'

54.The Wise Quran: And he taught his people levity; and they obeyed him; indeed, they were a disobedient people.

55.The Wise Quran: And when they angered Us, We took vengeance on them, and We drowned them all together,

56.The Wise Quran: And We made them a thing past, and a similitude to those after them.

57.The Wise Quran: And when the son of Mary was set forth as a similitude, behold your people turned away from it.

58.The Wise Quran: And they said, 'Are our gods better, or is he?' They did not set it forth to you except for argument. Nay, they are a contentious people.

59.The Wise Quran: He is only a servant whom We have been gracious to, and We have made him a similitude for the children of Israel.

60.The Wise Quran: And had We willed, surely We would have made among you angels in the earth to succeed.

61.The Wise Quran: And indeed, it is a knowledge for the Hour; so do not doubt concerning it, and follow Me. This is a straight way;

62.The Wise Quran: And let not the devil hinder you; indeed, He is to you a clear enemy.

63.The Wise Quran: And when Jesus came with the clear proofs, he said, 'I have come to you with wisdom, and that I make clear to you some of that concerning which you disagree; so fear God and obey me;

64.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God, He is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him, this is a straight path.'

65.The Wise Quran: Then the parties among them disagreed; and woe to those who did wrong from a punishment of a painful day.

66.The Wise Quran: Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?

67.The Wise Quran: Friends on that day shall be enemies to each other, except those who fear.

68.The Wise Quran: O my servants! There is no fear for you on the day; nor shall you grieve

69.The Wise Quran: Those who believed in Our signs, and were those who submit.

70.The Wise Quran: Enter into the Garden, you and your spouses, joyful.

71.The Wise Quran: Dishes of gold and cups shall be sent round to them; therein is what souls desire, and eyes shall be delighted, and you shall dwell therein forever;

72.The Wise Quran: And that is the Garden which you are given as an inheritance for what you used to do.

73.The Wise Quran: Much fruit for you in it; you will eat of it.

74.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the sinners are in the punishment of Hell to dwell forever.

75.The Wise Quran: It shall not be intermitted for them, and they therein shall be confused.

76.The Wise Quran: We wronged them not, but they were the wrongdoers.

77.The Wise Quran: And they shall call, 'O Malik! Let your Lord make an end of us.' He shall say, 'You will surely tarry.'

78.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly We have come to you with the truth, but most of you are averse to the truth.

79.The Wise Quran: Or have they arranged the affair? Then indeed We will arrange it too.

80.The Wise Quran: Or do they think that We did not hear their secrets and their secret discourse? Nay, but Our messengers are with them writing down.

81.The Wise Quran: Say, 'If the Merciful has a son then I am the first of the worshippers.'

82.The Wise Quran: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth. The Lord of the throne, above what they describe.

83.The Wise Quran: So leave them to plunge into vain discourse and play until they meet that day of theirs which they are promised.

84.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who is in the heaven a god and in the earth a god. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.

85.The Wise Quran: And blessed is He whose is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, and with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him shall you be brought back.

86.The Wise Quran: And those they call on besides Him shall not possess intercession except those who bear witness for the truth, and they know.

87.The Wise Quran: And surely if you ask them who created them they will surely, definitely say, 'God.' So how are they turned away?

88.The Wise Quran: And his saying, 'O Lord, indeed, these are a people who do not believe.'

89.The Wise Quran: So turn away from them and say, 'Peace.' Soon they will know.

1.The Wise Quran: Ha.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: By the clear Book.

3.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have sent it down in a blessed night; - indeed, We are warning -

4.The Wise Quran: Therein is decided every wise affair,

5.The Wise Quran: An order from Us. Indeed, We are sending -

6.The Wise Quran: A mercy from your Lord; indeed He is the Hearing, the Knowing:

7.The Wise Quran: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you are sure.

8.The Wise Quran: There is no god but He, He gives life and He gives death - your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

9.The Wise Quran: Nay, they are in doubt, playing.

10.The Wise Quran: But watch for a day when the heaven shall bring manifest smoke

11.The Wise Quran: To cover the people - this is a painful punishment.

12.The Wise Quran: 'Our Lord! Remove from us the punishment; indeed, We are believers.'

13.The Wise Quran: How can they have the reminder, when verily, they have had a clear messenger,

14.The Wise Quran: Then they turned away from him and said, 'One taught. A mad man.'

15.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We will remove the punishment a little, indeed, you return.

16.The Wise Quran: The day We will assault with the great assault, indeed, We will take vengeance.

17.The Wise Quran: And certainly before them We tried the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger:

18.The Wise Quran: 'Send back to me God's servants; indeed, I am to you a faithful messenger;'

19.The Wise Quran: And, 'Do not exalt yourselves above God; indeed, I come to you with clear authority.

20.The Wise Quran: And indeed, I seek refuge with my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.

21.The Wise Quran: And if you do not believe me then leave me alone.'

22.The Wise Quran: Then he called upon his Lord, 'Indeed, these are a sinful people.'

23.The Wise Quran: So journey with my servants by night - indeed, you are to be pursued.

24.The Wise Quran: And leave the sea at rest - indeed, they are an army to be drowned.

25.The Wise Quran: How many of gardens and springs did they leave,

26.The Wise Quran: And cornfields and noble places,

27.The Wise Quran: And ease and plenty in which they took delight.

28.The Wise Quran: Thus - and We made it an inheritance for another people.

29.The Wise Quran: And the heaven and the earth did not weep for them, nor were they respited.

30.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We saved the children of Israel from the shameful punishment. -

31.The Wise Quran: From Pharaoh; indeed, he was haughty, among the extravagant.

32.The Wise Quran: And surely, certainly We chose them upon knowledge over the worlds;

33.The Wise Quran: And We gave them of signs that in which was a clear trial.

34.The Wise Quran: Indeed these, surely they say,

35.The Wise Quran: 'There is nothing but our first death, and We will not be raised again.

36.The Wise Quran: So bring our fathers, if you are truthful.'

37.The Wise Quran: Are they better or the people of Tubba and those before them? We destroyed them - indeed, they were sinners.

38.The Wise Quran: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in play.

39.The Wise Quran: We created them not except with truth, but most of them do not know.

40.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the Day of Decision is their appointed time all together;

41.The Wise Quran: The day relation shall not avail relation anything, and they shall not be helped;

42.The Wise Quran: Except whomsoever God shall have mercy on; indeed, He is the Mighty, the Compassionate.

43.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the Zaqqum tree,

44.The Wise Quran: The food of the sinful:

45.The Wise Quran: Like molten brass, it shall boil in the bellies,

46.The Wise Quran: Like the boiling of hot water. -

47.The Wise Quran: 'Take him and drag him to the midst of Hell.

48.The Wise Quran: Then pour over his head the punishment of hot water.

49.The Wise Quran: Taste. Indeed, you are the mighty, the noble.

50.The Wise Quran: Indeed, this is what you disputed about.'

51.The Wise Quran: Indeed, the pious shall be in a safe place.

52.The Wise Quran: In gardens and springs,

53.The Wise Quran: They shall be clad in fine silk and brocade, face to face.

54.The Wise Quran: Thus. - And We will wed them to wide-eyed houris.

55.The Wise Quran: They shall call therein for every fruit in safety.

56.The Wise Quran: They shall not taste death therein except the first death, and He will keep them from the punishment of Hell.

57.The Wise Quran: Grace from your Lord, that - it is the great success.

59.The Wise Quran: So watch; indeed, they are watching.

1.The Wise Quran: Ha.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: A revelation of the Book from God, the Mighty, the Wise.

3.The Wise Quran: Indeed, in the heavens and the earth surely are signs for the believers;

4.The Wise Quran: And in your creation and what He dispersed of creature, are signs to a people who are sure;

5.The Wise Quran: And in the alternation of the night and the day, and what God sends down from the sky of provision and gives life thereby to the earth after its death, and in the veering of the winds are signs for a people who are intelligent.

6.The Wise Quran: Those are the signs of God We recite them to you in truth; and in what story after God and His signs will they believe?

7.The Wise Quran: Woe to every sinful liar

8.The Wise Quran: Who hears God's signs recited to him, then persists in pride as though he has not heard them - so give him the glad tidings of painful punishment -

9.The Wise Quran: And when he knows anything of Our signs, he takes it for a jest. Those, - for them is shameful punishment,

10.The Wise Quran: Behind them is Hell, and what they have earned shall not avail them anything, nor what they have taken besides God for patrons; and for them is great punishment.

11.The Wise Quran: This is a guidance. and those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord, for them is a punishment of a painful plague.

12.The Wise Quran: God is the one who subjects to you the sea that the ships may sail in it by His command, and that you may seek of His grace, and that perhaps you may give thanks.

13.The Wise Quran: And He has subjected to you what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, all together, from Him; indeed, in that surely are signs for a people who reflect.

14.The Wise Quran: Say to those who believe that they forgive those who hope not for God's days, that He may reward a people for what they used to earn.

15.The Wise Quran: Whoever did good works, then it is for his soul, and whoever did evil, then it is against it; then to your Lord you will be returned.

16.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We gave the children of Israel the Book and the judgment and the prophethood, and We provided them of good things, and We favoured them over the worlds.

17.The Wise Quran: And We gave them clear proofs of the affair, and they disagreed not except after the knowledge had come to them, through envy between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they were disagreeing.

18.The Wise Quran: Then We set you over a law concerning the affair: follow it, and do not follow the desires of those who do not know.

19.The Wise Quran: Indeed, they shall not avail you against God at all; and indeed, the wrongdoers, some of them are patrons of some; but God is the patron of those who fear.

20.The Wise Quran: This is an insight for mankind and a guidance and a mercy to a people who are sure.

21.The Wise Quran: Or do those who commit evil deeds think that We will make them like those who believe and do good works, equal in their life and their death? - Evil is what they judge.

22.The Wise Quran: And God created the heavens and the earth in truth; and that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged.

23.The Wise Quran: Have you considered him who takes his desire for his god, and God leads him astray upon knowledge, and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart, and has placed upon his sight a covering? Who then shall guide him after God? Then will you not remember?

24.The Wise Quran: And they say, 'It is only our worldly life, We die and we live, and nothing destroys us but time.' But they have no knowledge of that; they do not except guess.

25.The Wise Quran: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear proofs, their argument is not except that they say, 'Bring Our fathers, if you are truthful.'

26.The Wise Quran: Say, 'God gives you life, then makes you die, then He will gather you to the Day of Resurrection, there is no doubt in it; but most of mankind do not know.'

27.The Wise Quran: And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and the day the Hour will stand, on that day the vain-doers will lose.

28.The Wise Quran: And you shall see each nation kneeling, each nation summoned to its book, 'Today you are rewarded for what you used to do.'

29.The Wise Quran: This Our Book speaks to you with truth; indeed, We used to transcribe what you used to do.

30.The Wise Quran: Then as for those who believed and did good works, then their Lord will make them enter into His mercy; that - it is the clear success.

31.The Wise Quran: And as for those who disbelieved, - then were My signs not recited to you and you were proud and you were a sinful people?

32.The Wise Quran: And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of God is true, and the Hour there is no doubt therein;' You said, 'We do not know what the Hour is, we think not except guess, and we are not sure.'

33.The Wise Quran: And the evils of what they did will appear to them, and they will be encompassed by what they used to mock at.

34.The Wise Quran: And it shall be said, 'Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours, and your habitation is the fire, and you shall have no helpers.

35.The Wise Quran: That is because you took the signs of God for a jest and the worldly life deceived you.' So today they shall not be brought forth from it, nor will they be taken back into favour.

36.The Wise Quran: God's then is the praise, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the worlds.

37.The Wise Quran: And His is the greatness in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.The Wise Quran: Ha.Mim.

2.The Wise Quran: The revelation of the Book is from God the Mighty, the Wise.

3.The Wise Quran: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a named term; and those who disbelieve turn away from what they are warned of.

4.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you considered what you call on besides God? Show me what they have created of the earth; or have they share in the heavens? Bring me a book before this or a vestige of knowledge, if you are truthful.'

5.The Wise Quran: But who is more in error than he who calls besides God on who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection and who are heedless of their calling,

6.The Wise Quran: And when mankind are gathered together, shall be enemies to them, and shall deny their service.

7.The Wise Quran: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear proofs, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it comes to them, 'This is clear magic.'

8.The Wise Quran: Or do they say, 'He has forged it'? Say: 'If I have forged it you have no power to help me against God. He knows best what you utter concerning it; He suffices for a witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Compassionate.'

9.The Wise Quran: Say: 'I am not an innovation among the messengers, and I do not know what shall be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me; I am only a clear warner.'

10.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Have you considered, if it is from God and you have disbelieved in it, and a witness from the children of Israel testifies to the conformity of it, and he believes while you are proud?' Indeed, God does not guide the unjust people.

11.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, 'If it had been good, they would not have been before us in attaining it.' And when they are not guided by it, then they will say, 'This is an ancient lie.'

12.The Wise Quran: And before it was the Book of Moses, a model and a mercy; and this is a book confirming it in Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong and as good news for the good-doers.

13.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is God,' then go straight, there is no fear for them, and they will not grieve.

14.The Wise Quran: Those are the fellows of the Garden to dwell therein forever, a recompense for what they used to do.

15.The Wise Quran: And We have instructed man with his parents goodness. His mother bore him unwillingly and brought him forth unwillingly; and the bearing of him and the weaning of him is thirty months; until when he reaches his strength, and reaches forty years, he says, 'My Lord, enable me that I may be thankful for Your favour which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents; and that I may do good works which please You; and make it right for me in my offspring; indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of those who submit.'

16.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones from whom We accept the best of what they have done, and We overlook their evil deeds - amongst the fellows of the Garden; the promise of truth which they have been promised.

17.The Wise Quran: But he who says to his parents, 'Fie upon you both! Do you promise me that I shall be brought forth when generations have passed away before me?' And they both cry to God for help - 'Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of God is true.' Then he says, 'This is not except legends of the former people.'

18.The Wise Quran: Those are the ones against whom the sentence has proved true amongst the nations who have passed away before them of jinns and men; indeed, they were losers.

19.The Wise Quran: And for all are degrees of what they did, and that He may pay them in full their works, and they shall not be wronged.

20.The Wise Quran: And the day when those who disbelieve shall be exposed to the fire: 'You exhausted your good things in your worldly life, and you took your enjoyment in them; so today you shall be rewarded with the punishment of disgrace, because you were proud in the earth without the right, and because you were disobedient.'

21.The Wise Quran: And remember the brother of 'Ad when he warned his people in the sandy plains, - and indeed warners have passed away before him and after him, - 'Serve none but God; indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great day.'

22.The Wise Quran: They said, 'Have you come to us to turn us away from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful.

23.The Wise Quran: He said, 'Knowledge is only with God: and I convey to you that which I am sent with but I see you are a people who are ignorant.'

24.The Wise Quran: And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, 'This is a cloud to give us rain.' Nay, it is what you sought to hasten on - a wind in which is painful punishment,

25.The Wise Quran: Destroying everything by the command of its Lord. And in the morning nothing was seen except their dwellings, thus do We reward the sinful people.

26.The Wise Quran: And certainly, We had established them in what we have not established you, and We made for them hearing and eyesight and hearts; but their hearing, their eyesight and their hearts availed them nothing, since they denied the signs of God, and they were encompassed by what they mocked at.

27.The Wise Quran: And certainly We destroyed the cities that are around you: - and We turned about the signs that perhaps they might return.

28.The Wise Quran: Then why did not those help them, whom besides God they took for gods that could draw near to Him? Nay, they strayed away from them; and that was their lie and what they had forged.

29.The Wise Quran: And when We turned towards you a company of the jinn listening to the Quran, and when they were present at it, they said, 'Be silent.' and when it was over they turned back to their people, warning.

30.The Wise Quran: They said, 'O our people! Indeed, We have heard a book sent down after Moses, verifying what came before it, guiding to the truth, and unto the right way.

31.The Wise Quran: O our people! Respond to God's caller and believe in Him, He will pardon you your sins and will protect you from punishment.'

32.The Wise Quran: And whoever does not respond to God's caller then he shall not escape in the earth, and shall not have any patrons besides Him; those are in clear error.

33.The Wise Quran: Did they not see that God who created the heavens and the earth, and was not wearied with creating them, is able to give life to the dead? Nay, indeed, He is powerful over everything.

34.The Wise Quran: And the day when those who disbelieve shall be exposed to the fire, - 'Is this not the truth?' They shall say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He shall say, 'Then taste the punishment because you disbelieved.'

35.The Wise Quran: So be patient, as the possessors of determination among the messengers had patience; and do not seek to hasten for them. On the day they see what they are promised, as if they had not tarried except an hour of a day. A communication. And will any be destroyed but the disobedient people?

1.The Wise Quran: Those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of God, He made their works go astray.

2.The Wise Quran: And those who believed and did good works and believed in what is sent down upon Muhammad, - and it is the truth from their Lord, - He covered from them their evil deeds and He made right their condition.

3.The Wise Quran: That is because those who disbelieved followed falsehood and that those who believed followed the truth from their Lord. Thus God strikes their similitudes for mankind.

4.The Wise Quran: And when you meet those who disbelieve - then strike the necks until when you have massacred them, then bind fast the bonds. Then either a favour afterwards or ransom until the war lays down its burdens. That - And if God wills surely He would have exacted what is due from them - but to try some of you with others. And those who are slain in the way of God, He will not send their works astray;

5.The Wise Quran: He will guide them and make right their condition;

6.The Wise Quran: And will make them enter the Garden, which He has made known to them.

7.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! If you help God, He will help you, and will make firm your feet.

8.The Wise Quran: But those who disbelieve, destruction is for them. And He will send their works astray.

9.The Wise Quran: That is because they were averse to what God has revealed; so He has made their works void.

10.The Wise Quran: Have they not travelled in the land and seen how was the end of those before them? God destroyed them; and for the disbelievers are its similitudes.

11.The Wise Quran: That is because God is the sovereign of those who believe, and because the disbelievers - there is no sovereign for them.

12.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God will make those who believed and did good works enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow; and those who disbelieved they enjoy and eat as the cattle eat; and the fire is the habitation for them.

13.The Wise Quran: How many a city, stronger than your city which has driven you out, have We destroyed, and there was no helper for them.

14.The Wise Quran: Is he who is on a clear proof from his Lord like him, the evil of whose works is beautified for him, and who follow their lusts?

15.The Wise Quran: The similitude of the Garden which is promised to the pious, - in it are rivers of water without corruption, and rivers of milk, the taste of which does not change, and rivers of wine delicious to those who drink; and rivers of honey clarified; and therein for them of all fruits, and forgiveness from their Lord. Like him who dwells in the fire and are given to drink hot water so it tears their bowels asunder.

16.The Wise Quran: And among them are those who listen to you, until when they go forth from you they say to those who have been given the knowledge, 'What has he said just now?' Those are the ones on whose hearts God has set a stamp and they follow their lusts.

17.The Wise Quran: And those who are guided, He increases them in guidance, and He gives them their piety.

18.The Wise Quran: Do they wait but for the Hour, that it should come to them suddenly? And indeed, its conditions have come; then how, when it has come on them, can they have their reminder?

19.The Wise Quran: So know that there is no god except God; and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believers, men and women; and God knows your going to and fro, and your place of rest.

20.The Wise Quran: Those who believe say, 'Why has not a chapter been revealed?' But when a decisive chapter is revealed and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those in whose heart is sickness looking towards you - a look of one fainting from death. And more fit for them is

21.The Wise Quran: Obedience and a reasonable speech. And when the matter is determined, then if they were true to God, surely it would be better for them.

22.The Wise Quran: So would you perhaps, if you had turned away, work corruption in the earth and sever your blood relationships?

23.The Wise Quran: Those it is whom God has cursed, and has made them deaf, and has blinded their eyesight.

24.The Wise Quran: Then do they not meditate on the Quran? Or are there locks upon the hearts?

25.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who turn their backs after the guidance that has been manifested to them - the devil induces them, but He gives them respite.

26.The Wise Quran: That is because they say to those who are averse to what God has revealed, 'We will obey you in part of the affair.' But God knows their secrets.

27.The Wise Quran: Then how when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?

28.The Wise Quran: That is because they followed what displeased God and were averse to His pleasure; so He has made their works void.

29.The Wise Quran: Or do those in whose hearts is sickness think that God will not bring forth their malice?

30.The Wise Quran: And had We willed, surely We would have shown them to you, and surely you would know them by their marks. And surely you will definitely know them by the intent of speech, and God knows your works.

31.The Wise Quran: And surely We will definitely try you until We know those among you who strive hard and the patient; and We will try your news.

32.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of God, and split from the messenger after the guidance has been manifested to them, will not harm God at all, and He will make their works void.

33.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Obey God, and obey the messenger; and do not make your works vain.

34.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of God, then they die while they are disbelievers, God will not forgive them.

35.The Wise Quran: So do not faint and cry for peace while you have the upperhand; and God is with you, and will not cheat you of your works.

36.The Wise Quran: The worldly life is only play and diversion; and if you believe and fear, He will give you your rewards, and not ask you for your wealth.

37.The Wise Quran: If He were to ask you for it and to press you, you would be niggardly, and He would bring your malice out.

38.The Wise Quran: Here you are, these called upon to spend in God's way, and among you are some who are niggardly; and whoever is niggardly is only niggardly against his soul; but God is rich and you are needy, and if you turn away, He will substitute another people instead of you, then they will not be your similitudes.

1.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have given you a clear victory.

2.The Wise Quran: That God may forgive you of your sin that which is past and that which is to come, and may fulfil His favour upon you, and guide you, a straight way,

3.The Wise Quran: And that God may help you with a mighty help.

4.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sent down the tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they might add faith to their faith; - and God's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and God is knowing, wise -

5.The Wise Quran: To make the believers, men and women, enter into gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein; and to cover from them their evil deeds; that is in God's sight a great success;

6.The Wise Quran: And to punish the hypocrites, men and women, who think evil thoughts of God; upon them is a turn of evil fortune, and God's wrath is upon them and He has cursed them, and has prepared for them Hell, and evil is the destination.

7.The Wise Quran: God's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and God is mighty, wise.

8.The Wise Quran: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness, and a bearer of good news, and a warner; -

9.The Wise Quran: That you may believe in God and His messenger, and may aid Him and revere Him and glorify Him morning (Dawn to sunrise) and evening (Mid-afternoon to sunset).

10.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who swear allegiance to you, swear allegiance only to God; - God's hand is above their hands. So he who breaks his word breaks it only against himself; and He who fulfils what he has covenanted with God, soon He will give him a great reward.

11.The Wise Quran: Those of the desert Arabs who were left behind will soon say to you, 'Our wealth and our families occupied us; so ask forgiveness for us.' - They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, 'Then who can control for you anything from God, if He wishes you harm or wishes you profit?' Nay, God is aware of what you do.

12.The Wise Quran: Nay, you thought that the messenger and the believers would not return to their families ever; and that was beautified in your hearts. And you thought thought of evil, and you were a corrupt people.

13.The Wise Quran: And whoever does not believe in God and His messengers - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a blaze.

14.The Wise Quran: And God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and punishes whom He wills; and God is forgiving, compassionate.

15.The Wise Quran: Those who were left behind shall say when you set out towards spoils to take it, 'Let us follow you.' They wish to change God's words. Say, 'You shall not follow us; thus did God say before.' Then they will say, 'Nay, you envy us.' Nay, they do not understand except a little.

16.The Wise Quran: Say to the desert Arabs who were left behind, 'You shall be called out to a people, possessors of strong valour, you shall fight them or they shall submit. And if you obey, God will give you a good reward; but if you turn your backs, as you turned your backs before, He will punish you with painful punishment.'

17.The Wise Quran: There is no straitness on the blind, and no straitness on the lame, and no straitness on the sick. And whoever obeys God and His messenger, He will make him enter gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns his back He will punish with painful punishment.

18.The Wise Quran: Certainly God was pleased with the believers when they swore allegiance to you beneath the tree; and He knew what was in their hearts, and He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with a near victory,

19.The Wise Quran: And many spoils which they will take; and God is mighty, wise.

20.The Wise Quran: God promised you many spoils that you will take and He has hastened this on for you, and has restrained men's hands from you; and that it may be a sign for the believers and to guide you, a straight way;

21.The Wise Quran: And others, you had no power over them; certainly God encompassed them; and ever is God powerful over all things.

22.The Wise Quran: And if those who disbelieved had fought you, surely they would have turned their backs; then they would have found neither patron nor helper. -

23.The Wise Quran: God's course which has been followed before, and you shall find no change in the course of God.

24.The Wise Quran: And He is the one who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca after He had given you victory over them; and God sees what you do.

25.The Wise Quran: They are the ones who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque, and the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice; and had it not been for believing men and believing women whom you did not know, that you might have trampled on, then a crime might have befallen you from them without knowledge - that God may make whomever He wills enter into His mercy. If they had been distinct from one another, surely We would have punished those of them who disbelieved with painful punishment.

26.The Wise Quran: When those who disbelieved put in their hearts disdain, the disdain of ignorance - then God sent down His tranquillity upon His messenger and upon the believers, and obliged them to keep to the word of piety, and they were most worthy of it and most suited for it; and God knows all things.

27.The Wise Quran: Surely, Certainly God verified for His messenger the vision in truth. You shall indeed enter the sacred Mosque, if God wills, in safety having shaved your heads and shortened, not fearing; and He knows what you do not know, and He has made besides that, a near victory.

28.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sent His messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to set it above all the religions; and God sufficed for a witness.

29.The Wise Quran: Muhammad is the messenger of God, and those who are with Him are hard against the disbelievers, - compassionate amongst themselves; you may see them bowing down, prostrating, seeking grace from God and pleasure, - their marks are in their faces from the effects of prostration; - that is their similitude in the Torah. And their similitude in the Gospel is as a seedling puts forth its sprouts and strengthens it, and grows stout, and straightens itself upon its stem, delighting the sower. - that He may enrage the disbelievers with them; - God has promised those of them who believe and do good works forgiveness and a great reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not anticipate God and His messenger and fear God. Indeed God is hearing, knowing.

2.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, and do not speak loud to him as you speak loud to one another, lest your works become void, while you are not aware.

3.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the messenger of God, they are those whose hearts God has tried for piety, for them is forgiveness and a great reward.

4.The Wise Quran: Indeed, those who call you from behind the inner chambers, most of them are not intelligent;

5.The Wise Quran: And if they had been patient until you came out to them, certainly it would be better for them. And God is forgiving, compassionate.

6.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! If a disobedient one comes to you with information, verify it, lest you harm a people in ignorance, then you awake repenting over what you have done.

7.The Wise Quran: And know that among you is the messenger of God; if he should obey you in many a matter, surely you would commit sin; but God has made faith beloved by you and beautified it in your hearts, and has made disbelief and disobedience and rebellion hateful to you. Those they are the rightly directed.

8.The Wise Quran: Grace from God and favour. And God is knowing, wise.

9.The Wise Quran: And if two parties of the believers quarrel, then make peace between both of them; then if one of them outrages the other, then fight the party that has committed the outrage until it returns to God's commandment; then if it returns, then make peace between them with equity, and be just: indeed, God loves the just.

10.The Wise Quran: The believers are only brothers, so make peace between your two brothers, and fear God; perhaps you may obtain mercy.

11.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Let not one class ridicule another, perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule other women, perhaps they may be better than them; and do not defame each other nor call each other bad names - evil is the name, disobedience after faith. And whoever does not repent, then those they are the wrongdoers.

12.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Avoid much of conjecture; indeed, some conjecture is sin. And do not spy, nor backbite each other; would one of you like to eat his dead brother's flesh? You would abhor it. And fear God; indeed, God is relenting, compassionate.

13.The Wise Quran: O mankind! Indeed, We have created you of male and female, and made you races and tribes that you may know each other. Indeed, the most noble of you with God is the one who fears most of you; indeed, God is knowing, aware.

14.The Wise Quran: The desert Arabs say, 'We believe.' Say, 'You do not believe; but say, "We have submitted."' For the faith has not entered into your hearts; but if you obey God and His messenger, He will not defraud you anything of your works; indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

15.The Wise Quran: The believers are only those who believe in God and His messenger, then do not doubt, and strive with their wealth and souls in the way of God. Those they are the truthful.

16.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Will you teach God your religion, and God knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth? And God knows all things.'

17.The Wise Quran: They count a favour upon you that they have submitted. Say, 'Do not count your submission a favour upon me; nay, God confers a favour upon you that He guided you to the faith, if you were truthful.'

18.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God knows the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and God sees what you do.
