If you go forth striving in My way and seeking My pleasure, you conceal love to them; and I know best what you hid and what you published; and whoever does it among you, then certainly, he has gone astray from the right direction of the way.

2.The Wise Quran: If they find you they would be enemies to you, and they will extend to you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wished if you would disbelieve.

3.The Wise Quran: Your blood relationships and your children will not profit you on the Day of Resurrection. He will decide between you. And God sees what you do.

4.The Wise Quran: Certainly, there was for you a good example in Abraham and those who were with him, when they said to their people, 'Indeed, we are free of you and of what you serve besides God. We have disbelieved in you: and enmity and hatred has appeared between us and you forever, until you believe in God alone.' Except the speech of Abraham to his father, 'Surely, I will definitely seek forgiveness for you, and I do not have power of anything for you from God.' Our Lord! On You We have relied and to You we have repented and to You is the destination.

5.The Wise Quran: Our Lord! Do not make us a trial for those who disbelieved; and forgive us, our Lord! Indeed You, You are the Mighty, the Wise.

6.The Wise Quran: Surely, certainly, there was for you in them a good example for he who hopes for God and the Last Day. And whoever turns away, then indeed, God, He is the Rich, the Praiseworthy.

7.The Wise Quran: It may be that God will make love between you and those among them with whom you are at enmity. And God is powerful, and God is forgiving, compassionate.

8.The Wise Quran: God does not forbid you from those who have not fought you in the religion and have not driven you out of your homes, that you be righteous to them and just to them; indeed, God loves the just.

9.The Wise Quran: God only forbids you from those who fought you in the religion and drove you out from your homes and assisted in your expulsion, that you make them patrons; and whoever makes them patrons, then those, they are the wrongdoers.

10.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When the believing women, emigrants, come to you, then try them; God knows best their faith. Then if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful for them, and they are not lawful for them; and give them what they have spent, and there is no crime against you that you marry them, when you have given them their payment. And do not hold on to the marriage ties of disbelieving women; and ask for what you have spent, and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgment of God; He judges between you; and God is knowing, wise.

11.The Wise Quran: And if anything of your spouses escapes you to the disbelievers, then your turn comes, then give those whose spouses have gone the like of what they spent. And fear God, the one in whom you believe.

12.The Wise Quran: O prophet! When the believing women come to you, they engage with you on condition that they will not associate anything with God, and they will not steal, and they will not commit fornication, and they will not kill their children, and they will not come with slander which they forge between their hands and feet, and they will not rebel against you in kindness, then engage with them and seek God's forgiveness for them; indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

13.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Do not take for patrons a people with whom God is angry; Certainly, they have despaired of the hereafter, as the disbelievers have despaired of the fellows of the graves.

1.The Wise Quran: What is in the heavens and what is in the earth gave glory to God; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

2.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! For what do you say what you do not do?

3.The Wise Quran: It is greatly hateful with God that you say what you do not do.

4.The Wise Quran: Indeed, God loves those who fight in His way in ranks as if they were a compact building.

5.The Wise Quran: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people! For what do you hurt me? And certainly you know that I am the messenger of God to you.' Then when they deviated, God made their hearts deviate; and God does not guide the disobedient people.

6.The Wise Quran: And when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, 'O children of Israel! Indeed, I am the messenger of God to you, a verifier for what is before me of the Torah and a herald of glad tidings of a messenger coming after me. His name is Ahmad.' Then when he came to them with the clear proofs, they said, 'This is clear magic.'

7.The Wise Quran: And who is more wrong than he who forges the lie against God, and he is called to the submission? And God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

8.The Wise Quran: They desire to extinguish the light of God with their mouths; and God will perfect His light, even though the disbelievers are averse.

9.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over the religion all of it, even though the idolaters are averse.

10.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Shall I direct you to a merchandise? It will save you from painful punishment.

11.The Wise Quran: Believe in God and His messenger, and strive in the way of God with your wealth and your souls. That is better for you if you know.

12.The Wise Quran: He will forgive you your sins, and He will make you enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow, and good dwellings in gardens of Eden. That is the great success.

13.The Wise Quran: And another, you will love it, - help from God and near victory. And give glad tidings to the believers.

14.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Be the helpers of God, as Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, 'Who are my helpers to God?' The disciples said, 'We are the helpers of God.' And a party of the children of Israel believed and a party disbelieved. And We strengthened those who believed against their enemy; and they became winners.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.The Wise Quran: What is in the heavens and what is in the earth gives glory to God, the King, the Holy, the Mighty, the Wise.

2.The Wise Quran: He is the one who sent among the Gentiles a messenger from them reciting to them His signs and purifying them and teaching them the Book and the wisdom, and indeed, they were before surely in clear error,

3.The Wise Quran: And others of them, when they join them; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

4.The Wise Quran: That is the grace of God, He gives it to whom He wills; and God is the possessor of great grace.

5.The Wise Quran: The similitude of those who were made to bear the Torah then bore it not is like the similitude of the ass bearing books. Evil is the similitude of the people, those who say the signs of God are lies. And God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

6.The Wise Quran: Say, 'O those who became Jews! If you claim that you are patrons for God besides mankind, then wish for death, if you are truthful.'

7.The Wise Quran: And they will not wish for it ever, for what their hands have sent forward. And God knows the wrongdoers.

8.The Wise Quran: Say, 'Indeed, the death from which you flee, so indeed, it will meet you; then you will be sent back to the knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'

9.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! When the call is made for the prayer on the Day of Congregation, then go quickly to the remembrance of God and leave trade. That is better for you, if you know.

10.The Wise Quran: Then when the prayer is finished, then disperse in the land and seek of the grace of God and remember God much; perhaps you may prosper.

11.The Wise Quran: And when they see merchandise or diversion they disperse to it and leave you standing. Say, 'What is with God is better than the diversion and than the merchandise. And God is the best of providers.'

1.The Wise Quran: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, 'We bear witness, indeed you are surely the messenger of God.' And God knows, indeed you are surely His messenger; and God bears witness, indeed the hypocrites are surely liars.

2.The Wise Quran: They took their oaths as a covering, then they hindered from the way of God. Indeed they, evil is what they used to do.

3.The Wise Quran: That is because they, they believed, then they disbelieved, so a seal has been set on their hearts, so they do not understand.

4.The Wise Quran: And when you see them, their bodies please you; and if they speak, you hear their speech as if they were pieces of wood propped up; they think every noise is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. God fight them. How are they turned away?

5.The Wise Quran: And when it is said to them, 'Come, the messenger of God will seek forgiveness for you.' They turn their heads, and you see them, they turn away and they are proud.

6.The Wise Quran: Equal on them whether you seek forgiveness for them or you do not seek forgiveness for them. God will not forgive them; indeed, God does not guide the disobedient people.

7.The Wise Quran: They are the ones who say, 'You should not spend on whoever is with the messenger of God until they disperse.' And for God are the treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the hypocrites do not understand.

8.The Wise Quran: They say, 'Surely, if we return to Al Madinah, the mightier will surely, definitely drive out the weaker from it. And for God is the might and for His messenger and for the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

9.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Let not your wealth nor your children divert you from the remembrance of God. And whoever does that, then those, they are the losers.

10.The Wise Quran: And spend from what We have provided you before death comes upon one of you and he says, 'My Lord! If only You would defer me to a near term, then I would give charity and be among the righteous.'

11.The Wise Quran: And God will not defer a soul when its term has come; and God is aware of what you do.

1.The Wise Quran: What is in the heavens and what is in the earth gives glory to God; His is the kingdom, and His is the praise, and He is powerful over all things.

2.The Wise Quran: He is the one who created you; and among you is a disbeliever and among you is a believer. And God sees what you do.

3.The Wise Quran: He created the heavens and the earth with truth; and He fashioned you and made good your forms; and to Him is the destination.

4.The Wise Quran: He knows what is in the heavens and the earth; and He knows what you conceal and what you publish; and God knows what the breasts own.

5.The Wise Quran: Has the information of those who disbelieved before not come to you? So they tasted the evil result of their affair, and for them is painful punishment.

6.The Wise Quran: That is because their messengers used to come to them with the clear proofs, and they said, 'Shall mortals guide us?' And they disbelieved and turned away. And God was free of need; and God is rich, praiseworthy.

7.The Wise Quran: Those who disbelieved claimed that they will not be raised. Say, 'Yes, by my Lord, you will surely, definitely be raised, then you will surely, definitely be informed of what you did; and that is easy for God.'

8.The Wise Quran: So believe in God and His messenger and the light which We have sent down; and God is aware of what you do.

9.The Wise Quran: On the day He will gather you to the Day of Gathering, that is the Day of Mutual Cheating. And whoever believes in God and does good works, He will cover from him his evil deeds, and He will make him enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow, to dwell in it for ever, for ever. That is the great success.

10.The Wise Quran: And those who disbelieved and said Our signs are lies, those are the fellows of the fire, to dwell in it for ever. And evil is the destination.

11.The Wise Quran: No calamity befell but with the permission of God. And whoever believes in God, He guides his heart. And God knows all things.

12.The Wise Quran: So obey God and obey the messenger: and if you turn away, then only upon Our messenger is the clear communication.

13.The Wise Quran: God, there is no god but He; and upon God then let the believers rely.

14.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Indeed, among your spouses and your children is an enemy for you, so beware of them. And if you pardon, and overlook and forgive, then indeed, God is forgiving, compassionate.

15.The Wise Quran: Your wealth and your children are only a trial; and God, with Him is a great reward.

16.The Wise Quran: So fear God what you are able and hear and obey and spend; better for your souls. And whoever is guarded from the covetousness of his soul, then those, they are the prosperous.

17.The Wise Quran: If you lend to God a good loan, He will double it for you, and will forgive you; and God is grateful, clement.

18.The Wise Quran: The knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Wise.

1.The Wise Quran: O prophet! When you divorce women, then divorce them for their waiting period, and calculate the waiting period, and fear God your Lord. You should not drive them out of their houses, and they should not go out except that they commit manifest immorality. And those are the limits of God, and whoever transgresses the limits of God, then certainly, he has wronged himself. You do not know, perhaps God will originate after that a matter.

2.The Wise Quran: Then when they have reached their term, then retain them with kindness or separate from them with kindness; and call to witness two possessors of justice among you, and make the testimony upright for God. That, whoever believes in God and the Last Day is admonished with it. And whoever fears God, He will make for him a way out,

3.The Wise Quran: And He will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies on God, then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, God attains His purpose; Certainly, God has made a measure for all things.

4.The Wise Quran: And those of your women who have despaired of the menstruation, if you doubt, then their waiting period is three months, and those who do not menstruate. And those who are pregnant, their term is that they lay down their load. And whoever fears God, He will make for him of his affair ease.

5.The Wise Quran: That is the command of God, He has sent it down to you. And whoever fears God He will cover from him his evil deeds and He will make great for him reward.

6.The Wise Quran: Lodge them where you dwell, from your means, and do not harm them to straiten them. And if they are those who are pregnant, then spend on them until they lay down their load; then if they suckle for you, then give them their payment, and consult between yourselves with kindness; and if you disagree, then soon another will suckle for him.

7.The Wise Quran: Let the owner of ample means spend from his ample means and let him whose provision is straitened spend from what God has given him; God does not task a soul except what He has given it; soon God will make after difficulty ease.

8.The Wise Quran: And how many a town was averse to the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We called it to account, a severe account; and We punished it, a terrible punishment.

9.The Wise Quran: So it tasted the evil result of its affair; and the end of its affair was loss.

10.The Wise Quran: God has prepared severe punishment for them. So fear God, O possessors of understanding, those who believed! Certainly, God has sent down to you a reminder;

11.The Wise Quran: A messenger reciting to you the clear signs of God; that He may bring out those who believed and did good works from the darkness to the light. And whoever believes in God and does good works, He will make him enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow, to dwell in it for ever, ever. Certainly, God has made good provision for him.

12.The Wise Quran: God is the one who created seven heavens and of the earth, like them. The command descends between them that you may know that God is powerful over all things and that God, certainly He has surrounded all things in knowledge.

2.The Wise Quran: Certainly, God has allowed you the expiation of your oaths. And God is your sovereign and He is the Knowing, the Wise.

3.The Wise Quran: And when the prophet told information secretly to some of his wives, and when she gave information of it, and God made it apparent to him, he made known some of it and turned away from some. And when he informed her of it, she said, 'Who told you this?' He said, 'The Knowing, the Aware informed me.'

5.The Wise Quran: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorces you, will give him in exchange wives better than you: women who submit, who believe, who are obedient, who repent, who worship, who fast - previously married and virgins.

6.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Guard yourselves and your families from a fire; its fuel is mankind and stones; over it are angels harsh, strong; they do not rebel against God in what He commanded them, and they do what they are commanded.

7.The Wise Quran: O those who disbelieved! Do not make excuses today. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.

8.The Wise Quran: O those who believed! Repent to God, sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will cover from you your evil deeds and make you enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow, on the day God will not disgrace the prophet and those who believed with him. Their light runs before them and on their right. They say, 'Our Lord! Perfect for us our light and forgive us; indeed, You are powerful over all things.'

9.The Wise Quran: O prophet! Strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them; and their abode is Hell, and evil is the destination.

10.The Wise Quran: God has struck a similitude for those who disbelieved - the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot; they were under two righteous servants among Our servants, and they were treacherous to them. So they availed them nothing against God. And it was said, 'Enter the fire with those who enter.'

11.The Wise Quran: And God has struck a similitude for those who believe - the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, 'My Lord! Build for me a house near You in the Garden, and save me from Pharaoh and his work, and save me from the wrongdoing people.'

12.The Wise Quran: And Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her private parts, then We blew into it of Our spirit and she verified the words of her Lord and His Books, and she was of the obedient.
